Job Responsibilities

Partnering with internal and external business users, as well as with our technology team, the selected candidate will enable the business to run smoothly by assisting with various tasks such as maintaining existing processes, controls and reports; acting as a subject matter expert on core business systems and processes; and owning the transformation of the organization through targeted improvements in process and technology with limited supervision.

Specific Responsibilities

Act as a senior liaison to the business to surface issues and resolve challenging problems, as needed.
Lead the identification of strategic needs to assist with business transformation to include understanding the need, documenting the process and offering efficient solutions that result in annual savings to the company.
Lead small projects, fund launches and liquidations, workflow improvement and preparation of key deliverables.
Act as an analyst or subject matter expert on corporate initiatives.
Establish yourself as an application POC in at least one core business system.
Facilitate communications with internal audit, risk and compliance teams, clients, and/or key third party vendors.
Create new and maintain existing processes and reports that contain complex formulas and/or macros that will be used within business units to support everyday business functions.
Extract and manipulate data as part of business analysis and operational reporting.
Act as a subject matter expert in at least one key business application or support process (vendor management, risk management, etc.)
Assist with the onboarding of new clients.
Act as a mentor within the team for more junior/less tenured staff members and help to develop and expand our corporate culture.

Job Title: Junior Business Development Analyst

Job Code: 16321613

Job Location: Lexington Park, Maryland

Position Description: Imagine One is seeking a Junior Business Development Analyst to provide direct support to our Corporate Business Development Team. Range of support will include conducting business intelligence and opportunity research; updating and maintaining required business development records, spreadsheets, and pipeline; responsible for monthly, quarterly and annual business development metrics and tracking system for division(s); assisting the Business Units and Capture Managers in facilitating communication with external teaming partners during the capture and Bid & Proposal phases; and assisting with ongoing capture efforts. Additionally, the Analyst will conduct research and gather market information on potential clients and competitors to identify opportunities that align with the business development strategy. Candidate also may attend conferences/events and assist the business development team with customer meetings. Provides input to market strategies, and research. Participates in special projects as required, and performs other duties as assigned.
Key responsibilities include the following:
Attend and participate in weekly BD meetings and/or teleconferences with corporate and other regions.
Record and track status on action items from weekly meetings
Update internal pipeline daily (must have experience with SharePoint); Monitor daily updates from government (Seaport-NxG, GovWin, Sam.Gov)
Provide pipeline reports and provide pipeline metrics to Senior BD staff (Must have experience with Sharepoint and Excel).
Prepare monthly business development reports (must have experience with MS Word)
Conduct general market research, background research and competitor analysis using BD tools (GovWin, e-buy, e-commerce, FPDS, Sam.Gov, and other tools)
Leverage internal, external team, public, and personal resources and contacts for customer and competitive intelligence.
Assist with identifying and qualifying new opportunities aligned with Corporate strategic direction to meet Business Unit business plan objectives.
Performs detailed research and analysis of use of various search engines to identify new opportunities, new markets and customers within our strategic plan.
Provide bi-weekly new opportunity identification report and review with Senior BD staff.
Support Senior BD staff and Capture Mangers in the development of gate reviews during the different phases of Captures. (Must have experience with SharePoint)
Support Proposal Managers in proposal development planning as needed.
Support recruiting activities as needed.
Support Request for Information (RFI) and Sources Sought development for a potential business proposal and engage internal resources as needed for input/review.
Ensure designated Business Unit BD pipeline status information is accurately reflected in up-channel reporting systems.
Collaborate with Partner Companies when requested by Senior BD team / capture managers
Construct gap analysis templates (must have experience with Microsoft Word and Excel)
Assist with information needed for Non-Disclosure Agreements and Teaming Agreements

Experience Requirements: Candidate must have experience using the Microsoft Tool Suite to include but not limited to Microsoft Teams, Word, Excel, SharePoint, PowerPoint and Adobe. Candidate must demonstrate a high degree of integrity, decisiveness, and commitment to the growth and success of the company. Candidate must be willing and able to work extended hours and travel as necessary.

Educational Requirements
Associates or Bachelor’s degree preferred.

Security Requirements
Must be eligible to obtain U.S. Government clearance and be U.S. citizen; U.S. Citizenship required

Who you are:

As a Business Analyst in Health Services for Johns Hopkins Health Plans, you will perform audit analysis and review of processes and work flows within our clinical teams in addition to implementing new processes and creating efficiencies within the end product delivery. You are detail-oriented and able to maintain focus while working with large sets of data. You have the ability resolve issues quickly, make decisions and institute change when appropriate.

This is a hybrid role requiring you to work in the Hanover, MD office 1 day per week (Wednesdays).

What you’ll do:

Analyze complex business problems and issue using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers.
Identify and interpret trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences.
Construct forecasts, recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.
Create specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements.
Collaborate with clients to modify or tailor existing analysis or reports to meet their specific needs.
Participate in management reviews, including presenting and interpreting analysis results, summarizing conclusions, and recommending a course of action.
Work directly with internal service providers within IT and the Analytics Center of Excellence regarding complex data reporting and analytics needs.

What you’ll bring:

3+ years’ experience in a managed care environment
Experience with healthcare reporting specifically in medical management-UM and CM reporting and data for health plans preferred.
Experience with clinical health care data
Business and/or Data analyst experience in healthcare, specifically Managed Care
Ability to run and/or write reports and give a thorough analysis of the data

Who we are:

Johns Hopkins Health Plans (JHHP) is the managed care and health services business of Johns Hopkins Medicine. JHHP is a $3B business serving over 500,000 active members with lines of business in Medicaid, Medicare, commercial, military health, health solutions, and venture investments. JHHP is a leader in provider-sponsored health plans and is poised for future growth.

Many organizations talk about transforming the future of healthcare, at Johns Hopkins Health Plans, we are setting the pace for change within the healthcare industry. We develop innovative, analytics-driven health programs in collaboration with provider partners to drive improved quality and better health outcomes for our members and the communities we serve. If you are interested in improving how healthcare is delivered, and have a passion to be at the forefront of change, JHHP is the place to call home.

This is a hybrid role. The office is located in Hanover, Maryland.

Johns Hopkins Health System and its affiliates are drug-free workplace employers.

Job Description:


Fibertek is a leading developer of laser and electro-optic systems for the aerospace community, with key contributions to lasers for atmospheric sensing, laser communications, and lidar sensors for NASA, DoD, and commercial customers. We are looking for a highly motivated individual to join our division onsite at the Aberdeen Proving Ground in Aberdeen, MD.

Job Duties:
This position is required to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment supporting the Support Operations & Partnership Team, in strategic engagements, strategic documents/communication, technology transfer, and international efforts. Assists in coordination, and execution of strategic documents, strategic engagements, strategic planning/communication, to meet the Team and Directors strategic intent.

Develop Strategic Documents, such Standard Operating Procedures, engagement agendas, read ahead, top level roll ups, metrics, and regulatory policies (i.e., 10-1).

Strategic Planning/Communication such as develop, recommend, and coordinate strategic plans for the Director and Senior Leadership. Facilitate and coordinate senior leaders and international engagements. Assist in the development of unified and cohesive strategic plans and documents by collaborating across the Army’s (DEVCOM & DAC) analytical community.

Assist in planning, coordination, and execution of Senior Leader Engagements on behalf of the DAC Director, which will consist of communicate with technical and staff leads to execute a consolidated and holistic event, to meet the senior leader's strategic intent. Examples include the facilities/lab tours and demonstrations, international exchanges, town halls, monthly Director addresses and Off-Sites.

Effectively communicate to leaders in DAC and DEVCOM through briefings, presentations, information papers, and the development of taskers.

Assist in tracking and development of Technology Transfer agreements.

Assist in tracking and development of International Agreements.

Assist in furthering the DAC Technology Transfer processes.





Expertise and experience required:

BA/BS degree desired

Proactively demonstrates initiative, motivation, and drive; thrives in ambiguous, fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Proven organizational skills, including time management.

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

Knowledge of functional staff, roles, and structure

Experience in conducting mission analysis and prioritization.

Possess the ability to multi-task with minimal guidance.

Experience providing risk analysis and information to support senior leader decision making.

Ability to manage short notice suspenses of tasks, prioritize, and multi-task to allow for quick turnarounds while remaining future-focused.

Self-sufficiency: the ability to work with minimal supervision after guidance is given

Average or above average verbal and written skills

Attention to detail.

Development of strategic documents and process

Development of Standard Operating Procedures

Assisting in the planning and execution of Senior Leader Engagements

Strategic thinker

Work proficiently with a team.

US Citizenship is mandatory

Bonus Areas:

Prior military experience highly desired, Retired Field-Grade Officer with a Master’s Degree from an accredited college or university in technical or defense-related disciplines; completion of Command and General Staff College is a plus.

Company Overview

Every firm has a culture – the values, beliefs, methodology, attitudes and standards that reflect an organization’s DNA. But the truly inspiring firms – the game-changers, the industry leaders and the disruptors – have cultures that propel them to innovate and stand out. At Brown Advisory, we aim to be one of those inspired firms. Over the years, we have purposefully built and nurtured our client-first culture.
Brown Advisory is an independent investment management and strategic advisory firm committed to delivering a combination of first-class performance, strategic advice and the highest level of client service with offices in Austin, Baltimore, Boston, Delaware, Frankfurt, London, New York, North Carolina, San Francisco, Singapore, Southern California, Virginia and Washington, D.C. The firm’s institutional and private clients are based in 50 states and more than 44 countries and territories and are served by over 800 colleagues worldwide, all of whom are equity owners of the firm.
Position Summary
The Client Onboarding Analyst will provide centralized support to members of the Private Client and Institutional client teams across multiple office locations through the facilitation of all aspects of the account opening process for new and existing clients of the Firm.
The primary duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Support and facilitate all aspects of the account opening process for all clients in the Institutional and Private Client businesses.
Communicate in a timely manner with internal Client Service and Relationship Managers to acquire necessary client KYC documentation for account opening.
Manage inbound queue of ticket requests within internal task management system to ensure timely execution of tasks. Adhere to established SLAs and goals.
Manage workflow through multiple systems and applications to meet evolving business demands.
Partner with external partners to open custodial accounts, , process daily account maintenance and administration requests and complete any due diligence related audits and reports.
Use appropriate judgement to escalate issues and exception requests against firm policies and procedures, and own the resolution communication to impacted stakeholders.
Manage all aspects of proxy voting operations and provide proactive reporting and assistance in answering prospective client request for proposals (RFPs).
Partner with other supporting areas such as Legal, Compliance, Internal Controls, Technology, Client Services and other operational teams to deliver on firm goals.
Consistently create an improved operating environment by proactively identifying and escalating control gaps and proposing and instituting best practices and tools to be more efficient and effective.
Lead and contribute to firm-wide and departmental value-add projects and present project findings to leadership and other stakeholders as needed.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required
1-3 years’ work experience
Ability to handle confidential material with utmost discretion
Strong level of attention to detail and proven ability to work under pressure with multiple priorities and a sense of urgency
Must have the ability to work effectively and efficiently in a fast-paced, team environment.
Strong decision making, organization, and communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to solve problems independently.
Excellent client service orientation and must possess a client-first mentality; demonstrated flexibility and strong follow-up skills.
Demonstrated strategic thinker with a desire to identify opportunities and drive change
Ability to work in an office location
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor degree preferably in Finance, Accounting or Economics
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Knowledge of Investment Manager, Bank and Broker On-Boarding requirements
Knowledge of Advent’s APX, and PegaSystems preferred
Knowledge of Proxy Processing

Job Title: HR BUSINESS PROCESS ANALYST (HR ADMINISTRATOR I)
Job Description:
GRADE
18
LOCATION OF POSITION
MDH, Office of Human Resources, Classification, Salary and Organization Design Unit, Baltimore, MD
Main Purpose of Job
This position, serving as the HR Business Process Analyst, operates as a part of the OHR Organizational Design team and will be responsible for the creation and improvement of business process of the Human Resources Unit. This role will be to create, realign, oversee and improve the business process within all OHR units, including timekeeping, payroll, classification, employment and recruitment. The HR Business Process Analyst will review and audit current business processes and report functionality, and design and implement new processes that better support the organization’s goals. This position will be responsible for reviewing current reports and providing follow up for issues and assisting with corrections, as well as performing auditing functions on HR transactions with an eye towards quality assurance. The incumbent will be responsible for writing SOPs for all HR reporting functionality, including what Workday reports are ran and where the reporting data comes from so that reports can be consistent when pulled annually.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Experience: Eight years of experience, four years of professional HR experience involving recruitment and employment services, classification and compensation, employee relations, test development and validation, job analysis, job evaluation, salary administration, HR program evaluation, or HR policy formulation and an additional four years of professional experience in HR management work in the areas of recruitment and selection, classification, salary administration, employee relations, test development and validation or as a generalist.

Notes:

1. Candidates may substitute paraprofessional personnel work experience on a year-for-year basis for up to four years of the required experience. Paraprofessional personnel work is defined as work involving the application of public sector personnel procedures, policies, rules and regulations to specific employment actions. Appropriate paraprofessional personnel experience includes responsibility for activities such as: preparing and maintaining employment records, calculating salaries, applying personnel-related rules and policies, preparing personnel-related reports, conducting employee orientation and counseling employees regarding benefits and obligations and responding to inquiries concerning employment procedures.

2. Candidates may substitute the possession of a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university and four years of professional HR experience involving recruitment and employment services, classification and compensation, employee relations, test development and validation, job analysis, job evaluation, salary administration, HR program evaluation, or HR policy formulation for the required experience.

3. Candidates may substitute the possession of thirty graduate credit hours from an accredited college or university in the fields of HR/personnel administration, business administration, public administration, statistics, tests and measurements, psychology or a related field for up to six years of the required experience.

4. Candidates may substitute U.S. Armed Forces military service experience as a commissioned officer in human resources management classifications or human resources management specialty codes in the human resources management field of work on a year-for-year basis for the required experience.

DESIRED OR PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Preferred candidates should possess the following:


Master's degree in Human Resources, Industrial/Organizational Psychology, or related field
Experience in Change Management
Experience in Organizational Design
Experience in business process auditing, development, and improvement
LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS AND CERTIFICATIONS

1. Employees in this classification are required to obtain certification in State Personnel Management System policies and procedures and in the functionality of the Statewide Personnel System from the Office of Personnel Services and Benefits, Maryland Department of Budget and Management within six months from the time of appointment to the position. Employees are also required to obtain recertification every six months thereafter.

2. Employees in this classification may be assigned duties which require the operation of a motor vehicle. Employees assigned such duties will be required to possess a motor vehicle operator’s license valid in the State of Maryland.

SELECTION PROCESS

Applicants who meet the minimum (and selective) qualifications will be included in further evaluation. The evaluation may be a rating of your application based on your education, training and experience as they relate to the requirements of the position. Therefore, it is essential that you provide complete and accurate information on your application. Please report all related education, experience, dates and hours of work. Clearly indicate your college degree and major on your application, if applicable. For education obtained outside the U.S., any job offer will be contingent on the candidate providing an evaluation for equivalency by a foreign credential evaluation service prior to starting employment (and may be requested prior to interview).

Complete applications must be submitted by the closing date. Information submitted after this date will not be added.

Incorrect application forms will not be accepted. Resumes will not be accepted in lieu of a completed application.

Candidates may remain on the certified eligible list for a period of at least one year. The resulting certified eligible list for this recruitment may be used for similar positions in this or other State agencies.

BENEFITS

STATE OF MARYLAND BENEFITS




FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS

Online applications are highly recommended. However, if you are unable to apply online, the paper application (and supplemental questionnaire) may be submitted to MDH, Recruitment and Selection Division, 201 W. Preston St., Room 114-B, Baltimore, MD 21201. Paper application materials must be received by 5 pm, close of business, on the closing date for the recruitment, no postmarks will be accepted.

If additional information is required, the preferred method is to upload. If you are unable to upload, please fax the requested information to 410-333-5689. Only additional materials that are required will be accepted for this recruitment. All additional information must be received by the closing date and time.

For questions regarding this recruitment, please contact the MDH Recruitment and Selection Division at 410-767-1251.

If you are having difficulty with your user account or have general questions about the online application system, please contact the MD Department of Budget and Management, Recruitment and Examination Division at 410-767-4850 or Application.Help@maryland.gov.

Appropriate accommodations for individuals with disabilities are available upon request by calling: 410-767-1251 or MD TTY Relay Service 1-800-735-2258.

We thank our Veterans for their service to our country.

People with disabilities and bilingual candidates are encouraged to apply.

As an equal opportunity employer, Maryland is committed to recruitment, retaining and promoting employees who are reflective of the State's diversity.

Overview:

Bachelor's Degree and 8 to 10 years of experience
Clearance: Must posess and maintain a TS with Polygraph clearance
Analyze gathered requirements to identify potential conflicts or gaps, work with users to clarify and refine the requirements, as needed
Collaborate with stakeholders to create clear and concise requirement documentation
Establish traceability between requirements and test cases to ensure end-to-end test coverage

About BigBear.ai:
BigBear.ai delivers AI-powered analytics and cyber engineering solutions to support mission-critical operations and decision-making in complex, real-world environments. BigBear.ai’s customers, which include the US Intelligence Community, Department of Defense, the US Federal Government, as well as customers in manufacturing, healthcare, commercial space, and other sectors, rely on BigBear.ai’s solutions to see and shape their world through reliable, predictive insights and goal-oriented advice. Headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, BigBear.ai is a global, public company traded on the NYSE under the symbol BBAI. For more information, please visit: http://bigbear.ai/ and follow BigBear.ai on Twitter: @BigBearai.

Williams Consulting, LLC (WCLLC) is in search of a Sr. Business Analyst to join our growing team onsite at our Catonsville, Maryland office on the campus of the University of Maryland Baltimore County. The core business hours are Monday-Friday 8:30 am - 5:00pm.




Williams Consulting, LLC is an 8(a), HUBZone, Woman-Owned Small Business, and Economically Disadvantaged Woman-Owned Small Business with Federal, State, local, and commercial clients. We take immense pride in our ability to provide exceptional client service. We value our employees and recognize their contributions to the success of our clients and our company. We offer competitive salaries and support flexible work locations and scheduling, when possible. We offer competitive benefits including Medical, Vision, and Dental coverage through national plans. We also offer Life, AD&D, Short- & Long-Term Disability Insurance, PTO, and 401k.




Description

Williams Consulting, LLC is seeking a highly skilled Sr. Business Analyst with specialized experience in the normalization of application scoring to support the delivery of a mission-critical Federal healthcare program. This role involves coordinating, analyzing, and improving the application submission process for a new healthcare Model for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation (CMMI) within the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS). In addition, the Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and optimizing the scoring methodology to ensure fair and consistent evaluations.




Duties and Responsibilities

Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the CMS CMMI Model, its components, and its impact on the application submission process.
Create application submission workflows and identify areas for enhancements.
Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies
Provide insights and recommendation to improve the application submission processes including data collection, validation, and quality control.
Document and implement the normalization process.
Use the Salesforce Review and Scoring Module for tracking and processing applications.
Conduct applicant outreach and identify areas where outreach efforts could help improve application submission rates.
Create and manage tools (e.g., emails, dashboards, tracking documents) to enhance the effectiveness of program operations e.g., Excel document for analysis, action item tracking, SOPs, timelines, strategic planning, PMO dashboard in Excel, etc.
Identify interdependencies, sequencing, milestones, risks/issues, and performance measures.
Addresses risks and implement contingency plans to resolve issues impacting the project.
Other duties as assigned.



Qualifications and Experience

A./B.S. degree in business administration, or related field
A minimum of 8 years proven experience as a Business Analyst with a focus on healthcare application submission processes and application scoring and normalization.
Familiarity with CMS CMMI Models is highly advantageous.
A deep understanding of evaluation methodologies and scoring processes.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Customer-focused with a commitment to providing high-quality service.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Strong attention to detail, organization, and efficient time management.
Knowledge of healthcare industry standards, regulation, and quality improvement initiatives.

Title: Power BI Analyst

Department: IT

Position Status: Full Time

Exempt Status: Exempt Salary

About CDS Logistics

At CDS Logistics, we are specialists in last mile delivery services of kitchen cabinets, windows, doors and appliances. We service our customers through a nationwide network consisting of over 80 locations making over 1 million deliveries annually to homes, job sites and retail locations. Our team-oriented approach, together with our proprietary technology, enables us to exceed our customers’ expectations.

We are not perfect, but we try to be. We hold ourselves to the highest standards, ensuring every customer is treated with respect and every order handled as if it were our own. We support our team members to ensure their career success with training programs, accessible leadership, and ongoing talent development.

Our Mission: “Creating Customers by Servicing Customers”

Our Guiding Principles:

1. Respect for others

2. Can do attitude

3. Solve customer concerns immediately

4. Treat customer's orders like they are our own

5. Culture of continuous improvement

About the Job

CDS Logistics is seeking a talented and motivated Power BI Developer/Analyst to join the CDS team. As a Power BI expert, you will be a member of the Information Technology team and will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining interactive dashboards and reports that provide valuable insights to the organization. You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and create data visualizations that enable data-driven decision-making throughout all levels within our organization. The ideal candidate will have strong technical skills in Power BI, data modeling, a good understanding of business processes and excellent communication skills.

Power BI Analyst:

Successful applicant will be able to:

· Perform quality work within deadlines.

· Interact and communicate professionally with internal and external customer groups.

· Prioritize daily tasks in consideration of Organizational Strategic Goals.

· Work independently while understanding the necessity for communicating and coordinating efforts with your stakeholders.

Essential Job Functions

· Design, develop, and deploy interactive Power BI dashboards and reports that meet the needs of various business units.

· Work closely with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective data visualizations.

· Develop data models, relationships, and calculations to ensure data accuracy and integrity in Power BI.

· Optimize and tune Power BI reports for performance and usability through close partnership with internal customers.

· Monitor and maintain existing Power BI solutions, troubleshooting and resolving issues as needed.

· Collaborate with the technology team to access and transform data from various sources into usable formats for Power BI.

· Stay up-to-date with the latest Power BI features, best practices, and industry trends.

· Work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

· Ensure that the Power BI implementation meets enterprise data security and compliance standards.

· Develop strong data documentation about algorithms, parameters, models.

· Provide thought leadership, best practices, and standards required to deliver effective and sustainable solutions to the business.

· Provide training and support to end-users on using Power BI and interpreting visualizations effectively.

Required Education & Experience:

· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience (1+ years) as a Power BI Developer, Analyst, or similar role preferred.

· Experience with the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Logic Apps, Power Pages, Power Virtual Agents, Dataverse etc.)

· Experience in data modeling, data visualization, and report development.

· Proficient in SQL and database querying.

· Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.

· Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Knowledge of security protocol as outlined by the Microsoft Power Platform best practices/governance and assign permissions using appropriate protocol/SOPs.

Other Duties

· Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.

DSD Laboratories, a leader in Cybersecurity, IT Portfolio / Project Management and Big Data Analytics Decision Support is currently seeking a motivated and qualified professional for an exciting opportunity to lead/manage/coordinate the creation/configuration of reports, visualizations and dashboards to transition requirements from current solutions to QLIK.

Why YOU should join the DSD Team!

If you are a dynamic individual with a strong passion to help others, this may be the role for you! At DSD Laboratories, we focus on the customers and ultimately, the end-users. We are committed to bringing passion and customer service to the U.S. Air Force warfighters!

While we truly believe in working hard, we also believe in enjoying life; family is a core value to DSD!

The DSD Laboratories team works very hard and while this position is challenging, it is also very rewarding!

About The Team

The team focuses on two areas: Customer Service and Capability Delivery

We provide critical customer support to 36k+ users on a regular basis. This support is satisfied through emails, phone calls, training sessions and web publishing/communications.
The team delivers the U.S. Air Force warfighter decision support capabilities using AGILE methodologies.

How will YOU support the customers?

Get It Done – Successfully deliver end-to-end projects/capabilities working through a wide range of challenges and opportunities across multiple organizations.
Communicate – Communicate regularly with your customers, teammates and stakeholders on both technical and non-technical topics.
Create – Utilize business intelligence tool sets to create/configure enterprise reports and dashboards.
Collaborate – Work closely across the team to remediate/migrate existing capabilities to a new hosting environment.

About the Position

The QLIK expert works closely with business analysts, product owners and key stakeholders to design and implement custom dashboards and visualizations/reports to meet organizational needs. This individual creates custom reporting solutions to facilitate mission success.

Preferred individual is self-motivated, with a high energy level, and a proactive work ethic. Activities include participation in Kanban/SCRUM sprints and summaries, weekly SCRUMs and retrospectives.

During the COVID-19 period, 2-3 days of remote work per week may be required; therefore, the candidate must have the ability to excel while working from home. (Government computer will be provided)

Key Skills/Experience Required:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field of study; experience/certifications may be substituted for degree requirements
Design and implement reports, scorecards and dashboards using visualization tools (preferably QLIK)
Experience gathering/analyzing requirements and translating them into functional specifications
Requires strong organizational skills and action-oriented personality; experience leading tasks and tracking actions across multiple organizations
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities backed by solid writing and highly-effective communication skills; must collaborate constructively and effectively with project end-users, customers, advocates and stakeholders
Active Government Secret Clearance required

Other Skills
(beneficial, not required)

Design and implement reports, scorecards and dashboards using Tableau, Lumira, Power BI, is a plus
Analytical and problem-solving skills with other Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Lumira, Power BI and Business Objects); experience with query creation/configuration and troubleshooting; ad-hoc report creation and related skills is a definite plus.

Summary:

We are seeking a seasoned and visionary Business Analytics Manager to lead our analytical and financial analysis team. This managerial role encompasses the strategic oversight of a team that blends data interpretation through advanced analytics with financial insights, translating them into actionable business strategies. With a solid background in both BI tools and financial management, the Business Analytics Manager will guide, mentor, and drive the team to craft tailored solutions aligning business goals with financial objectives. As a bridge between data-driven insights and fiscal governance, this role will play a pivotal part in steering organizational success, ensuring financial compliance, and fostering a culture of informed, data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate will demonstrate leadership acumen, technical proficiency, financial savvy, and a commitment to continuous improvement and innovation. This is a hybrid role, based out of our Frederick, MD Corporate Office.

Essential Job Duties:

3 years’ experience in Accounting/Finance
Experience: 5+ years of experience in financial analysis and data, BI tools, or related field.

Job Purpose:
The Finance Solutions Analyst plays a proactive role in partnering with our finance and accounting department and other business teams to develop and manage solutions that align with business goals and drive targeted outcomes. This position involves leading analysis and design tasks to ensure technology solutions meet business needs while adhering to architectural standards.

Key Responsibilities:

Interpret Business Needs: Translate business requirements into technical solutions, collaborate with stakeholders, and shape requirements to meet business objectives.

Assess Technology: Monitor and evaluate the current solution portfolio, research emerging technology trends, and recommend improvements to align with business requirements.

Apply Technology: Serve as a liaison between business and IT teams, lead solution implementation, and develop a roadmap for the evolution of the enterprise solution portfolio.

Qualifications and Experience:

Bachelor's or master's degree in finance, accounting, IT, project management, or related field, or equivalent progressive IT experience.
4-5 years of experience in IT solution development and/or finance/business analyst roles with a focus on supporting Finance stakeholders.
ERP system and/or ERP implementation experience, PDI experience preferred.
Experience in leading workstreams and supporting a multi-unit retail organization's finance department.
Experience with finance and accounting solutions and automation tools.
Proficiency in project or task management tools, functional design tools, and creative solution tools.
Exposure to diverse technologies and strong communication and collaboration skills.
Authorization to work in the U.S. (visa sponsorship or C2C opportunities not available at this time).
Willing to submit to a pre-employment background check in accordance with local, state, and federal laws.

Competencies:

Adapting to change
Working with people
Delivering results and meeting customer expectations
Strong analytical, planning, organizational, and technical skills
Applying expertise and technology
Presenting and communicating information
Creating and innovating

Availability and Travel:
This role includes a hybrid schedule with two in-office days each week in La Plata, MD. Occasional travel for training or conferences may be required, with eligible travel expenses.

Regents Consulting Group - the premier professional services firm specializing in enterprise solutions for the Staffing / Services Industry- is looking for an ERP Cross-Functional Business Process Analyst to join their consulting team.

Specific responsibilities are project specific, however we are looking for candidates with the following experience:

Analyze, develop and configure business processes and data structures.
Analyze, develop and implement new business architecture
Translate business objectives and requirements into functional and system specifications
Develop, configure and test business requirements
Create and generate detailed project documentation
Interact with business users to understand their business needs and requirements.
Coordinate with implementation team to develop and refine logistics.
Assist and support the design and development of required interfaces and enhancements.


The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of experience:

Business Process related to an ERP implementation, upgrade or transformation project (PeopleSoft, Oracle, SAP, etc.)
Working in the Staffing or Services industry, or a related field.
Providing high quality deliverables such as Business Process Flows, System Flows, Test Scripts

Company Description


The University of Maryland Medical System is a 14-hospital system with academic, community and specialty medical services reaching every part of Maryland and beyond. UMMS is a national and regional referral center for trauma, cancer care, Neurocare, cardiac care, women’s and children’s health and physical rehabilitation. UMMS is the fourth largest private employer in the Baltimore metropolitan area and one of the top 20 employers in the state of Maryland. No organization will give you the clinical variety, the support, or the opportunities for professional growth that you’ll enjoy as a member of our team.



Job Description


I. General Summary

This is a multifaceted position that will work closely with the ITSM Service Operations Team and UMMS IT and business entities to ensure highly effective and consistent use of the ITSM System. This individual is responsible for understanding and analyzing user requirements, developing and modifying business applications in a dynamic healthcare environment. As a subject matter expert, uses data and technology to address business and customer challenges.

II. Principal Responsibilities and Tasks

The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by personnel so classified.

Work with stakeholders to define and understand system requirements, building strong stakeholder relationships and trust.
Work with developers and architects to ensure that solutions developed meet client needs.
Leads workshops with business teams for customer processes, document findings and develop/propose workflows and design documents for existing and new/improved workflow, maximizing the ITSM platform capabilities.
Works with internal teams to evaluate demand and develop priorities, timelines and level of effort for requested system changes
Gathers data and creates data visualizations to more deeply understand key issues and associated impacts
Assess complex data sets and performing root cause analysis
Identifies trends and patterns in data to deliver on Key Performance Indicators and make strategic business decisions.
Performs process modeling and documentation, including reports and dashboards to define business KPIs and value targets
Ensures accurate data and creates reports, visualizations, filters and dashboards
Support testing of system modifications and upgrades/updates by developing test cases, overseeing user testing, and documenting results
Documents business and functional requirements to create the stories needed to implement, modify or improve the ITSM system functionality to enhance business and IT operations.
Prepares written documentation of various types, including application documentation, analytical reports, functional specifications, training manuals and status reports
Trains new users on appropriate and efficient use of the ITSM system and associated interfaces/integrations. Develops and maintains technical guides which inform and educate staff as to appropriate use of the ITSM system.
Participates in periodic audits of ITSM system configuration and transactions to ensure compliance with UMMS policies and regulatory requirements.
Recommends new ITSM system functionality, keeping abreast of new ISM features and enhancements.
Provide recommendations and implementation strategies for improving business processes, procedures, and workflows


Qualifications


III. Education/Experience

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience required.
Five (5) plus years of experience with large scale ITSM systems in an enterprise environment, including end-user support; report development, system analysis for fit to business needs; ad-hoc analysis and auditing of system data; and the use of Agile for development and delivery.
Three (3) plus years of experience working with the ServiceNow platform as an ITSM Business Analyst or similar level role. Experience with ServiceNow implementations is preferred.
Experience working in a healthcare environment is preferred.
Certified System Administrator and other ServiceNow certifications preferred

IV. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Deep understanding of ITIL Incident, Problem, Change, Configuration, Knowledge, and Request Management processes.
Knowledge and experience in all project life cycle phases, including fit/gap analysis, product design, build, test, implementation and stabilization a plus.
Proficient in the use of MS Office products.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of employees and management.
Effective collaboration skills are required, including the ability to work alongside other departments in the organization toward a common goal despite differing perspectives on individual success.
Demonstrated ability to perform detailed tasks with a high degree of accuracy.

Additional Information


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

OPERATIONS RESEARCH ANALYST

The Operations Research Analyst (intermediate and senior positions) will provide SETA support to Tactical Networks at Aberdeen Proving Ground (APG), MD.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform a wide variety of cost analysis assignments in support of the program life cycle cost estimates (LCCE) and program office estimates (POE).
Develop or evaluate cost assessments, cost positions relating to the systems development, demonstration and production approaches.
Assess impact on systems and program costs, including analyses of prototype systems.
Work with SMEs to develop independent Government cost estimates (IGCEs) that will stand up to Army and DoD level review.
Serves as Working Leader to lower-grade personnel and is considered an expert for providing technical guidance and information to meet requirements.
Review, assist and mentor lower-grade employee’s work for quality, accuracy of work. Coordinate work efforts with Contract Officer Representative.
Serves as a expert for providing technical guidance and information to meet requirements.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum of 5 years preparing and updating cost estimates using ACEIT (must be with DoD Program Executive Office (PEO), Project Manager (O6 PM) or Product Manager (O5 PdM)
analytical abilities required.
MS proficiency with Excel required.
Bachelor's degree in economics, mathematics, operations research, data analytics, or related field

SECURITY CLEARANCE

Active DoD Secret clearance required

TRAVEL

Some travel may be required

Job Code:
1069

Job Title: Business Analyst | Microsoft Power BI and CRM
Job Description:
ABOUT ALBERT USTER IMPORTS

Albert Uster Imports, Inc. (“AUI”) is a privately held gourmet food company headquartered in the Washington, DC area (Gaithersburg, MD) with warehouse locations in Kansas City, Las Vegas, Miami, Los Angeles, San Francisco and Gaithersburg. AUI falls under the Vestar Capital Partners portfolio with affiliate organization, Roland Foods, LLC.

Founded in 1968, the company offers over 1,400 products from around the world. We serve leading hotels, restaurants, casinos, cruise lines, airlines, and manufacturers with innovative, high quality products and solutions to their most demanding culinary challenges. We operate a network of distribution centers across the U.S. and serve select International markets as well. AUI has a national direct selling organization of over 60 sales professionals and a staff of culinary experts (chefs and food scientists) adept at custom product solutions.




ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Business Analyst with expertise in Microsoft Business Intelligence (BI) and Dynamics 365 Customer Relationship Management (CRM) to join our team. As a Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving business growth and enhancing operational efficiency by leveraging your knowledge and experience in Microsoft BI and Dynamics 365 CRM. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and clients to understand business requirements, analyze data, and deliver actionable insights and solutions. Your technical expertise and business acumen will be instrumental in driving strategic decision-making and supporting the successful implementation of BI and CRM initiatives.

Location: This is not a remote position and is expected to be local to Gaithersburg, Maryland.

This position is expected to report to AUI Fine Foods’ Gaithersburg, MD headquarters. As a response to the pandemic, AUI Find Foods’ office employees have transitioned to a hybrid working schedule, requiring employees to report in-person Monday through Wednesday, with the option to telework on Thursday and Friday each week. Due to the collaborative, cross-functional nature of the organization, employees at the Gaithersburg office are required to work in-person for the abovementioned days, outside of any People & Culture-approved disability accommodation request.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business requirements, objectives, and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Analyze complex data sets from various sources, including Microsoft BI and Dynamics 365 CRM, to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes.
Design, develop, and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using Microsoft BI tools such as Power BI, SSRS, and Excel.
Perform data modeling, data mapping, and data integration tasks to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency within the BI and CRM systems.
Provide expertise in configuring, customizing, and extending Dynamics 365 CRM to meet business needs, including workflows, forms, entities, and plugins.
Collaborate with IT teams and developers to define technical requirements and ensure seamless integration of BI and CRM solutions.
Conduct user training sessions and create documentation to facilitate user adoption and self-service reporting capabilities.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to Microsoft BI and Dynamics 365 CRM, and make recommendations for process improvements and system enhancements.
Work closely with project managers to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet quality standards.
Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and maintenance of BI and CRM systems, including investigating and resolving user-reported issues.




QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

Required

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working as a Business Analyst, with a focus on Microsoft BI and Dynamics 365 CRM.
Strong expertise in Microsoft BI tools, including Power BI, SSRS, and Excel.
Proficient in data modeling, ETL processes, and SQL for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Extensive experience with Dynamics 365 CRM configuration, customization, and integration.

Preferred

Certifications in Microsoft BI and Dynamics 365 CRM are highly desirable.
Solid understanding of business processes and CRM best practices across various industries.
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from complex data sets.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and clients.
Proven track record of delivering high-quality BI and CRM solutions within deadlines and budget constraints.




SALARY RANGE

AUI hires exceptional people to perform a wide variety of important functions that contribute to the success of the Company. One of the ways Albert Uster Imports, Inc. does that is through a competitive compensation package. The base salary for this role will be $85,000 - $90,000

This role is bonus eligible.

Based on your qualifications, previous experience, and transferrable skills, the Company will determine at its sole discretion, the salary offered.




Founded by immigrants, AUI & Roland Foods knows that diversity is the spice of life. We believe in the power of food to open minds, spark adventure, and bring diverse people together. All are welcome at our table! We know the transformative value of food in individual lives and communities. Because of this, we insist on obtaining the highest-quality ingredients and talent!

AUI is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. AUI considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. AUI is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at peopleandculture@rolandfoods.com.

Salary: Up to $90,000 depending on education and experience

Security Requirements: TS/SCI with CI Poly (both active).

Locations: Fort Meade, MD.

Certifications: None.

Job Description:

Develops, maintains, and automates metrics to assess USCYBERCOM operational Measure of Effective and Performance (MOE/MOP)
Develops cost-benefit analysis, data collection, data analysis, risk analysis, simulation model execution, economic analysis, and operational effectiveness studies.
Devises modeling and measuring techniques, and utilizes mathematics, statistical methods, engineering methods, operational mathematics techniques (linear programming, game theory, probability theory, symbolic language, etc.) and other principles and laws of scientific and economic disciplines to investigate complex issues, identify, and solve problems, and aid better decision making.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):

Proficient in using query languages (e.g., SQL, Hive, Pig). Experience with common data science toolkits (e.g., R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc.) Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., D3.js, GGplot, etc.).
Provides operations research analysis support for intelligence, cyberspace operations, contingency operations, and operational-level planning, joint and multilateral training exercises, and strategic engagement policy.
Researches and collects information from various sources and analyzes it for better understanding of cyberspace operations assessment frameworks and methodologies.
Interprets policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and objectives and applies operations research principles and techniques to compound analytic needs.
Identifies issues and priorities affecting assessment of planned or on-going cyberspace operations.
Selects features, builds and optimizes classifiers using machine learning techniques.
Enhances data collection procedures to include information relevant for building analytic systems.
Analyzes, reports, and develops recommendations on data related to compound operational metrics.
Assists in identifying and prioritizing requirements for capability development efforts.
Applies and/or develops highly advanced technologies, scientific principles, theories, and concepts to assist organizations in advancing performance and operating more efficiently.
Assists in addressing requirements and the evaluation of data assessment strategies: sampling, statistical analysis, evaluation, flow processing, and management assessment strategies.
Possesses an in-depth understanding of cyberspace doctrine, policies, operations, and organizations.
Collaborates with internal and external partners to facilitate cyberspace operations assessment, situational awareness, and information sharing.
Delivers innovative, flexible, integrated solutions to meet changing business needs.
Assists in the planning of programs and recommends technological application programs to accomplish long-range objectives.
Exhibits an intermediate degree of ingenuity, creativity, and resourcefulness during the conduct of research and development and preparation of documents, briefings, and analyses which may include narrative, tabular, and graphic materials.

Qualifications:

Minimum five years of operations research analyst experience is required.
Minimum of bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Operations Research, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Computer Engineering, or related discipline.

MBA or advanced degree
Experience using SAP

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Acquisition Business Analyst to join our team. As an Acquisition Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in supporting our acquisition activities by conducting thorough analyses of acquisition requirement packages. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in business analysis, and financial analysis, coupled with excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Duties and Responsibilities

Collaborate with the acquisition team to gather requirements, objectives, and priorities for potential acquisitions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify integration requirements, assess operational impact, and develop implementation plans for successful acquisition.
Provide insights and recommendations to senior management.

Qualifications

8 years’ experience
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
Strong financial analysis skills, including financial modeling, valuation techniques, and cost-benefit analysis.

Solid understanding of financial statements, financial ratios, and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex information to stakeholders at various levels.
Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and build positive relationships with team members and stakeholders.
Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools.

Entegra Procurement Services is a fast-growing and dynamic division of Sodexo and part of a global procurement network that manages more than $36 billion in spend for food, services and supplies, and serves more than 120,000 purchasing sites throughout the United States alone. Entegra Procurement Services provides procurement management for multi-unit clients in industries including seniors, healthcare, education, government, faith based, leisure, hotels, and restaurants. We deliver procurement solutions that drive operational effectiveness and innovative products and services.

We are currently searching for a Business Analytics Specialist 2, who will support our Local and Direct Portfolio.


This is a remote opportunity. Candidates for the position can reside anywhere within the United States.
The successful candidate will:
Support Local and Direct analytical, reporting and administrative needs including, but not limited to, business review preparation, standard reporting, ad-hoc analysis, financial close support and budget/forecast review/processing.
Systematically gather information from a variety of sources, analyze information, identify implications of data, draw appropriate conclusions, generate viable alternative solutions to a question or problem, and evaluate the consequences of choosing each alternative.
Be responsible for preparing monthly and quarterly reports associated with Local and Direct sales and revenue that will help explain past activities and find opportunities for growth with our supplier partners.
Conduct analysis of sales and revenue results and assist in the forecast and budget process.
Continue to build knowledge of the organization, processes and customers. Performs a range of mainly straightforward assignments.
Use prescribed guidelines or policies to analyze and resolve problems. Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction.
Have experience working with large sets of data in Excel and Access.
Continually be looking for opportunities to improve current processes and develop new data analysis processes to help grow sales and revenue.

The successful candidate will possess the following:

Associate’s Degree or equivalent experience
Strong analytical skills

Location: BALTIMORE, MD, United States
Organization: Constellation Energy Generation, LLC
Job ID: 248007
Date Posted: Nov 17, 2023



Job Description

Description

As the nation's largest producer of clean, carbon-free energy, Constellation is a company purposely-built to meet the challenges of the climate crisis. Constellation has been the leader in clean energy production for more than a decade and we are growing our company and capabilities. Now, we're accelerating, speeding our low-carbon or no-carbon power to more people in more places, day, and night, providing our customers and communities with options to buy, manage and use energy as part of their decarbonization mission. The race is on to confront the climate crisis and Constellation is ready to meet the challenge. Come join us as we lead energy, together.

Constellation has been the leader in carbon-free energy production for more than a decade, and generates 50% more clean, carbon-free electricity than any other company in America. We're generating power 24/7 with the nation's largest emission-free nuclear energy fleet, providing enough clean energy to power 15 million homes. Constellation offers customers a range of clean, zero-carbon energy solutions to help reduce their carbon footprint and achieve their sustainability goals.

We are committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion and believe in attracting, retaining, and advancing employees who will best serve and represent our customers, partners, and communities. We provide a workplace that ensures mutual respect, where each individual has the opportunity to grow and contribute at their greatest potential. Constellation will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build, and power a successful career.

TOTAL REWARDS

Constellation offers a wide range of benefits and rewards, designed to help our employees thrive professionally and personally. In addition to highly competitive salaries, we offer a bonus program, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase program; comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits, including a robust wellness program; paid time off for vacation, holidays, and sick days; and much more.

Expected salary range of $110,700 to $123,000, varies based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits package that includes bonus and 401(k).




PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

This position has a unique blend of business and financial analysis, reporting, and relationship management within the Chief Information Officer’s (CIO) Strategy Enablement organization. Lead and perform support activities for Strategic Vendor Management Office (SVMO) which sets and drives the standards and processes with the focus on operational execution, governs and oversees the contractual, financial, and operational performance of multiple Strategic Partners (SPs). Build and maintain relationships with SPs, Constellation IT Service Delivery, and supporting organizations to deliver high-quality IT services within a risk managed environment.

Perform detailed analysis and prepare comprehensive reports/charts/graphs to support business operations. Conduct complex modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, and other general financial and operational analysis. Track, maintain, analyze, and provide current information on operational scorecards and/or service level agreements (SLAs). Support the design, development and implementation of digital technology and automation related to our data collection, analysis, and presentation processes.

PRIMARY DUTIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Lead the Financial Services function:

Ensure financial adherence to the contractual terms and conditions. Support organizational studies, research, and initiatives that could potentially improve operations and/or result in cost reductions.

Deliver a flexible consumption model able to support the changing needs of the business, provide on-demand spend analysis, administer consistent change request process, track savings, validate accuracy and timeliness of invoice submissions, develop, and maintain an innovation program, and sustainment and continuous improvement activities related to Management Model core functional processes.

Compliance & Oversight: Development and implementation of program financial processes (service fee credits, accruals, invoicing) and procedures that support oversight, conform with financial policies, and support auditing. Serve as liaison between Finance, IT Service Delivery leads, Accounting, Supply, and external vendors on a day-to-day basis for program related financial inquiries. Maintain strong relationships with external vendor administrative personnel in Finance, Accounting, Supply, and IT Service Delivery, ensuring adherence to contractual terms.
Financial Planning & Analysis: Lead development of forecast and Long-Range Plan (LRP) outsourcing cost for IT Strategic Partnering Program (SPP); determining and communicating projections in accordance with contractual terms. Manage the delivery of key program metrics and information supporting audit request, benchmarking, cost, and resources for IT senior leadership, business office, and portfolio owners.
New Business Valuation: Collaborate with Finance and IT Business Office to construct business cases, obtain funding authorization, and manage project implementation budget for outsourcing initiatives. Lead cross functional teams through the development and implementation of program processes.
Data Analytics and Reporting Services: Perform detailed analysis and reporting in support of business operations for the SVMO which governs and oversees the contractual, financial, and operational performance of multiple SPs. Develop models depicting trends and projections that are translated into analytical information for business stakeholders. Track, maintain, analyze, and provide current information related to operational performance. Develop and maintain various reports/charts/graphs.
Financial Services: Lead performance measures with related financial impacts e.g. Credits/Earn Backs. Work in conjunction with internal organizations to ensure that appropriate mechanisms are in place to provide SPP financial information as required.
Innovation Management: Lead the contractual innovation framework to drive innovation and continuous improvement. Effectively leverage the SPs’ capabilities to meet Constellation IT’s strategic objectives; ensures the SPs’ performance continuously improves throughout the term of the services and across all Constellation IT’s business units.
Support of Contract and Performance Services: Work collaboratively with IT SVMO Performance Lead on performance measures with related operational impacts e.g. KPIs/CPIs. Works in conjunction with internal organizations to ensure that appropriate mechanisms are in place to provide SPP performance information as required.
Tools and Reporting Automation and Continuous Improvement: Work with internal and external organizations to develop tracking and reporting mechanisms to provide multi-dimensional views of financial data. Drive continuous improvement through the design, development and implementation of digital scorecards and dashboards. Identify opportunities to automate manual processes and drive self-service reporting.

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related discipline and typically 5 to 8 years experience in Information Technology or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel to retrieve and analyze data in support of business needs.
“Tech Savvy” - Able to leverage technology to solve business problems with proficiency with specialized business technologies (Power BI and other MS development tools).
Ability to provide in-depth analysis analytical and statistical problem solving, financial and business analysis.
Comprehensive knowledge of the practices, procedures, and principles of performance analysis (trending, root cause and gap analysis) benchmarking and compliance. Ability to analyze organizational data and complex problems, interpret and recommend alternative courses of action.
Strong leadership, organizational, and project management skills.
Excellent writing skills, as well as excellent written and oral presentation and communications skills.
Strong emotional intelligence, including a demonstrated ability to manage confidential, sensitive, or proprietary information in a discreet and professional manner.
Ability to navigate/build relationships and to collaborate at all levels across the organization.
Ability to build consensus, find common ground, and influence outcomes.
Strong initiative, with self-drive and ability to independently manage time, priorities, and deadlines.
Flexible and comfortable navigating through ambiguity or shifting priorities.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

A minimum of 8 or more years of relevant experience in IT or a business area performing financial activities.
Graduate degree
Demonstrated experience performing vendor management with outsourcing agreements and associated operational processes.
Financial and contractual acumen and negotiation skills
Proficiency with MS 365 Collaboration tools (SharePoint, Teams)

EEO

Whether you are an employee or applicant, you will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

We are committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion and believe in attracting, retaining, and advancing employees who will best serve and represent our customers, partners, and communities. We support a workplace that ensures mutual respect, where everyone has the opportunity to grow and contribute at their greatest potential. Constellation will provide you the tools and resources to build and power a successful career.

Collaborate with stakeholders and product teams to decompose large epic stories into features and user stories that can be understood and approved by members of the development team

Description

Do you desire to be part of a hardworking, dynamic IT operations team that is passionate about helping people solve IT problems?

Do you specialize in data analytics, visualization or reporting? Are you keenly interested in working in an environment that offers the opportunity to partner with staff and program management stakeholders on projects?

If so, we're looking for someone like you to join our team at APL.

We are ranked as one of Computerworld 's Top Places to Work in IT 5 years running, and we are seeking an IT Operations Analyst to join our Desktop Services Group. As an IT Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing, developing and engineering reports that support data-driven decision making throughout the department. You will work closely with department management to deliver analytical insights, which drive operational initiatives.

As an IT Operations Analyst ...
Your main responsibility will be to use tools such as ServiceNow, PowerBI, SQL and Denodo to develop dashboards and reports to highlight key performance indicators.
You will collect, coordinate and analyze sophisticated batches of data from various sources to interpret trends or patterns
You will prepare documents and presentation materials to include analytics and data findings
You will serve as a domain expert to develop, implement, and solve reporting models
You will partner with project team and program management stakeholders to ensure accurate insights are delivered and communicated
You will build adhoc reports as needed

Qualifications

You meet our minimum qualifications for the job if you...
Possess a Bachelor’s Degree in an IT-related field plus at least 2 years of recent IT-related work experience; or in lieu of a degree, at least 6 years of a combination of education and relevant IT work-related experience
Have the ability to use visualization/dashboard design techniques and tools for data analysis and presentation
Have hands-on experience with ServiceNow Reporting.
Have knowledge of basic database table schema
Have an understanding of ITSM Tools
Are knowledgeable of the Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) Process for data management
Are proficient in Microsoft Excel
Have experience working with users to elicit requirements and developing solutions to meet business needs
Possess strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, coordinate, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Possess strong oral and written communication skills including technical and non-technical audiences
Are able to obtain a Secret security clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.
You'll go above and beyond our minimum requirements if you...
Have hands-on experience with the Performance Analytics Tool
Have experience using PowerBI, Denodo, SQL, Splunk
Have experience working in IT Operations with an understanding of ITIL processes
Have experience leading an IT support team

Job Title: Tableau Business Intelligence SME and User Support Specialist
Job Description:
Centurion is immediately hiring a Tableau BI SME for a long-term Federal opportunity supporting SSA in Woodlawn, MD. Position includes providing operational and technical support services to our user community. Technical support includes assisting users with troubleshooting, and providing advice and guidance for using Tableau Desktop, and Server.

***Selected candidate must reside within two (2) hours of SSA Headquarters in Woodlawn, MD***

Position Description


Provide Tableau operational and technical support services to our user community. Technical support includes assisting users with troubleshooting, and providing advice and guidance for using Tableau desktop, server and Prep.


Provide non-technical support to our user community. Activities include varied aspects of tool administration, documentation development and management, maintaining user-oriented communications / information (SharePoint sites, Knowledge libraries, and Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)).


Develop and maintain Tableau processes and procedures, best practices, and technically based guidance for Tableau and Tableau Prep.


Prepare and conduct presentations or training sessions on non-technical and technical topics to the user community.


All other duties as assigned or directed.
Required Skills


Experience building complex reports, dashboards, scorecards, and visualizations using Tableau or similar tools such as WebFOCUS, MS Power BI, or similar tools.


Experience in the creation and use of visualizations and conducting data analysis. Critical thinking, problem solving and the ability to work independently or collaboratively is required.


Thorough understanding of data warehouse techniques (dimensional models and aggregation techniques).


Experience with Tableau Server configuration and maintenance of project, group security, and permissions).


Experience writing advanced SQL queries and designing data models in Greenplum, Postgres, SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, and DB2.


IT customer service experience providing user support to include providing technical support/resolutions and direction on non-technical aspects of the software use at SSA.

Operations Research Analyst

What you can expect as an Operations Research Analyst at Fortress:
As an Operations Research Analyst, your role is pivotal in steering complex analytical studies within the realm of acquisition logistics. With a solid foundation in operations research methods and applied mathematics, you will tackle intricate logistics problems, innovating and applying advanced techniques. Your expertise will not only be applied to conducting and supervising comprehensive analytical investigations but also to consulting management on strategic decisions. A significant part of your responsibility lies in validating the technical aspects of studies, ensuring they align with the advancements in integrated logistics support (ILS) management.

Responsibilities include:
Utilize operations research methods and mathematical techniques to analyze acquisition logistics problems.
Develop new techniques in applied mathematics.
Complete or supervise analytical studies.
Conduct analytical investigations and develop analysis methods and techniques.
Act as a management consultant.
Manage mathematical operations related to acquisition logistics.
Ensure the technical validity of studies.
Advise acquisition logistics personnel on study results and implications, especially concerning advances in scientific knowledge and techniques in fields applicable to integrated logistics support (ILS) management.
Document and communicate results, recommendations, and summaries both orally and in writing.
Minimum Qualifications:
A minimum of 10 years of relevant experience.
At least two (2) years of experience in weapon systems acquisition analysis or logistics analysis.
Advanced knowledge of operations research methodologies and techniques.
Comprehensive understanding of acquisition logistics and its intricacies.
Familiarity with integrated logistics support (ILS) management and its advancements.
Knowledge of weapon systems acquisition and logistics analysis.
Understanding of mathematical modeling and analytical methods pertinent to logistics issues.
Awareness of scientific knowledge advancements in fields applicable to ILS management.
Must hold a minimum clearance of "Secret."
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with or within Navy Program Office(s)
Education:
Bachelor's degree
