JOB SUMMARY/OBJECTIVE:

Reporting to Group Controller North America, the Financial Analyst will execute analysis from internal and external data sources to provide data-driven decision making related to the performance of American companies in the Beretta group.

The successful candidate will liaise with senior level staff across functions of the organization. The candidate will provide meaningful insight to Beretta Holding and to the group companies ultimately improving our financial results.

This position resides at the 3 Arrows Corporate headquarters, located in Accokeek Maryland. The candidate must be located in a commutable distance from Accokeek, Maryland. This position does not offer relocation assistance.

GOAL

Effective collaboration with the Group Controller in supervising and coordinating the financial activities of the US, Canadian and Brazilian companies. To ensure the compliance to the Group standards of the reporting made by the operating companies. To supervise the intra-group transactions. Provide support with dedicate analysis to the Group management decision-making.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Ensure the coordination between local and European based management
Supervises the consolidation process for every cycle (monthly, budget, forecast, etc) of the companies

About the Role:

A Financial Business/Systems Analyst leads financial decisions for the application suite. They assist in the creation of requirements for application enhancements and creating service level agreements.


Responsibilities:

Serving as lead financial business analyst and subject matter expert of the Maryland financial business processes for the MDEC application suite
Working alongside JIS financial analysts and Judiciary leadership in resource management for fulfilling assignments
Providing analysis and requirements to the case management vendor for application enhancements
Providing end user support in adherence to established service level agreements
Evaluating current District and Circuit Court financial systems, recommend, and assist in development of standardize statewide Financial Configurations per current Maryland statutes
Providing analysis and recommendations for standardized business processes configuration and testing support of those configurations
Providing ongoing support of data review for MDEC financial data conversions, including but not limited to data mapping, creation of conversion logic, data analysis, solution determination and validation and documentation
Providing analysis and design input for audit requirements for MDEC
Supporting system testing of MDEC development, as well as provide support during User Acceptance Testing
Providing analysis to programming team on financial integrations processes
Analyzing existing and proposed data exchanges for interoperability with local and statewide financial systems
Analyzing and developing business rules specifications for the development of the MDEC Financial Systems
Analyzing large financial data sets and formulate conclusions. Develop queries and data extracts. Utilize data analysis software tools to assist with analysis and make conclusions based on data. Organize and present data set analysis graphically and verbally
Analyzing and coordinating with team members in support of other non-financial areas of MDEC, as needed
Creating and maintaining documentation containing established statewide business processes and configuration decisions
Responding to requests from auditors regarding MDEC financial business processes and financial configuration
Providing end user orientation/training on new or revised business processes in person and virtually


Candidate Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field
Ten (10) years of experience in working with, analyzing and formulating conclusions on large financial data sets, and with performing database queries
Mid-expert level experience with the following:

a. Good teamwork Skills

b. Ability to communicate information to technical and non-technical audiences

c. Strong business process knowledge

d. Court business experience

e. Ability to prepare and deliver presentations

f. Strong organizational skills

g. Ability to multi-task

Technical Skills:

a. Five years’ experience programming in PROGRESS 4GL

b. 3-4 years’ experience working with UNIX (AIX)

c. Windows

d. Strong analytical and programming skills

e. Court Case Management application experience desired

f. Experience with UNIX/AIX based, large scale applications

g. SQL and PL/SQL

h. XML

i. Java script

j. FTP

We are seeking an Operations Analyst, Junior to support talented Operations team at The Persistent Maritime Unmanned Aircraft Systems Program Office (PMA-262) in Patuxent River, Maryland. The Operations Analyst, Junior will primarily support the daily activities of the Program Office and Operations Department. The Operations Analyst, Junior is an in-person, in-office, position with no telework, supporting the Operations Officer with all facets of the Program Office operations.

The Operations Analyst, Junior is responsible and accountable to the Operations Team, the Program Manager and the Deputy Program Manager for day-to-day operations, providing business management support to the Program Office. The Operations Analyst, Junior will manage and support all IPT activities as requested from the IPTLs to effectively achieve program technical, cost, and schedule objectives; advise and participate in the development and coordination of all required program documentation and briefings; and ensure all program requirements and milestones are communicated and coordinated with program leadership.

Performs management, technical, or business case analyses. Collects, completes, organizes and interprets data relating to aircraft/weapon/project acquisition and product programs. Tracks program/project status and schedules. Applies government-instituted processes for documentation, change control management and data management.

Awards / Recognition

Solicit, review, draft, and coordinate award/recognition submissions
Coordinate, draft, and submit Navy End-Of-Tour (EOT) Awards for all Military members. Must be familiar with NDAWS, OPNAV Form 1650, award citation requirements.

Maintain Program Office Calendar and Schedules in Microsoft Office

Serve as backup for Access Control for conference room scheduling.
Coordinate with Executive Assistant (EA) regarding updates and maintenance of PM/DPM calendars.

Familiarity with ETMS2 a plus.
Schedule SVTCs/Tandberg/VOIP/STE calls
Verify attendees for classified meetings using Defense Information System for Security (DISS).
Attend weekly OPS Meetings/Bi-Weekly Program Analyst Meetings.
Utilize digital tools to the maximum extent.
Should be very familiar with Microsoft Teams and FlankSpeed SharePoint Online (SPO).
Assist with the maintenance and updates of the action and milestones (POA&M) for timely completion of all FITREPS and EVALs throughout the Fiscal Year.
Assist with the Setup Summary Groups and Initial Draft reports in eNAVFIT for each cycle in accordance with (IAW) the Navy’s promulgated FITREP and EVAL schedule.

Data Call / Request for Information (RFI) / Questions for the Record (QFR)

Coordination of White Papers

Meetings

Prepare, coordinate, and post evaluation of meetings, conferences and technical reviews to include briefs, issue sheets, white papers, quad charts, and trade studies.
Document meeting minutes and action items.
Track action items / suspense dates.

Microsoft Teams / Flankspeed SharePoint Online (SPO)

Program Office Organization Chart

Maintain and update as required.

Business Analysts will coordinate with client and project leads and IT personnel to streamline processes and increase productivity. The Business Analyst will provide effective communication to all levels of staff for reporting system environment status. The place of performance for this contract is onsite in Suitland, MD.

MUST HAVE AN ACTIVE TOP SECRET SECURITY CLEARANCE

Job Title: Sr Analyst / Analyst, Middle Office - Ventures Distribution Operations
Job Description:
There is a place for you at T. Rowe Price to grow, contribute, learn, and make a difference. We are a premier asset manager focused on delivering global investment management excellence and retirement services that investors can rely on today and in the future. The work we do matters. We invite you to explore the opportunity to join us and grow your career with us.
Sr Analyst / Analyst, Middle Office - Ventures Distribution Operations*
Please note: This position can be filled at either the Sr Analyst / Analyst level.

Role Summary and Scope:

Leads or assists the oversight of trade management responsibilities for Venture Capital Distribution Management Services and associated tasks. Utilizes technical and operational knowledge to resolve complex operating and account issues that often involve multiple internal groups or external parties. Manages relationships with third-party vendors. Works with the team in developing operational goals that are aligned with functional strategy. Identifies, drives, and implements process improvement initiatives with a critical focus on risk, control, and scalability.

Requires in-depth knowledge and expertise in their own job discipline and working knowledge of related disciplines. Leads projects or work streams within broader projects. Accountable for work of self and sometimes others, provides process and standards advice in area of specialty. Works independently, receives minimal guidance. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.

Directly administers and processes the books and records for complex accounts. Coordinates, checks, and validates transfers, settlements, redemptions, and reconciliations. Works under minimal supervision with direct accountability for a set of accounts and/or an administrative process.

General Responsibilities:
Administers a broad range of portfolio transactions, ensuring proper controls and validations are in place and that activities are accurate and compliant. Identifies quality, accuracy, or compliance deficiencies and corrects. Guides less experienced peers and support staff on preventing errors and interpreting process controls.
Serves as a primary liaison between securities operations staff, relationship managers, portfolio managers, custodians, and clients to collect, analyze, and communicate information that impacts accounts. Fields and manages queries from internal or external clients and follows through to resolution.
Prepares complex documentation for settlements, reconciliations, transfers, etc. Instructs team members on adjustments needed to books and records and performs a final quality review, confirming resolution.
Following established controls, checks and validates third-party reconciliations; provides feedback on third-party performance and quality to management. Works with clients and internal stakeholders to prepare account outsourcing plans; stewards account transition process to the end-state infrastructure of outsourced providers.
Analyzes report metrics and develops recommendations to address deficiencies.

Typical Qualifications:
Analyst, Middle Office - Ventures Distributions
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience AND
2+ years of related work experience

Senior Analyst, Middle Office - Ventures Distributions
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience AND
5+ years of related work experience

Preferred Qualifications:
Prior experience with Middle Office Trade Management for operational activities or accounting related to Venture Capital distribution management
People Management experience preferred for Sr Analyst level
Knowledge of third-party vendor oversight, as well as overall Trade Support experience
Strong technical skills – in depth knowledge of systems, processes or function (i.e. Charles River IMS, SQL or similar)
Demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities and deadlines
Demonstrated ability to collaborate in a team environment and build strong relationships with Front Office
Demonstrated initiative to proactively initiate process improvement opportunities
Adept at managing complex issues, identifying alternative solutions

FINRA Requirements: FINRA licenses are not required and will not be supported for this role.

Work Flexibility: This role is eligible for remote work up to two days a week.

We strive for equity, equality, and opportunity for all associates. When we embrace the power of diversity and create an environment where people can bring their authentic and best selves to work, our firm is stronger, and we create greater value for our clients. Competitive pay and bonuses as well as a generous retirement plan and employee stock purchase plan with matching contributions

ASFC Federal AFSS is a premier provider of systems engineering, software engineering, system integration and project management services for real-time, mission-critical defense systems. We are seeking a Records/Documentation Management Specialist to support a NASA contract in Greenbelt, MD and Washington D.C.

Job Title: Product Owner / Sr. Business Analyst - Salesforce
Job Description:
Joining the Stanley Black & Decker team means joining one of the world's largest, fastest growing, and most dynamic companies. Stanley Black & Decker is a world-leading provider of tools and storage, commercial electronic security and engineered fastening systems, with unique growth platforms and a track record of sustained profitable growth.

We are seeking a CRM Product Owner our North America Sales & Marketing Division that is motivated and a self-driven individual.

How You Will Make An Impact...

The CRM Product Owner will be a key member of the CRM & Sales Technology Team. This role will assist and lead with the daily tasks and projects associated with the operations team, Salesforce.com. The successful candidate will support the CRM functionality and sales analytics needed for the commercial and/or retail sales team(s), while working cross-functionality with marketing, sales, operations, and IT as it relates to systems support.

What You Will Be Doing...

This role's core responsibility entails working in partnership with diverse stakeholder groups to:

Uncover their needs and elicit requirements
Define user stories
Create product backlog
Support the organization's CRM platform, including:

Providing operational support, serving as the first tier of troubleshooting support for the sales team
Supporting business requirements
Supporting analytics needs
Work cross-functionally with marketing, sales, operations, and IT as it relates to systems support
Drive the strategy and process improvements for all business partners; work one-on-one with the business leaders to enhance the 360 view of the customer and increase adoption
Handle daily maintenance tasks associated with Salesforce.com
Develop and produce dashboards/reports surrounding customer opportunities, activities, new product trends, territory trends, and goal analysis, leveraging SFDC and other systems
Support the Salesforce.com teams' projects as it relates to system/user settings and data manipulation
Drive the end user strategy as it relates to Salesforce.com with lead generation, job site collaboration, CORE, and end user account maintenance
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop data Event Marketing team and the systems in place to handle event invites, event registration, event follow-up, event ROI, and more
Act as a key player in our Operational training strategy of the team:

Build training modules leveraging our current training tools, as it relates to various aspects of Salesforce.com and other systems the sales team utilizes
Conduct training (live stream and in person) on various Salesforce.com processes
Collaborate with training resources at SBDU to support all required systems training supported by the role
Other duties as assigned

What You Bring To The SBD Team...

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology or a related field, or equivalent combination of education and work experience
3+ years CRM system experience - Salesforce.com preferred
Systems knowledge or ability to learn quickly: Salesforce.com, SAP, Business Warehouse, Power BI
Proven business analysis skills with Salesforce.com or other CRM application
Highly Proficient in all Microsoft Office Software, especially MS Project, Excel, and PowerPoint
Comfort with Zoom and Microsoft Teams
Demonstrated organization and problem-solving skills; detail-oriented, self-reliant
Demonstrated effective time management skills through managing multiple tasks simultaneously
Experience working with multi-disciplinary and geographically dispersed teams; comfort working with people across various countries, time zones, and through language barriers, as needed
Professional verbal and written communication skills with comfort in presenting to all levels of the organization; experience providing technical guidance or influencing the work of others
Knowledge of industry and business principles; Strong understanding of commercial and sales processes
Ability to Independently develops solutions that are thorough, practical, and consistent with functional or customer objectives
Salesforce.com certification(s) a plus
Jira experience a plus

What We Offer:

A comprehensive benefits plan that includes medical, dental, life, disability, 401k, ESPP, vacation, paid holidays.
On-the-job training
Incentives tied to performance
Career advancement within service representative role and overall service center
Discounts on Stanley Black & Decker tools and other partner programs

How You'll Feel
We want our company to be a place you'll want to be - and stay. Being part of our team means you'll get to:

Grow: Be part of our global company with 20+ brands to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths.
Learn: Have access to a wealth of learning resources, including our Lean Academy, Coursera® and online university.
Belong: Experience an awesome place to work, where we have mutual respect and a great appreciation for diversity, equity and inclusion.
Give Back: Help us continue to make positive changes locally and globally through volunteerism, giving back and sustainable business practices.

What's more, you'll get that pride that comes from empowering makers, doers, protectors and everyday heroes all over the world. We're more than the #1 tools company. More than a driving force in outdoor power equipment. More than a global leader in industrial. We're visionaries and innovators. As successful as we've been in the past, we have so much further to go. That's where you come in. Join us!

All qualified applicants to Stanley Black & Decker are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or any other protected characteristic.

We Don't Just Build The World, We Build Innovative Technology Too.

Joining the Stanley Black & Decker team means working in an innovative, tech-driven and highly collaborative team environment supported by over 58,000 professionals in 60 countries across the globe. Here, you'll get the unique chance to impact some of the world's most iconic brands including STANLEY TOOLS, DEWALT, CRAFTSMAN, MAC TOOLS and Black + Decker. Your ideas and solutions have the potential to reach millions of customers as we work together to write the next chapter in our history. Come build with us and take your career to new heights.

Who We Are

We're the World's largest tool company. We're industry visionaries. We're solving problems and advancing the manufacturing trade through innovative technology and our Industry 4.0 Initiative. We are committed to ensuring our state-of-the-art "smart factory" products and services provide greater quality to our customers & greater environmental and social value to our planet. We are unique in that we have a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, but that hasn't stopped us from evolving into a vibrant, diverse, global growth company.

We pride ourselves on being an awesome place to work. We respect and embrace differences because that's how the best work gets done. You'll find we like to have fun here, too.

You'll help us continue to make positive changes in the local communities where we work and live as well as in the broader world through volunteerism, giving back and sustainable business practices.

Who We Are: ThinkTek is a fast-growing Certified SBA 8(a) and Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) company. We specialize in providing management and technology consulting services to support the business and technology modernization efforts of the Federal Government. ThinkTek was formed with the specific purpose of providing its clients a tailored solution around Program & Project Management, Strategic Planning, and IT Operations.

Position Description: ThinkTek is seeking an Security Specialst with an active security clearance. This Industrial Security Oversight Specialist (ISOS) position supports DCSA’s risk-based industrial security oversight mission by providing impactful pre-Security Review research and analysis relevant to the National Industrial Security Program (NISP). Research sources vary, but are primarily limited to commercial and government databases, controlled unclassified information (CUI), and publicly available information (PAI). Currently, due to COVID-19 mitigation efforts initiated by DCSA, a hybrid work arrangement of telework and on-site support temporarily exists.

Key Responsibilities include:

Producing impactful research and analysis of potential risks to cleared defense contractors (CDC) and Department of Defense (DoD) programs.
Identifying and reporting potential vulnerabilities associated with the CDC.
Identifying and reporting possible OPSEC or other security issues associated with the CDC.
Identifying and reporting possible violations of 32 Code of Federal Regulation (CFR) National Industrial Security Program Operating Manual (NISPOM) Part 117 requirements.
Authoring professional work products and meeting established deadlines.
Working in a collaborative on-site work environment at DCSA or independently through customer approved telework.
Provide security oversight as the primary DoD security interface for cleared contractor facilities relative to the establishment and maintenance of a security program in compliance with the NISP.
Responsible for handling more difficult, complex, and challenging industrial security issues within the NAESOC area of responsibility.
Identify and conduct administrative inquiries of serious security violations.
The ability to set well-defined and realistic personal goals and display a high level of initiative, effort, and commitment towards completing assignments in a timely manner.
Facilitate integration of the counterintelligence (CI) methodology into administration of the NISP and provides CI information and guidance to internal and external stakeholders.

Qualifications & Clearance Requirements:

Bachelor's degree.
At least one (1) years of experience with National Industrial Security System (NISS), and the Defense Information System for Security - Joint Verification System (DISS-JVS)
Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
Knowledge of the principles of OPSEC and OSINT.
Familiarity with new CUI guidance and directives.
Ability to understand and apply the principles of research to analyze, evaluate, and interpret raw data collected from multiple sources.
Current Top-Secret (TS) security clearance verifiable through DISS-JVS, and prior to start date.

Preferred Skill Sets of Qualified Candidates:

At least five (3) years' relevant experience in business analysis, intelligence, counterintelligence or industrial security.
Familiarity with the NISP and 32 CFR NISPOM 117 requirements.
Comprehensive knowledge of Microsoft Office software packages.

In addition to highly competitive salaries, ThinkTek offers a great benefits package to ensure we attract, motivate, and retain our talented employees.

ThinkTek offers telework and other flexible work arrangements to the greatest extent possible.

ThinkTek LLC is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

At Franklin Templeton, everything we do is focused on one thing – delivering better client outcomes. We do that by partnering closely with our clients, assessing their strategic needs, and identifying the solution or solutions that can meet the challenge. Over 9,500 employees working in 30 countries around the world are dedicated to servicing investment solutions for our clients in more than 155 countries. For more than 75 years our success has been a direct result of the talent, skills and persistence of our people, and we are looking for qualified candidates to join our team.
The Compensation Analyst sits within HR and is a key role responsible for leveraging data analytics and technical expertise to maintain compensation programs. The role provides global reporting of competitive pay practices and variable compensation administration, with an emphasis on data modeling. This data is often enterprise wide and will be used by HR, Finance, and Business Unit leaders to help inform recommendations and analysis for the business.
What are the ongoing responsibilities of this position?
Variable Compensation Administration: Maintain and implement monthly compensation accruals by analyzing data and ensuring data accuracy. Model changes to plans and research and report out the plan mechanics.
Data Analysis and Data Visualization:
Create compelling data visualizations and dashboards (using tools like Tableau or Power BI) to communicate complex compensation insights to stakeholders effectively.
Proficiently use data analytics tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Alteryx) to analyze compensation data, identify trends, and provide data-driven insights to inform decision-making.
Maintain documentation of compensation processes, data sources, and analytical methodologies.
Advanced Excel Skills: Experience with Excel functions and formulas to create complex analyses and manage large datasets efficiently.
Market Research: Conduct in-depth market research using compensation survey data, online databases, and benchmarking tools to ensure the organization's compensation remains competitive.
HRIS Expertise: Experience with Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) and compensation software (e.g., Workday, MarketPay, Compose) to maintain accurate compensation records, configure systems for compensation planning, and generate reports.
Compliance and Auditing: Ensure compliance with compensation-related regulations and conducting audits using data analytics to identify and rectify discrepancies or issues.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with HR, finance, and IT departments to integrate compensation data into broader business processes.
What ideal qualifications, skills and experience would help someone to be successful?
5+ years related experience in Financial Analysis, Business Analysis, or Human Resources
Previous experience in Investment Management or Financial Services industries a plus.
Bachelor’s degree, further education a plus
Comfortable working with and analyzing large sets of data and presenting results that tell a clear and compelling story
Strong analysis skills with ability to communicate findings in a clear, concise manner
Demonstrated ability to build relationships with and influence people at all levels of the organization
Adaptable with the ability to deal with ambiguity and develop a course of action
Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills
Proficiency with data analytics tools (Excel, SQL, Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI etc)
Familiarity with Workday and/or other HR Information Systems would be an advantage
Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational and interpersonal skills
Highly detail driven with emphasis on confidentiality, time sensitivity and accuracy
Analytical, passionate about data, numbers, and information
Excellence in complex problem solving with an emphasis on creative and unique perspectives
Experience working in a global business environment
Compensation Range: Along with base compensation, other compensation is offered such as a discretionary bonus, 401k plan, health insurance, and other perks. There are several factors taken into consideration in making compensation decisions including but not limited to location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. At Franklin Templeton, we apply a total reward philosophy where all aspects of compensation and benefits are taken into consideration in determining compensation. The salary, benefits and variable rewards will reflect the seniority of the position and a competitive market rate. We expect the salary for this position to range between $95,000 to $125,000.

At TAYS, you will have a voice. Your unique perspective will help us to solve complex problems, and we welcome your ideas. Our employees work closely with our customers and develop long-term, trusting relationships. We look for creative thinkers who are not afraid of technical challenges. If you feel you can contribute to our high-tech, high-touch culture, join us, and we will uncover possibilities together.

TAYS is seeking a Business Development Specialist/Analyst to join its Business Development team.

The business development professional will conduct market intel, research, develop relationships, and actively pursue federal business opportunities that support the company's strategic direction. They will work collaboratively with other members of the business development, capture, proposal, marketing, executive, administrative, and technical teams throughout the company to meet revenue and profit goals.

This is a remote position, with up to 25% traveling to visit customers, participate in trade shows, and attend in-person meetings when required. The business development professional must be local to the DMV area.

What You’ll Get to Do

Thoroughly understand the company’s history, capabilities, service offerings, culture, and strategic direction.
Maintain knowledge of current federal procurement cycles, processes, targeted contract vehicles, agencies, opportunities, and agency decision-makers and influencers.
Follow the company’s rigorous business development process to identify, qualify, and pursue opportunities in the federal marketplace that align with the company’s business development strategic and tactical priorities.
Understand target agency needs, work with technical teams to develop innovative solutions linked to customer objectives, position company capabilities and solutions with prospective agencies and teaming partners, assess competition, develop win themes, and foster collaborative customer, prime contractor, and subcontractor relationships.
Handoff knowledge to the Capture/Proposal team to ensure high win percentages.
Prepare action plans, weekly progress reports, and market intel reports in the company’s CRM and data aggregation systems and actively participate in pipeline meetings.
Meet quarterly milestones and annual sales goals.
Protect the organization's value by keeping information confidential and assuring no conflict of interest.
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.

You’ll Bring These Qualifications

Minimum of 3 (3) years of government business development experience. Undergraduate or graduate degree in business or equivalent experience.
In-depth understanding of the federal sales/contracting cycles, teaming regulations, market positioning, competitive analyses, and relationship development.
Ability to organize and prioritize activities to focus on high payoff opportunities.
Excellent CRM record keeping,
Possess active listening skills and emotional intelligence.
Strong analytical and problem-resolution abilities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to develop documents from scratch.
Capable of working independently and as a member of various teams and committees.
Commitment to excellence and high standards.
Acute attention to detail.
Proven ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions.
Communicate professionally and effectively in person, on the phone, electronically, or through other means to individuals and groups.
Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
Desire to learn new technologies and approaches.
Thrives in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment but brings order to chaos.

These Qualifications Would Be Nice to Have

EZ GOVOPPS Market Intelligence web-based tool experience.
Active Clearance

What We Can Offer You:

Remote work in most cases.
The flexibility that allows staff to balance work and personal lives.
Competitive benefits and tuition reimbursement.
Paid time off, 11 paid federal holidays, and two (2) floating holidays.
Quarterly team building or community outreach events.

The Cystic Fibrosis Foundation is a leading healthcare nonprofit organization like no other. For decades, we have been taking major steps and pioneering new ways to advance the mission to find a cure for cystic fibrosis and to provide all people with CF the opportunity to lead long, fulfilling lives by funding research and drug development, partnering with the CF community, and advancing high-quality, specialized care.
We are the global leader in the search for a cure for cystic fibrosis and nearly every CF drug and therapy available today was made possible because of CF Foundation support. We did this not only for the close to 40,000 people living in the U.S. with CF – and the estimated 105,000 people worldwide – but for the people with CF and families who have worked tirelessly to support the mission.
These achievements have required dedication and unwavering commitment from a talented team of CF Foundation employees. We promote an environment that attracts - and retains - a diverse group of talented people who are passionate about eradicating this disease . Join us and you will join an amazing team, devoted to our community, and our mission.
Position Description
The Cystic Fibrosis Foundation (CF Foundation) and its employees embrace their commitment to its core values. These core values are the pillars on which the CF Foundation stand and will continue to sustain us as we move forward.
Keep sight of what really matters: Our decisions are based on what is best for people with cystic fibrosis and their families.
Aspire for excellence in all we do: We take pride in our work. We are committed to continuous learning and improvement.
Stronger together: We collaborate and work together so that we can learn more and achieve more.
Innovate with courage: We embrace challenges. We reach beyond boundaries in pursuit of our vision.
Care about our people: We deeply care about each other and all who support our shared mission. We listen with respect. We support one another.
We are a nonprofit, donor-supported organization that has raised and invested billions of dollars to help develop cystic fibrosis therapies that have changed the lives of people with this disease. Nearly every CF medicine available today was made possible because of Foundation support.
POSITION SUMMARY:
Our highly mission-focused Foundation is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Investment Operations Analyst to join our team. The person in this role will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of the Foundation’s direct Mission Related investments (MRI) portfolio, including valuation, cash management, trade processing, reconciliation, performance reporting, SEC reporting and filing requirements for public direct investments, and coordination of issued stock certificates for private investments. You will work closely with the investment team, external service providers, and other internal stakeholders to ensure the efficient and effective execution of all MRI activities. This is a hybrid role based in Bethesda, MD, and requires 2-3 days per week in the Bethesda office.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Oversee the operational aspects of CFF direct MRI portfolio, including semi-annual valuation of direct private investments, cash management, trade processing, reconciliation, and performance reporting.
Work closely with the Finance department to ensure investment values and cash flow activities are accurately recorded within the Foundation’s accounting system.
Manage SEC reporting and filing requirements for public direct investments, and coordination of issued stock certificates for private investments.
Develop and improve operational processes and procedures under guidance of the Director of Investment Operations to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and best practices.
Work closely with the investment team to understand investment objectives, processes, structures, and constraints, ensuring operational processes align accordingly.
Aid in managing relationships with external service providers, including custodians, administrators, brokers, and stock issuing agencies such as Carta or Continental Securities.
Serve as a knowledge resource on investment operations, providing guidance and support to other team members as needed.
Participate in ad hoc projects and initiatives as required.
Process incoming communications from portfolio companies and initiate proper workflows for related actions, including investment related transactions, and wires payments.
Coordinate execution of new investments’ legal agreements and other documents as needed.
Manage the onboarding process for new investments to ensure accurate inclusion in all internal systems and tracking of relevant terms. Maintain documents in the Foundation’s CRM system.
Collaborate with other internal departments to develop financial dashboards and to execute day-to-day operations and implementation of best practices.
Support audit processes.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or related field; master’s degree in finance, CFA, or CAIA designation is a plus.
Minimum of three years of experience in investment operations and portfolio management, preferably at a Venture Capital or Private Equity firm.
Experience with cash management, trade processing, valuation analyses, and reconciliation.
Knowledge of venture investments including equity, convertible notes, and SAFEs.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements, including SEC reporting, and filing requirements for public direct investments.
Experience with coordination of issued stock certificates process.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with a range of stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS:
Reports to the Director, Investments Operations. No direct reports.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
Normal office environment with little exposure to excessive noise, dust, and temperature.
No heavy lifting required.
Minimal travel (e.g., 2x/yr.) to conferences and meetings, as necessary.
The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of essential functions, responsibilities, or requirements.
Total Rewards: The CF Foundation is committed to offering competitive compensation (base pay and incentive), benefits, and professional development opportunities that maximize our ability to recruit, retain, reward, and motivate a highly-qualified and diverse workforce. Our comprehensive benefits package includes medical, dental, and vision coverage; generous time-off and leave policies; a holistic well-being program; health savings and flexible spending accounts; employer-provided life and disability insurance; retirement savings benefits; and a variety of work-life benefits to support employees and their family members.
The CF Foundation is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to being an employer of choice, not just a good place to work, but a great and inclusive place to work. We strive to recruit and maintain a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, physical or mental disability, color, religious creed, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, sex, marital status, genetic information or testing, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran or any characteristic protected by law.
Reasonable Accommodations: The CF Foundation is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or would like to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at HROps@cff.org.

Unit Description:
Sodexo is seeking a Lead Business Technical Analyst to support our food management systems applications & technology

The Lead Business Technical Analyst translates the business requirements into detailed system requirements for the scope of Food Systems. Maintains functional specifications, coordinates Release Management cycles, creates and maintains internal system integrations escalation procedures. Possesses full technical knowledge of supported systems, but also considers the business implications of the application technology to the current and future business environment.

Will analyze the systems and procedures of their scope to design functional specifications for enhancement. Will interact frequently with internal customers, developers and project managers.

This is a remote role with the preferred candidate residing in the Eastern Standard time zone

The successful candidate will:
Identify areas for systems improvement by interacting with internal customers and analyzing existing systems.
Translate business processes and requirements into system enhancements.
Analyze and decompose complex functional requirements into specifications.
Define application needs, perform gap analysis and identify feasible solutions.
Create/Prepare functional specifications/flowcharts.
Prepare technical user manuals, system configuration documents and other technical reports.
Define controls, conversion procedures and system implementation plans.
Oversee the development of the system as per the specifications.
Lead implementation and document system changes.
Facilitate the change and the configuration management
Monitor the performance, discover variances and propose necessary actions.
Validate the functionality of the end product according to the requirement specifications
Help and support the functional tests plan to ensure the solution is meeting the functional requirements defined by the business.
Is this the right opportunity for you? We are looking for candidates that have/are:


BS in Computer Science, Information Systems or Engineering or equivalent Business degree
Familiarity with application development disciplines (.NET, C#, and/or java)
Experience with PL/SQL (Oracle) and T/SQL (MS-SQL) query with Excel as a data visualization tool – pivot tables
Business Analysis skills including facilitation of requirements, documenting functional specifications and business process flows
2+ years experience in project management, and production systems deployment and support
Skilled in use of Microsoft Visio, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Strong Communication, Negotiation and Organization Skills
Azure Dev Ops/JIRA experience a plus
Food Management Application Experience a plus
Ability to collaborate with multiple departments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to make quality decisions
Understanding of the business
Willingness to undergo continual learning
Ability to persuade and influence
Sodexo offers a full array of benefits including paid time off, holidays, medical, dental, vision, 401K and access to ongoing training and development programs, tuition reimbursement, plus health and wellness programs.


Not the job for you?
At Sodexo, we have numerous IS&T positions that support this and other initiatives with similar goals. Continue your search for IS&T jobs.

Working for Sodexo:
Sodexo fosters a culture committed to the growth of individuals through continuous learning, mentoring and career growth opportunities. Our IS&T team supports 13,000 locations across North America and collaborates with the entire Sodexo Group, spanning 72 countries. Sodexo empowers its employees who have developed a thorough understanding of the organization to create their own career path.

#LI-Remote
What We Offer:
Sodexo offers fair and equitable compensation, partially determined by a candidate's education level or years of relevant experience. While the budgeted range for the position is posted, Sodexo salary offers are based on a candidate's specific criteria, like experience, skills, education and training.
Position Summary:
Top level technical contributor with expertise in particular business processes responsible for formulating system's scope and objectives relative to the company's business plan and industry requirements. Acts independently or as a member of a project team responsible for providing technical guidance concerning the business implications of the application of various systems. Provides technical consulting on complex projects. Devises and/or modifies procedures to solve the most complex technical problems related to computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time, and form of desired results. Creates detailed specifications from which programs will be written.
Qualifications & Requirements:
Basic Education Requirement - Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
Basic Functional Experience - 3 years IT-related experience

Sodexo is an EEO/AA/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer.

You may know McCormick as a leader in herbs, spices, seasonings, and condiments – and we’re only getting started. At McCormick, we’re always looking for new people to bring their unique flavor to our team.
McCormick employees – all 14,000 of us across the world – are what makes this company a great place to work.

The best people deserve the best rewards. In addition to the benefits you’d expect from a global leader (401k, health insurance, paid time off, etc.) we also offer:

Wellbeing programs including Physical, Mental and Financial wellness

SALES OPERATIONS ANALYST
The Sales Operations Analyst will work with their cross functional business partners to drive improved business processes by simplifying and creating more efficient ways of working to improve sales productivity. This role is an integral part of the sales technology eco-system for communication, integrated planning, and reporting. The Sales Operations Analyst will be primarily responsible for the development and delivery of sales support and sales communication materials for the various business units as assigned. The role will support the larger Sales Operations Team with systems management, training, analysis, and reporting.

RESPONSIBILITIES Primary Salesforce.com daily administrator. Oversee the territory management process including setting up brokers, new sales groups, correct territory overlaps and changing/updating user access Conducts audit controls for user validation for Salesforce, BW and TPM Support the onboarding of sales employees and brokers by leading routine trainings on Salesforce and BW reporting Own the maintenance and archiving of documents on Salesforce including price pages Develop and oversee the routine communication process to sales and broker partners including content packs, weekly sales bulletin, and monthly sales newsletters Work with cross functional partners in Trade Marketing on creating and maintaining TPM reports for ad hoc business requests Manage various special projects

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 4-year degree in Sales, Marketing, Information Technology, Information Systems, or Communications Minimum of 2 years of experience with data analytics. Familiarity with salesforce.com or relevant CRM. Self-starter, with strong leadership skills who can build a strong network. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Strong business systems knowledge
Ability to lead the execution of technology application across multi-faceted sales organization (i.e., Salesforce, TPM, BW)
Ability to influence effectively; heavy cross functional interaction with Sales, Finance, Supply Chain, Marketing and Procurement.
Data analytics experience
#LI-SM1
McCormick & Company is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Overview:
The Sales Analyst produces reports, interprets data, and provides recommendations on areas of opportunities for a diversified, complex, and high profile sales division to key decision makers. The position also supports the head of the division in analysis and business planning activities, sales measures and performance, and growth opportunities. This position will actively participate in planning meetings with key leaders as a subject matter sales data and analytical expert.
Responsibilities:
Complete complex data analysis projects to support a variety of initiatives using advanced excel skills and presenting findings in Power Point.
Research and anticipate analytical needs of division including competitor analysis, strategy support, and GAP analysis.
Design and produce ad-hoc and user created reports incorporating multiple systems on a weekly/monthly/quarterly basis and support requests for ad-hoc analysis for Vice President of division and various sales leaders.
Support the head of the division in analysis and business planning activities.
Produce sales materials for division including monthly deal highlights, pricing reference books, business plans, and all other sales related materials.
Produce business plans, and various communication to division associates on behalf of Vice President.
Administer sales monthly incentive plans and is key point person for all related questions.
Other duties, as assigned by the jobholder’s supervisor, may also be required.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in related field and/or equivalent training and work experience
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in finance, marketing, or business analyst role
Proficient PC skills using MS Office and other various computer programs including presentation software
Must be a results-oriented professional with verbal/written communication skills using diplomacy and discretion as well as customer service skills
Ability to multi-task, work independently and/or within a team, pay attention to detail and meet deadlines
Analytic and Reporting skills
Utilize sound judgement and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in fast-paced, high-volume, team environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with a consumer-packaged goods company or data provider (IRI, Nielson)
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel including VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, Match Functions
Strong proficiency with Power Point
Physical Requirements:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to, stand, sit; talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone
Competencies:
Accountable for results which impact the department.
This job description is only a summary of the typical functions of this position, not an exhaustive or comprehensive list of all possible job responsibilities, tasks and duties. Responsibilities, tasks, and duties of individual jobholders may vary from the above description.

In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!

When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.

Job Description:

Ready to be part of a team that tackles defense and data challenges? Want to take your analytic skills to the next level to work on tough projects that will make a huge impact? Parsons is now hiring experienced Business Operations Specialist with a desire to work on projects that change the urban fabric of our community.

Parsons’ extensive experience in this field, combined with your business knowledge, will propel your career forward with opportunity for advancement with top performance. We can offer training, development and opportunities to work on marquee projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our business analysts to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team-oriented environments and who have exceptional communication, analytical and organizational skills.

PROJECT:

Parsons is managing a Technical Services (TS) program for an agency within the Department of Defense to review third party A/E work; conduct studies, analysis, testing and measuring; perform specialized engineering services, planning and design reviews; commissioning services; construction oversight on worldwide delivery orders, and information technology (IT) support.

RESPONSIBLITIES:

Parsons is seeking a Business Operations Specialist support our PMO performing the following:

Gathers data on existing functional group from managers and employees. This includes collecting samples of current procedures, practices, and standards, as well as related documents and forms.
Analyzes data gathered and translates into work process diagrams or reports.
Reviews current work flow captured in work process diagrams and assists in developing recommendations for process improvements. This may involve creating new processes, revising current processes, and/or automating processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness within the organization.
Assists with developing recommendations and guidance documentation for new or revised processes (e.g., flow diagrams, procedures, manuals, reports, specifications, procurement documents, etc.). Ensures proper translation of technical information from functional groups into document formats that are easily understood by the end user.
Submits recommendations (including guidance documentation) to functional management for their review and approval, and incorporates any subsequent recommendations into the new processes prior to publication.
Identifies specific business processes that are targets for immediate and long-term development. Works with functional management to set goals for these targeted areas and to assign priorities for study and intervention.
Prepares plans and schedules, status reports and performance evaluations.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Project or Construction Management, Information Technology or related field (or equivalent experience)
8+ years of related work experience.
Working knowledge of facilities processes is preferred.
Must be US Citizen
Active TS/SCI with Polygraph clearance required.

SKILLS/COMPETENCIES:

Business/facilities background with understanding of the processes used for business analysis planning.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
Written and oral communication skills appropriate for the position, including the ability to speak very well in basic professional situations and present technical data in a logical manner that is easy to understand (may include communication via telephone, in person, or presenting to small groups). Ability to write moderately complex documents (may include emails, memos, procedures, presentations). Communicates with a wide variety of individuals (employees and managers) throughout the organization and outside of the organization (i.e. clients, vendors).
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Strong attention to detail.
Excellent analytical skills translating technical functional information into established end user documentation meeting the needs of a global, culturally diverse organization.
Ability to be part of a team and lead team members, coordinating day to day activities as well as special projects to assure timely completion.

Minimum Clearance Required to Start:

Top Secret SCI w/Polygraph

PSI Pax, Inc has an exciting opportunity for a Program Analyst - Journeyman with NHDSM Tool experience to support NAVAIR NBO located in Patuxent River, MD.

Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities:

Under broad supervision, provides support to the NAVAIR Navy Enterprise Resource Planning (Navy ERP) Business Office (NBO). Provides technical and functional expertise to ensure the Navy ERP solution supports NAVAIR Financial Accounting business operational requirements. Monitors and resolves user trouble calls, support data calls, develop and maintain process documentation, training materials and knowledge management articles, and develop, collect, and analyze business metrics. Support includes participation in NAVAIR and Navy ERP working groups and requires coordination and communication with principle command stakeholders, NAVAIR end users, and external stakeholders. Following are specific tasks that support business solutions sustainment, production operations, and business initiatives:

Perform analysis and provide recommendations for resolution, and/or workarounds, for system deficiencies
Support the analysis and coordination of NAVAIR business needs and develop white papers, justification, and/or system engineering documents for new/enhanced functional capabilities
Evaluate Navy ERP requirements to determine impacts to NAVAIR business operations
Assess outstanding Navy ERP work items for relevance and impact to NAVAIR business operations to provide work prioritization recommendations in support of Navy ERP monthly/quarterly release planning
Perform and coordinate review with key NAVAIR stakeholders of Navy ERP functional design change documentation to ensure accurate and complete business requirements definition; consolidate NAVAIR feedback to Navy ERP functional team
Evaluate Navy ERP releases and coordinate activities to identify and minimize impacts of system changes on NAVAIR business operations
Coordinate quality assurance and test activities in support of changes to Navy ERP software, NAVAIR or Navy business process changes, and/or Navy ERP Software Upgrades to assess impacts to NAVAIR and recommend corrective actions
Identify test candidates to the NBO Test Manager via the provided tools, and ensure testing methods, test dates and test plans are in place for testing. Track status and record progress and results in the NBO provided tools or other format as necessary.
Perform analysis and provide recommendations for resolution or mitigation of risks related to Segregation of Duties conflicts N0042120R0153 Page 15 of 77
Support the development/maintenance of NAVAIR end user training documentation and activities to update/maintain the NAVAIR Navy ERP training environment (e.g., master data build and troubleshoot functional issues) for NAVAIR end user training
Maintain NAVAIR Business Process Rules
Support development and implementation of interface processes
Support research and resolution of issues discovered during interface processing.
Inform command stakeholders of batch or interface processing issues, resolution actions, and status
Work with command stakeholders to integrate and maintain the Navy ERP solution into Business Contingency Plans that can be invoked as needed in the event of production system downtime
Monitor the Navy ERP production schedule for job failures and deviations
Perform analysis to evaluate impacts of current and emerging internal and external business initiatives affecting NAVAIR business operations within the Navy ERP solution (e.g., Business Process Standardization, Audit Readiness, Cost Management, Material Acquisition and Management)
Support the implementation of process changes and/or Navy ERP capabilities in support of current and emerging internal and external business initiatives
Evaluate opportunities for NAVAIR utilization of Navy ERP capabilities to support continual process improvement activities
Perform assessment of future functionality deployments usability/applicability to the NAVAIR command (e.g., asset management, inventory management, warehouse management, material management, depot, supply deployments)
Participate in NAVAIR and Navy level working groups and facilitate collaboration among NAVAIR key stakeholders, other Navy Commands and Navy Process Owners to address business requirements supported by the Navy ERP system
Participate with the implementation and sustainment of processes to ensure full financial statement audibility
Support the Navy ERP Technical Upgrade and the subsequent move from SAP ECC 6.0 and SCM to SAP S/4 HANA Business Suite to include the development of test scenarios, execution of test scripts, and identification and resolution of issues or defects encountered during testing
Support the development, implementation and sustainment of business processes focused on capturing labor actuals (i.e., hours and cost execution) in Navy ERP
Support the integration of the Command’s property and inventory portfolios and functions into the Navy ERP solution
Required Qualifications:

Three (3) to ten (10) years of related experience.
Of the minimum required experience, at least four (4) years must be in program management, technical or a business analysis discipline and two (2) years must be professional experience in efforts supporting corporate business operations.

Desired Qualifications:

Proficient in MS Office
Proficient in the NAVAIR Help Desk Service Management (NHDSM) Tool
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must be able and willing to support an evolving and dynamic environment and able to adapt to emergent requirements
Required Education:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Financial, Business Administration, Human Resources, or related field.
An additional four (4) years of experience (total of 7-14) and an associate’s degree or an additional six (6) years (total of 9-16) of work experience may be substituted for the Bachelor’s Degree.


PSI Pax, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation or genetic information.


PSI Pax, Inc. is an E-Verify Participant

cyDaptiv Solutions is seeking an energetic and detail-oriented professional to join our team as a Business Development Analyst. In this position, you will play a crucial role in supporting our business development and opportunity evaluation process. Your responsibilities will include identifying government contract opportunities that align with our capabilities and supporting our opportunity gate review process. This analysis will enable our Business Development (BD) team to determine if our company's capabilities, past performance, business relationships align with identified opportunities. This position offers room for growth and advancement within our government contracting efforts.

Government Contract Analyst Responsibilities:

Conduct thorough evaluations of government RFPs and Performance Work Statements (PWS) to understand project requirements and performance expectations.
Create detailed requirement documents (gap analysis) that highlight the alignment between our company's capabilities and past performance experience with the RFP and PWS requirements.
Collaborate closely with our Business Development (BD) team to provide them with the information needed to make informed decisions about contract opportunities.
Assist in determining the suitability and viability of pursuing specific government contract opportunities.
Continuously identify and suggest improvements to our opportunity evaluation and requirements documentation processes.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree
3-5 years of experience working in a DoD and/or Federal contractor environment, supporting business development activities.
Knowledge of government contracting vehicles and information portals. SAM, GovWin, GovTribe, GSA eBuy, etc.
Familiarity with the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) and Defense Federal Acquisition Regulations Supplement (DFARS).
Experience with Microsoft Excel, Word, Project, and other office automation and collaboration tools.
Excellent communication, organization, and interpersonal skills.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.

Job Type:

Part-time: Roughly 20 hours a week
Role is Remote

Compensation:

$35+ per hour

Athenix Cyber & SIGINT is seeking an Operations Requirements Analyst level 3 to work in the Annapolis Junction, MD area.

Ten (10) years' experience in Operations Requirements on programs and contracts of similar scope, type and complexity is required of which five (5) years shall be in the Intelligence Community (IC).
Bachelor's degree in engineering or a related field (e.g., systems engineering, mathematics, information technology, operations research). A High School diploma and fourteen (14) years' experience would also be acceptable.
Must have a thorough understanding of US Armed Forces tactical SIGINT operations, military capabilities, and SIGINT concepts of operation.

Job Description:

Provide technical direction in national and tactical cryptologic capabilities and facilitate requirements gathering by coordinating technical exchange meetings (and other meetings as needed) with the Services, Combat Support Agencies (CSAs), systems engineers, data modelers, and other members of the requirements team.
Provide comprehensive definition and documentation updates for deliverables and coordinate with analysts, managers, and seniors within Unified Cryptologic System (UCS) to verify operational requirements to assist a customer that advocates and facilitates interoperability, commonality, modernization, and integration with the US SIGINT System.

Note: Position requires occasional travel.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs):

Thorough understanding of US Armed Forces tactical SIGINT operations, military capabilities, and SIGINT concepts of operation.
US Air Force SIGINT experience.
Ability to communicate with Service Cryptologic Offices.
Familiarity with Technical SIGINT Operations.
Experience in the intelligence cycle, information operations, signals intelligence technical expertise, an understanding of the National signals collection system, and familiarity with the varying levels of tactical operations and analysis taking place within the military services.

technical SIGINT operations, cryptology, service cryptologic office, SIGINT, Air Force, USAF

Minimum of bachelor's degree in engineering or a related field (e.g., systems engineering, mathematics, information technology, operations research).
High school diploma and fourteen years' experience would also be acceptable.

Job Title: Foreign Military Sales Financial Analyst, Junior
Job Description:
As a solutions-based company, Precise Systems is focused on innovation in support of the warfighters and aligning our expertise to deliver the highest quality of service. Powered by our highly skilled workforces, we provide expert consultation on network and weapons systems acquisition programs, maintenance/modernization programs, and sustainment programs with solutions in Digital Transformation, Advanced Engineering, Physical Sciences Research, Platform Lifecycle Support, and Technical Services. Since our establishment, we have demonstrated and perfected our ability to manage the customer's needs, no matter how complex – offering exceptional service and the Precise solution.

We are currently looking for a Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Financial Analyst to support the H-60 Multi-Mission Helicopter Program (PMA-299). The ideal candidate will be able to perform the following duties and have the required experience and education.

Functional Description: Conduct quantitative analyses of information requiring financial and/or accounting support. Provides support to the activity Accounting Department, Budget Department, Financial Systems Department, or Business Operations Department, or other organizational support elements and other activities. Performs managerial/cost accounting, budgeting, funding execution, manpower management, workload, acquisition, document management, system support, and financial analyses to provide efficient allocation and effective utilization of financial resources, making recommendations for improving operations, systems, and reporting. Utilizes Navy ERP to perform financial execution functions. Provides support with a variety of management activities, corporate initiatives, special projects, and data calls which could have significant impact on the organization and its business operations. Demonstrates knowledge of DoD Federal Management Regulations (FMR), Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), Planning, Programming, Budgeting, and Execution, and DoN procurement policies and procedures.

Key Qualifications/Tasking

Provide support for budget development, execution tracking, and the generation and tracking of financial documents using various Navy and DoD electronic data systems such as Management Information System for International Logistics (MISIL), Navy Enterprise Resources Program (N-ERP), SharePoint, Case Reconciliation Tool (CRT), current work planning tools, and other systems not yet required by FMS to include but not limited to Common Spend Plan Tool (CSPT), and Integrated Data Environments (IDE). Conduct quantitative analyses of information affecting investment programs of public or private institutions.
Assist the Program Manager and Resource Sponsor in the coordination, upgrades and submits of the Financial Management Reviews (FMR), Program Management Review (PMR), Navy International Programs Office (NIPO), Defense Security Assistance Management System (DSAMS) Manpower Sheets, FMS Case budget drills as well as coordinate inputs and ensure that data provided is in an acceptable format.
Maintain, consolidate, and organize databases, such as the Case Reconciliation Tool (CRT), of budgetary status information, based on information provided through the Management Information System for International Logistics (MISIL), Navy Enterprise Resources Program (N-ERP) and Defense Integrated Financial System (DIFS).
Perform budget execution, including tracking the status of obligations and expenditures in detail by Country and Case, and program for financial reconciliation for all funds; update/develop spreadsheets and financial status briefs and presentations.
Prepare financial charts and input for briefings supporting mid-year reviews, budget execution reviews, spend plan reviews, and various other program briefings.
Track and monitor financial documents through the routing and approval process
Participate in preliminary financial reviews and prepare monthly and quarterly reports for the IPT Lead and FMS Case Manager.
Performs business financial management activities in support of pre-case, case execution, reconciliation, and case closure activities
Analyzes total program financial requirements for the development of P&A, LOA, amendments, modifications, revisions, and other pricing elements
Applies knowledge of financial management functions, processes, and analytical methods to evaluate program information required for the Budget Financial Manager (BFM) and Program/Case Manager
Demonstrates knowledge of DoD Federal Management Regulations (FMR), Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), PPBE, and DoN procurement policies and procedures experience

Required Education:

BS or BA degree in a business, management or relevant technical discipline.

Allowable Substitution:

AS or AA degree and an additional four (4) years of experience can be substituted for a BS or BA degree OR an additional six (6) years of experience may be substituted for the BS or BA.

Required Experience: Has less than three years of experience supporting military program acquisition. A demonstrated working knowledge of DoD Financial Analyst support is desired.

Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance. Due to the sensitivity of customer-related requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required.

Further, Precise Systems will not discharge or, in any different manner, discriminate against employees or applicants because they choose to inquire about, discuss, or disclose their compensation or the compensation of another employee or applicant.

Company Description


The University of Maryland Medical System is a 14-hospital system with academic, community and specialty medical services reaching every part of Maryland and beyond. UMMS is a national and regional referral center for trauma, cancer care, Neurocare, cardiac care, women’s and children’s health and physical rehabilitation. UMMS is the fourth largest private employer in the Baltimore metropolitan area and one of the top 20 employers in the state of Maryland. No organization will give you the clinical variety, the support, or the opportunities for professional growth that you’ll enjoy as a member of our team.



Job Description


I. General Summary:

Responsible for planning, coordinating, monitoring and implementing complex IT Programs to meet organizational goals. Oversees and provides guidance to the staff responsible for the department’s projects. Supervises activities of a small department, major project and several smaller projects. Manages project management tools within the department. Makes decisions on personnel actions (hiring, terminations, promotions). Controls revenues and/or expenses within an operating unit and responsible for meeting budget goals and objectives. Provides input to policy level direction regarding standards and budget constraints.

II. Principal Responsibilities and Tasks:

The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. These are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by personnel so classified.

1. Manages the operation, monitoring, maintenance, development, upgrade and support of information technology applications.

2. Work with stakeholders to define business and system requirements for existing and new implementations.

3. Collaborates with analysts, technical staff and application owners with all phases of the System Development Life Cycle and Project Management standards.

4. Plans, execute and finalize projects according to timeline and budget.

5. Establishes productive relationships with customer groups and vendors. Responsible for assisting Director with customer satisfaction, vendor contracts and associated invoices, quality control, problem management and resolution within the business and financial product lines and across multiple facilities.

6. Determine staffing requirements and supervise the work of all direct reports to ensure effective and efficient departmental functions. Serve as resource, primary advisor, and mentor for all direct reports.

A. Hire, orient, train, conduct performance evaluations, handle disciplinary issues, and provide an open and goal oriented work environment with establish clear and concise work procedures and productivity standards.

B. Develops personnel by providing opportunities and training programs to enhance individual employee’s career development.

C. Ensures full staff competency of technologies, policies and practices across the division.

D. Manages activities of contractors.
7. Implements and enforces departmental policies and procedures.

A. In coordination with departmental management, ensures compliance with regulatory and audit agency requirements.

B. Develops performance improvement initiatives aimed at improving customer service, operating costs, departmental functions/departmental productivity.

C. Develops and executes effective control process and compliance monitoring procedures to ensure risks are measured, monitored, controlled, and mitigated.

D. Represents the department at various meetings, task force groups, quality councils and with other members of the UMMS.

8. Assess, manages and monitor employee satisfaction results and action plans, and assist Senior Management in the execution of improvement action plans.

9. Develop, establish and implement departmental goals and objectives for UMMS in collaboration with IT Leadership.

10. Provide Information Services and Technology guidance and assistance to customer base and ensure process/policies are maintained in accordance with established UMMS standards.

11. Participates in change management responsibilities.



Qualifications


III. Education and Experience:

1. Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Health, Science, Business or an equivalent level of professional experience required. Master’s Degree preferred.

2. Eight years progressively responsible experience in information technology, including one year performing application and/or programming analysis, or equivalent, such as business analysis, is required. Two years experience in managing projects and resources.

3. Certification in Service Management, Project Management, or Business Analysis is preferred.

4. Experience working in a healthcare environment is preferred.


IV. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

1. Effective verbal and written communication skills are necessary to advise and consult with user personnel and make formal presentations of project findings and recommendations.

2. Excellent organization skills: demonstrates confidence, creativity.

3. Demonstrated leadership ability, effectiveness in supervising, evaluating, training, discipline and motivating management and technical staff successfully is required.

4. Demonstrates ability to maintain professional growth and business affiliations to keep abreast of technical advances.

5. High level of proficiency and demonstrated effectiveness in problem-solving and to implementing new programs related to increased departmental and organizational operating efficiency.

6. Highly effective oral and written communication skills are required to train and supervise employees, and to work closely with Senior Information Systems management, hospital administration, and end user personnel effectively.

7. Ability to understand and adhere to systems security and control procedures in accordance with departmental, vendor standards and regulatory bodies. Supervise, teach and monitor compliance.

8. Ability to organize and lead projects.


Additional Information


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
