FOUNDATION FOR SUCCESS (*_Basic Qualifications_*)

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or a related field.
Masters or Doctorate degree may substitute for required experience
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Public Trust. Contract requirement.
8+ years of experience with analysis, design and developing systems using skills identified in this requirement.

FACTORS TO HELP YOU SHINE (*_Required Skills_*)
These skills will help you succeed in this position:

Experience building complex reports, dashboards, scorecards, and visualizations using Tableau or similar tools such as WebFOCUS, MS Power BI, or similar tools.
Experience in the creation and use of visualizations and conducting data analysis. Critical thinking, problem solving and the ability to work independently or collaboratively is required.
Thorough understanding of data warehouse techniques (dimensional models and aggregation techniques).
Experience with Tableau Server configuration and maintenance of project, group security, and permissions).
Experience writing advanced SQL queries and designing data models in Greenplum, Postgres, SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, and DB2.
IT customer service experience providing user support to include providing technical support/resolutions and direction on non-technical aspects of the software use at SSA.
Strong written and oral communication skills including the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical/business stakeholders and conversely, communicate business information to a technical audience.
Experience in adapting to changing environments. Candidate must be willing to exercise patience and be able to adapt and respond to rapidly changing priorities while maintaining a respectful and positive attitude with team members and stakeholders.
Experience in conducting training sessions or facilitating business presentations such as user groups.
Possess the ability to drive insights into actions that improve the teams service delivery or user experience.

HOW TO STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD(Desired Skills)
Showcase your knowledge of modern development through the following experience or skills:

Working knowledge of Tableau Prep.
Working knowledge of WebFOCUS 9, SharePoint and using Microsoft Teams as a documentation repository and communications channel with stakeholders.
Experience in requirement elicitation and documentation.
Experience conducting validation and/or user acceptance testing.

​Master's with 5+ years experience or Bachelors's with 7+ years experience

As a solutions-based company, Precise Systems is focused on innovation in support of the warfighters and aligning our expertise to deliver the highest quality of service. Powered by our highly skilled workforces, we provide expert consultation on network and weapons systems acquisition programs, maintenance/modernization programs, and sustainment programs with solutions in Digital Transformation, Advanced Engineering, Physical Sciences Research, Platform Lifecycle Support, and Technical Services. Since our establishment, we have demonstrated and perfected our ability to manage the customer's needs, no matter how complex – offering exceptional service and the Precise solution.

We are currently seeking a Financial Analyst to support our Patuxent River, MD customer. The Financial Analyst will provide Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Case support to the PMA-280 FMS Team.

Functional Description: Supports the efforts and actions of the Case Manager/Program Managers/Team Lead for various Foreign Military Sales (FMS) programs. With other members of the Security Cooperation team, and under direction of the Case Manager/Program Manager/Team Lead, assists the Case Manager in analyzing and managing all aspects of FMS casework in accordance with the Arms Export Control Act, the Security Assistance Management Manual (SAMM) and the International Traffic in Arms Regulation (ITAR) as well as applicable DoD Acquisition policy guidance.

Duties will include, but are not limited to:

Develop estimates for Price and Availability (P&A), Letters of Offer and Acceptance (LOA); provide recommendations for the development of P&A data; and provide estimate information on individual case elements. Input data into the Defense Security Assistance Management System (DSAMS) for P&As, LOAs, Amendments, and Modifications. The contractor shall provide the program office support in developing National Security Agency (NSA) Authorization to Sell Letters, 36(b) Congressional Notification Letters, Non-Recurring Costs Letters, Missile Technology Control Regime (MTCR) Remarks, Anti-Tamper Remarks, and Yockey Waivers.
Perform financial management support including development of pre-case pricing data; preparation and execution of financial documents in the various case management and financial systems; providing financial analysis of FMS, potential FMS and ICDP programs; tracking funds commitments, obligations and expenditures; assisting in the development and presentation of financial briefing materials; developing and maintaining a financial status report; and reconciling FMS cases in preparation for closure.
Other duties as assigned

Required Education: MS or MA degree in a business, management or relevant technical discipline is desir

Allowable Substitution: BS or BA degree and an additional four (4) years of experience OR an additional six (6) years of experience may be substituted for a BS or BA degree.

Required Experience: At least ten (10) years of experience in program management, technical or business analysis discipline; and included in the ten (10) years, there must be at least four (4) years professional experience in technical efforts supporting major weapon systems and components development. Demonstrated experience in program/project status tracking and schedules. Demonstrated knowledge of SECNAV, OPNAV and OSD policy and documentation related to PPBS, life-cycle management of military acquisition programs (as specified in the DoD 5000 series), Military Interdepartmental Procurement Requests, Work requests, Requisitions, Contract Data Requirements Lists, and DD 254.

Desired Experience: FMS case support experience, Advanced excel knowledge, strong communication skills




Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance. Due to the sensitivity of customer-related requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required.

Company Name: Air Combat Effectiveness Consulting Group, LLC
Job Description:
Full-time

Description

POSITION DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Performs critical program management, technical, or business analysis of major DoD acquisition systems and provides recommendations to ensure program success. Collects, completes, organizes and interprets technical data information relating to aircraft acquisition and product programs. Applies scientific, mathematics and statistical methodologies to the study and analysis of
technological problems in relation to engineering and scientific development of processes, systems and equipment. Uses mathematical and computerized modeling and other analytical techniques, to design procedures for and execute experiments, test and evaluations on weapons systems or equipment.

Requirements

MINIMUM TANGIBLE REQUIREMENTS:
At least ten (10) years of recent and relevant technical experience in program management, technical or business analysis discipline, related to weapon systems acquisition and life cycle management, is required; with a minimum of six (6) years out of the previous ten (10) years of recent and relevant experience related to analysis and planning.
Demonstrated knowledge of SECNAV, OPNAV and OSD policy and documentation related to Planning, Programming and Budgeting System (PPBS), Military Interdepartmental Procurement Requests (MIPR), Work Requests, Requisitions, CDRLs and DD Form 254 (as specified in the DoD 5000 series) is required.
Must have experience processing program acquisition, funding and contract documentation for military programs. Demonstrated experience in the program/project status, earned value management and schedules is required.
Position requires a MS or MA degree from an accredited college or university in Business, Management or a related technical discipline. ALLOWABLE SUBSTITUTION: A BS or BA degree from an accredited college or university in Business, Management or a related technical discipline and an additional four (4) years of recent and relevant technical experience may be substituted for a MS or MA degree. These four (4) years of experience are in addition to the required minimum of ten (10) years to meet the “Experience” requirements below, therefore, requiring a total of fourteen (14) years of experience.
ACE Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business that provides expertise in the operational application of current and future airborne weapons systems, with an emphasis on their lethality and survivability in the Battlespace. Our employees draw from a wealth of personal, professional and company experience to provide our Nation’s decision makers with the knowledge required to optimally equip our Armed Services with affordable, lethal and survivable weapons systems.

We serve as our customers’ most trusted agents in their goal of producing enterprise-wide survivability investments and executable programs. We fill key roles within customer offices, offering critical knowledge regarding design, development, procurement, and test and evaluation of new and upgraded weapons and platforms.

ACE Group’s philosophy is simple: Our success must be grounded on service and honest relationships. We focus on meeting the needs of our customers and employees, and trust that with those satisfied employees and satisfied customers, the business will take care of itself.

ACE Consulting Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, ACE Consulting Group complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Job Title: Senior Program Analyst – Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Business Development
Job Description:
Senior Program Analyst – Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Business Development Analyst

RBC, Inc. has a position at Patuxent River, MD for a Senior Program Analyst – FMS Business Development Analyst to support the efforts and actions of the PMA-290F MPRA International Programs Director and the Business Development Lead relating to case development for various FMS P-8A Poseidon Aircraft programs. Under the direction of the International Programs Director/Country Case Manager, assists in analyzing and managing all aspects of FMS casework in accordance with the Arms Export Control Act, the Security Assistance Management Manual (SAMM) and the International Traffic in Arms Regulation (ITAR), as well as applicable DoD Acquisition policy guidance. This position requires experience in defense acquisition program management related to aircraft platform acquisition and life-cycle management; DoD Instruction (DoD) 5000.2, DoD Directive (DoDD) 5530.03 (International Agreements); demonstrated knowledge of the principles, policies, and practices of FMS acquisition to plan, organize, and coordinate critical aspects of the development, production, execution, and sustainment of systems, subsystems, and equipment to execute a successful program within cost, schedule and performance; demonstrated knowledge of the SYSCOM Security Cooperation Office (SSCO) programs to include the understanding of the FMS sales process from releasability, pre-case development, case development, implementation, execution, to closure in accordance with the Security Assistance Management Manual (SAMM), DoD 5105.38; strong interpersonal skills that ensure collaborative and trusting relationships with the team, peers, customers, stakeholders and leadership; strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to develop and deliver executive-level presentations; possess knowledge of security cooperation/participation/offsets activities through FMS channels; proven ability to manage multiple broad ranges of diverse projects simultaneously, quickly adapt and navigate in a highly demanding environment; the ability to identify, monitor and manage risk as it relates to the execution of the FMS program; and be proactive to ensure processing of case documentation in an expedient manner.

This position requires a BS or BA degree in Business Management, or relevant technical discipline and a minimum of ten (10) years of experience in program management or technical/business analysis discipline. Eight (8) years of relevant experience may be substituted for the college degree. Six (6) years out of the prior ten (10) years of experience supporting FMS business development activities associated with major weapon systems and components, as well as P-8A aircraft systems knowledge is desired. No travel required. A current Secret security clearance will be required.

Work Location: NAS Patuxent River, MD. Hybrid (Remote) working arrangement possible.

Job Title: Tier I Network Operations Center NOC Analyst
Job Description:
Tier I Network Operations Center NOC Analyst

Job Category: Information Technology

Time Type: Full time

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: None

Employee Type: Regular

Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%

Type of Travel: Local

CACI is seeking Tier I NOC Analysts to support a 24x7x365 enterprise operations center. Analysts will be responsible for monitoring network dashboards, analyzing problems, troubleshooting, coordinating, and reporting of all operational information concerning the enterprise network infrastructure. This is a customer facing position that requires significant experience in customer service and the ability to remain calm, tolerant, and professional in a stressful and demanding environment. We are currently hiring to fill rotating schedules.

**Must be flexible, able, and willing to work *rotating shifts, including some weekends**

What You'll Get to Do:

Provide first-line investigation and diagnosis of all incidents, logging all details and prioritization codes for all incidents.
Conduct technical services and support at the Tier I level, including WAN and LAN connectivity, routers, firewalls, and security.
Installation and support for remote access platforms such as VPN, Terminal Services, and Citrix
Promptly assign unresolved incidents to higher Tier support or internet service providers to coordinate restoration of service and obtain the necessary information for recording/tracking the outage or degradation of service.
Keep component NOCs informed of their incident’s status at agreed intervals and continuously update incidents as needed.
Notify Govt Leads and other stakeholders of high impact/priority failures using the appropriate escalation procedures.

You'll Bring These Qualifications:

Able to obtain DHS Entry on Duty (EOD)
Typically requires a bachelor’s degree and at least 3 year of relevant routing/switching experience in an enterprise network operations center environment
Knowledge of network protocols such as OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP. Experience with Cisco command line interface and configuration
Strong customer service and strong communication skills (both written and verbal)
Must be able to work one of the schedules listed below (the specific shift is not guaranteed):

- Sunday - Tuesday, every other Wednesday 7am-7pm or 7pm-7am

- Thursday - Saturday, every other Wednesday- 7am-7pm or 7pm-7am

These Qualifications Would Be Nice to Have:

Understanding of ITIL service delivery concepts
Experience working with wireless technologies, Virtual Private Networks (VPN), Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), WAN Accelerators and associated technologies
Working knowledge of ServiceNow; creating, updating and closing tickets
Network+, ITIL Foundations, CCENT, Security+


What We Can Offer You:


We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.


Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.


We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.


We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.


For over 60 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.

Company Overview: At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

Description

Do you have experience in Operational Intelligence in the maritime domain?

Are you interested in applying your skills to complex problems supporting national security?

If so, we are looking for someone like you to join our team at APL!

We are seeking an analyst with maritime intelligence research experience to provide technical contributions and leadership to support prevailing American undersea superiority. We are a hardworking team of analysts and former operators who assess problems and develop insights in support of the US Navy Sea Control Mission. We strive to cultivate an environment of collaboration while working on complex technical challenges that advance the security of the United States.

As an Undersea Warfare Operations Intelligence Analyst you will...
Provide Intelligence related research and insights to support studies and assessments.
Develop tailored methods and metrics in order to analyze and evaluate the performance and operational utility of undersea warfare (USW) and anti-submarine warfare (ASW) systems.
Work with acoustic and non-acoustic engineers, data analysts, and operations professionals in a team environment to develop employment concepts for undersea platforms and sensors.
Document outcomes in reports and annotated briefs for delivery to DoD sponsors which you will brief to sponsors or DoD command staff.
Interact with DoD and or Navy staff to facilitate task execution and work prioritization.

Qualifications

You meet our minimum qualifications for the job if you...
Have a BS degree in Engineering, Physics, Applied Mathematics or other related technical field with five or more years of relevant USW/ASW operational/technical experience.
Have relevant experience working with or for the Navy or IC in an Operational Intelligence billet.
Are technically and analytically oriented and possess strong mathematical, operational, problem-solving and organizational skills and a proven ability to lead small teams.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact with Navy/DOD and fleet operational staff.
Are willing and able to travel (i.e., occasional 2-3 day trips or week long tests) and are willing to work on a dynamic project and ability to prioritize a number of concurrent taskings.
Are able to obtain an Interim Secret security clearance by your start date and can ultimately obtain a TS/SCI level clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.
You 'll go above and beyond our minimum requirements if you...
Have a MS degree in Engineering, Physics or Systems Engineering/Management.
Have a tour with ONI Naval Warfare Department or a staff operational intelligence billet with interagency coordination and / or publication.
Have prior experience with maritime surveillance systems, submarine operations or exposure to Navy Theater-level OPINTEL programs.
Operational, engineering, and analytical knowledge of USW or ASW systems.
Have an active Top Secret or higher level clearance.

Why work at APL?

The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) brings world-class expertise to our nation’s most critical defense, security, space and science challenges. While we are dedicated to solving complex challenges and pioneering new technologies, what makes us truly outstanding is our culture. We offer a vibrant, welcoming atmosphere where you can bring your authentic self to work, continue to grow, and build strong connections with inspiring teammates.

At APL, we celebrate our differences and encourage creativity and bold, new ideas. Our employees enjoy generous benefits, including a robust education assistance program, unparalleled retirement contributions, and a healthy work/life balance. APL’s campus is located in the Baltimore-Washington metro area. Learn more about our career opportunities at http://www.jhuapl.edu/careers.

#LI-AG1


About Us

APL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, occupation, marital or familial status, political opinion, personal appearance, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

APL is committed to promoting an innovative environment that embraces diversity, encourages creativity, and supports inclusion of new ideas. In doing so, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals of all abilities, including those with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in any part of the hiring process, please contact Accommodations@jhuapl.edu. Only by ensuring that everyone’s voice is heard are we empowered to be bold, do great things, and make the world a better place.

Position: Financial Management Lead

Knowesis is currently seeking a Senior Financial Management Analyst to support the United States Army Medical Materiel Development Activity (USAMMDA) at Ft. Detrick, MD. USAMMDA is responsible for developing medical products such as drugs, vaccines, devices, and medical support equipment. USAMMDA preserves and protects warfighters' lives by developing medical products to ensure readiness and the highest quality medical care for DOD personnel. This is a hybrid position at the facility in Fredrick, MD.

This position requires a Public Trust security clearance. Must obtain and maintain a NACI clearance and a CAC Card. Additionally, U.S. Citizenship is required (applicants without proof of U.S. citizenship will not be considered due to the position's security clearance requirement).

The Job Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

Organized, detail-oriented, proactive, multitasking and personable Senior Financial Analyst to support USAMMDA's Force Health Protection (FHP) office and the Office of the Commander (OOC) and support the following tasks and activities:

Support product managers in budget and financial functions associated purchase and procurement of goods/services
Support all aspects of the Planning, Programming, Budgeting, and Execution System (PPBES), including but not limited to Program Objective Memorandum (POM), Program Decision Memoranda, Program Budget Decisions, Future Years Defense Program, and Budget Estimate Submission, Execution Reviews, Fiscal Year Budget Planning
Utilize General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS) to initiate purchase requisitions, execute monthly financial reports for obligations and disbursement rates, and query multiple reports
Prepare contract packages to support timely awards and facilitate the acquisition process, as needed, to ensure contracts and agreements operate smoothly
Analyze and provide reports on programmatic planning and execution data, provide periodic updates to financial plans inclusive of planned release schedules and current fiscal year activity, and prepare reports that will be used to brief senior leadership
Recommend methods for effective and efficient use of funding in the budget and planning years and analyze obligation and disbursement rates against the budget. As budgetary and financial challenges arise, seek resolution approaches and ensure funding is utilized appropriately.
Prepare contract packages to support timely awards and facilitate the acquisition process, as needed, to ensure contracts and agreements operate smoothly
Can handle demanding situations with clarity, focus, and professionalism, and respond quickly to quick turnaround taskers
Participate in special projects as required
Responsible for various financial functions such as budgeting, auditing, forecasting, and analysis.
Create, maintain, and update financial databases and spreadsheets and generate financial reports as required.
Analyze assigned contracts, projected staff hours, contract totals, revenues, and profit totals.
Make recommendations to management to improve the financial performance of the organization.
Develop budgets for assigned contracts and tracks performance through invoices to budgets.
Work within SharePoint to update data and maintain records as needed by the customer.
Input data and create purchase requisitions within GFEBS.

Required Qualifications:

Five years of related finance, accounting, or business analysis experience
Working knowledge of financial management systems
Prior finance support experience for the DoD or other government agency
Understanding of the PPBES system
Ability to quickly learn the Government Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS)
Excellent proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Must possess effective communication skills, including verbal, written, and email correspondence, and the ability to work with senior leadership and personnel of higher echelons

Required Education:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related business discipline or the equivalent combination of education, professional training, or work experience

Knowesis is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Crisis24, a GardaWorld company, is widely regarded as the leading integrated risk management, crisis response, consulting and global protective solutions firm, serving the world's most influential people, disruptive brands and prominent organizations. Championed by our advanced Global Operation Centers and our highly skilled team of intelligence analysts, we offer highly specialized services, 24/7 security and consulting, with the technology and AI to power it all across the globe. More information at crisis24.garda.com.

As a member of the Product Management team, this role is responsible for driving business value for Crisis24 while delighting our customers. The person in this role will shepherd a portfolio of product features from concept to end-of-life: developing, maintaining and realizing the vision for the product, being familiar with its design, architecture and features, and knowing and representing the customer needs at all times. This includes owning relevant artifacts and facilitating related processes, such as the product roadmap, product backlog, product releases, go-to-market approaches, pricing and packaging, post-launch maintenance and product profitability. To optimize their portfolio for success, this role always considers the larger Crisis24 ecosystem – providing the bridge between business and technology, and working collaboratively with multiple stakeholders (both internal and external) as well as their fellow product team members.
This particular position's portfolio would primarily be focused on Intelligence-oriented offerings.

Essential Job Duties/Responsibilities:
The core duties are listed below, but there may be other related tasks as directed by line management from time-to-time.
Market-Facing

Identifies and owns the customer needs and problems, both for existing customers and the larger prospective market.
Understands the overall market and competitive dynamics for offerings within their portfolio (or the equivalent thereof).
Iteratively develops product and feature requirements and acceptance criteria – consulting with clients, sales, and other stakeholders internally and externally – including outlining the market/customer problems we are trying to solve and business goals we are trying to achieve.
Supports go-to-market activities, including communicating internally, assisting Marketing with external communications, collateral and other product marketing elements, coordinating the set-up and execution of internal and customer-facing Beta programs, initiating updates to Sales and Contract Management tools, and ensuring support for Demos and Trials.
Demonstrates the product capabilities to customers and internal stakeholders as necessary, for existing features and new releases, and documents feedback.
Product Development

Identifies and defines opportunities within their portfolio for increasing internal efficiencies to provide a better quality, reduced costs, and/or increased productivity.
Prioritizes and specifically defines that which is most valuable to Crisis24 to be delivered next for the product and is able to clearly articulate this value.
Is the primary creator of the stories and scenarios that comprise the product requirements.
Works with UX on design and refinement of the user interaction.
Participates in meetings involving key members of senior leadership as well as peers, and presents updates on their product.
Contributes to the creation and maintenance of personas relevant for their offerings.
Creates and manages the subscription model, packaging and overall purchasing model for the go-to-market offerings within their portfolio.
Monitors the usage, profitability and ROI for their product, as part of the product lifecycle management.
Uses analytics to gauge user adoption, observe user behavior, and make data-driven priority decisions.
Interaction with Delivery & Engineering teams

Presents comprehensive requirements to engineering during grooming, to achieve refinement of stories.
Understands Agile/Scrum methodologies and supports iterative design and continuous improvement practices
Attends applicable scrum ceremonies, with guidance from the Technical Delivery Managers.
Answer questions from developers, clarifies requirements, and describes priority for the product development.
Collaborates with Engineering leadership on Buy/Build/Partner decisions pertaining to product development within their portfolio.
Experience, Functional, and Technical Requirements:
Any combination of education and experience providing the required skill and knowledge is qualifying. Typical qualifications would be equivalent to:

Bachelor's degree in business, engineering, software, or another relevant field is desired.
3+ years of experience in product management, product ownership, or business analysis relating to software development.
Demonstratable experience engaging with customers to understand their unmet needs and explain clearly which of their problems the product suite can solve.
Collaborative individual with a pragmatic/flexible attitude who can effectively work across teams internally and also with customers.
Ability to take ownership of tasks and make decisions.
Attention to detail at all times.
Ability to demonstrate compassion and actively listen to customer requirements.
Reporting and Place of Work

It is desirable that the candidate be located near Crisis24’s regional office in Annapolis, MD, United States.
Position holder must have the right to work in the United States without restrictions.
Position holder would have to pass a pre-employment check.
Crisis24, A GardaWorld Company is dedicated to equal opportunity in employment. We are committed to a work environment that celebrates diversity. We do not discriminate against any individual based on race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital or parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors protected by applicable laws.

Overview:
At Legal & General America, we aim to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers, partners, colleagues, and the communities in which they live. As a recognized market leader of term life insurance, we’re working to transform our business through innovation and technology to provide products and solutions that help American families secure their financial futures.

We are a future-focused company, passionate about what we do and how we do it. This means working with pace and energy to reach our goals, and challenging ourselves to achieve more. We strive to create a unique environment where balance between work and life is possible. Our employees' passion, dedication and hard work, as well as our career development opportunities, benefits, and employee activities contribute to our positive workplace culture.

We are undergoing an extensive IT Transformation to digitize our business to support aggressive growth targets. This is a rare opportunity to not only change the organization but influence the US life insurance industry to deliver best in class, digital customer experiences. Our successful business transformation will depend on significant strategic input and product development to ensure we are building products that our customers value.


In this critical role you will be a key member of the IT leadership team, managing the company’s product teams and partnering with business leadership to help them meet short and long term business objectives. You will work closely with IT leadership to shape the overall IT strategy and ensure the right portfolio of products are built with the right features at the right time to meet business propositions focused on growth, experience, and cost reduction through digital strategy.

Responsibilities:
Inspire your team to build the best outcome for the customer and/or end-user. Ensure product design and development processes meet the needs of the customer and drive business value.
Bring a strong business understanding, interpersonal relationships, handling of cultural diversity, communication skills, and influence capability to build a high-performing team of Product Managers, Product Owners, Business Analysts, and Business Architects.
Ensure delivery of work supports the program or product vision and goals.
Understand and communicate the drivers, goals, and strategy associated with programs and products.
Make evidence-based decisions using qualitative and quantitative data. Continuously track key metrics and validate the success of projects and features.
Coordinate and unblock cross-functional teams when there are challenges delivering value for portfolio product management strategy.
Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure valuable releases early and often; solving complex business or functional problems and coordinating work as necessary.
Provide ongoing communication to stakeholders on progress, expectation management and to remove impediments.
Support project portfolio delivery leverage best-in-class product management and agile methods that deliver products on time, on budget, on quality, at a high-velocity cadence.
Foster a team environment that is open, informed and empowered, in order to continually improve effectiveness and deliver value to the business.
Determine, monitor, and review product management practices, including costs, supply & demand of staffing requirements, and risk, ensuring that there are appropriate and effective governance arrangements, supported by appropriate reporting.
Evaluate, monitor, and review the products economics, including costs, staffing requirements, resources, and risk, ensuring that there are appropriate and effective governance arrangements, supported by appropriate reporting.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm’s reputation and safeguarding LGA, its clients, and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules, regulations, adhering to policy, applying sound ethical judgement regarding behavior, conduct, and practices. Escalate, manage, and report control issues with transparency and create accountability where appropriate.
Assist in all matters with regards to the management of employees, ensuring that management discretion is used in a consistent manner. In coordination with the Head of Product, set team performance, create annual program goals, facilitate achievement of the same goals, and provide performance feedback for a team size of 10+ people comprised of Product Managers, Product Owners, and Business Analysts.
Qualifications:

Education

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent combination of education/experience in IT/business management
MBA/Advanced degree in business, leadership, finance, and/or business management preferred
Scrum Product Owner certification (CSPO), Scaled Agile Framework certification, or equivalent

Experience/Knowledge

5+ years of leadership role experience
10+ years of product owner / product management experience
10+ years of people management experience
10+ years of financial services / life insurance industry experience
15+ years of professional experience with background in business analysis or business subject matter expertise

Skills

Delivery against product roadmaps aligning design with need
Strong sense of urgency
Demonstrates clear and concise communication skills
Direct experience with operational processes, data analysis, and business case development
Proven stakeholder management and ability to interact at all levels using expert presentation skills and material to effectively communicate and influence stakeholders
Strong network of relationships among peers, internal partners, external constituencies, decision makers, and stakeholders
Strong leadership and management skills - create and drive product vision, mentoring and coaching of product owners and associates, and continuous feedback and support through effective planning and tracking
Expertise developing, evolving, and executing agile frameworks, product management, and software development
Ability to work under pressure and manage deadlines or unexpected changes in expectations or requirements
Exhibits strong leadership capabilities, emotional intelligence skills, and is a proven, results-oriented individual focused on delivering customer value
Ability to work unsupervised and adjust priorities quickly and effortlessly
Excellent problem solving and program execution skills
Demonstrated analytical skills
Demonstrated problem-solving and decision-making skills
Ability to structure and break down complex problems, form methods or processes to solve, and deliver outcomes
Familiarity with technology processes and experience with business transformation
Team-oriented behavior
Travel
Up to 10% travel may be required

What’s in it for you?

The expected hiring compensation range for this position is $147,700 - $214,150 annually.


The total compensation package for this position may include other elements, such as a sign-on bonus, long term incentives, and annual bonuses. This role is eligible to participate in the Legal & General America Annual Incentive Plan. The current target payment for the position is 20% of base salary, modified for corporate and individual performance. Bonuses are pro-rated based on start date. This role has 20 vacation days and 10 sick days that are accrued on a bi-weekly basis. Employees also have 9 paid holidays throughout the calendar year.

We have a competitive compensation and benefits package focused on your overall wellbeing. Employee benefits include health, life, and dental insurance; 401K with company match up to 6% as well as a pension package; generous time off; and wellbeing initiatives throughout the year (we like doing fun stuff). We’re big on professional development and we’ll support and mentor you in your career progression and expect you to help us pay it forward by helping us develop tomorrow's leaders and growth-focused professionals. We value our teams and our communities and believe in giving back. Enjoy time off to volunteer for those causes that matter most to you!


If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors. Job Title: Cyberspace Event and Current Operations Situational Awareness Support Analyst
Job Description:
Job ID: 2314540

Location: FORT MEADE, MD, US

Date Posted: 2023-10-23

Category: Cyber

Subcategory: Cybersecurity Ops

Schedule: Full-time

Shift: Day Job

Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

Minimum Clearance Required: TS/SCI with Poly

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: None

Potential for Remote Work: No


Description

SAIC is seeking a Cyberspace Event and Current Operations Situational Awareness Support Analyst out of Fort Meade, MD.

This position directly supports the USCYBERCOM Joint Operations Center (JOC). The Cyberspace Event and Current Operations Situational Awareness Support Analyst assesses, analyzes, and maintains situational awareness of USCYBERCOM operations and activities. The team reviews numerous JOC products, aggregates data, and summarizes information requiring the attention of the Battle Captain, the JOC Director, or the J3 Operations Director. This is a mission critical function and requires 24x7x365 coverage in support of the JOC.

Shift 1: Tues-Fri 0600 – 1600 / Shift 2: 1400 – 0000 / Shift 3: Sat-Tues 2300 – 0900

Responsibilities include (but not limited to):

Perform expansive cyberspace intelligence analyst duties;
Review intelligence analytic concepts to monitor, assess, and report on cyberspace operations, capabilities, and vulnerabilities;
Develop operations products fused with relevant information from higher, adjacent, and supporting organizations;
Aggregate JOC operational information into daily briefings to provide situational awareness of USCYBERCOM activities;
Review internal and external reporting data for applicability to cyberspace operations;
Conduct quality assurance checks on daily briefing dashboards;
Maintain relationships and coordinate required actions with higher, adjacent, and supporting organizations;
Develop analytic approaches and make recommendations to problems and situations with incomplete, controversial, or unprecedented datasets;
Monitor various services to maintain situational awareness;
Archive current operations products outside their window of relevancy.

Deliverables include (as required):

J3 Morning Update Brief (virtual dial-in via Skype);
Daily briefing dashboards;

Qualifications

Requirements:

Education – High School Diploma or equivalent
Minimum of five (5) years of experience providing support to a cyberspace center to include:

o Collaborating or working with other centers on fleshing out the perspective on a situation, incident, or event

o Drafting reports on cyber events, incidents, and documenting situations

o Contributing to the development of cyberspace situational awareness products and cyberspace analysis duties with minimal guidance

o Possessing a general understanding of intelligence analytic base concepts to monitor, assess, and report on cyberspace operations, capabilities, and vulnerabilities

o Contributing to the development of analytic approaches and recommendations to problems and situations for which data are incomplete, controversial, or which no precedence exists

Required Clearance:

TS/SCI CI Poly




Covid Policy: SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.

Job Title: Senior All Source Analyst - Language Exploitation Operations Team Lead
Job Description:
Job Description:


Prescient Edge is seeking a Sr. All Source Analyst- Language Exploitation Operations (LEO) Team Lead to support a federal government client.

Please note that the availability of this position is contingent upon contract award.

Benefits:

At Prescient Edge, we believe that acting with integrity and serving our employees is the key to everyone's success. To that end, we provide employees with a best-in-class benefits package that includes:

A competitive salary with performance bonus opportunities.
Comprehensive healthcare benefits, including medical, vision, dental, and orthodontia coverage.
A substantial retirement plan with no vesting schedule. Career development opportunities, including on-the-job training, tuition reimbursement, and networking.
A positive work environment where employees are respected, supported, and engaged.

Sr. All Source Analyst- Language Exploitation Operations (LEO) Team Lead

Description:

Conducts exploitation/analysis using intelligence and information from multiple data sources to assess, interpret, forecast, and explain a range of national security issues and developments that are regional or functional in nature. Provides all-source exploitation support to collections, operations, investigations, and other defense intelligence requirements.
Supports business rule that all LEO language teams shall have designated team leaders.
Coordinates assigned project tasks, relaying management requirements to their teams, training team members, updating production schedules, using and updating style and translation standards guides and other related tasks as assigned.
Serves as NMEC’s principal representatives during non-core hours, interact with NMEC customers and platforms, respond to requirements and requests, maintain situational awareness, and notify government leadership as the need arises.
Qualifications: All shall be qualified Language Analysts at a 3/3 or higher in English and in a Target Language. Team Leads shall have a least two years of experience in managing Language Analysts. They must be proficient in MS Office Suite. Must be comfortable briefing senior Government personnel. Must be able to multi-task and be organized and adaptable to changing/evolving requirements.



Job Requirements:


Desired experiences:

Must have a minimum of 12 years’ experience working as a Language Analyst and/or All Source Analyst.
The Triage Team Lead will have functional capability in one of NMEC primary languages, scoring at least 3/3 in reading and listening in one of NMEC primary languages and have English with general professional plus or higher proficiency (3+) on the Interagency Language Analyst Roundtable (ILR) 5-point scale.
Must be proficient in MicroSoft Office Suite.
Must be comfortable briefing senior Government personnel.
Must be able to multi-task and be organized and adaptable to changing/evolving requirements.

Desired education:

Master’s Degree in an area related to the labor category from a college or university accredited by an agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education: or have a bachelor’s degree related to the labor category from a college or university accredited by an agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and an additional 5 years of related Senior experience for a total of 17 years, as a substitute to the master’s degree.

Security Clearance:

Security clearance required TS/SCI with CI POLY or the ability to obtain CI POLY.

Location:

Bethesda, MD.

Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for working within the SOC section while coordinating efforts with the SOC Operations, Digital Forensics Incident Response Team, DCO Engineers, Threat Intelligence, and Threat Hunt Teams.
You will utilize client-monitoring consoles to monitor tools supplied by the client remotely.
You will provide information on previous malicious network attacks, performing triage on events reported by various detection devices to filter out false positives and known, accepted activities.
Investigate and respond to security alerts, incidents, and vulnerabilities
Conduct security analysis and risk assessments to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities
Develop and implement security measures to protect the organization's information assets
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure compliance with security policies and procedures

Qualifications:
1. Attention to Detail - Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail. IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include recognizing information gaps and then quickly fill those gaps by asking the appropriate stakeholder or subject matter experts theappropriate questions, all in order to make better informed decisions.
2. Customer Service - Works with clients and customers (that is, any individuals who use or receive the services or products that your work unit produces, including individuals who work in the agency, other agencies, or organizations outside the Government) to assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems, or satisfy their expectations; knows about available products and services; is committed to providing quality products and services. IT related experience demonstrating this competency include maintaining positive communications with key personnel involved in the execution of operations.
3. Oral Communication - Expresses information (for example, ideas or facts) to individuals or groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the information (for example, technical, sensitive, controversial); makes clear and convincing oral presentations; listens to others, and responds appropriately. IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include conducting daily synchronization meetings to key leadership.
4. Problem Solving - Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information; uses sound judgment to generate and evaluate alternatives, and to make recommendations. IT-related experience demonstrating this competency include coordinating with all entities/adjacent organizations to ensure external operational requirements are authorized and available for use during rehearsals and/or operations.

Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the position. It is not an exhaustive list of responsibilities, qualifications, or skills required. The successful candidate may be asked to perform additional tasks as needed.

Dental insurance
Health insurance

Performance bonus

3 years
5 years

Job Title: Advisory Lead Business Analyst 1 - PDM Senior Consultant
Job Description:
Risk and Financial Advisory - Hybrid Operate

Lead Business Analyst - PDM Senior Consultant

Do you have a drive to be a part of the technology evolution , and a passion for turning challenges and opportunities into long-term competitive advantages? If so, please consider an opportunity with Deloitte under our Project Delivery Talent Model. The Project Delivery Model (PDM) is a talent model tailored to long-term, client service delivery. PDM practitioners are local to project locations, minimizing the need for extensive travel . As a Lead Business Analyst in our Hybrid-Operate business, you'll have the opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience, share ideas, and collaborate with leading professionals as we engage a diverse set of industries with effective solutions

Work you'll do

As a Lead Business Analyst, you will work on client teams , supporting technology products - including onboarding new client implementations, performing data analytics, and expanding existing business features and functionality to meet client needs. You will be working with other analysts and developers to identify and address technical and non-technical issues. Additional responsibilities m ay include:

Documenting highly complex business processes, data flow and architecture for new systems and data
Creating business cases to provide cost effective solutions.
Following complex data flow to interpret source of information in support of new systems and data.
Recommend ing change s based on business system impact analysis.
Serving as functional lead in technical implementation of agreed upon solutions.
Translating business requirements into test cases
Facilitating User Acceptance Testing of system enhancements and new applications, including initial root cause analysis of failures
Preparing and presenting complex written and verbal materials such as reports, findings, and systems training
Building reports using Crystal Reports and SSRS and, ad-hoc queries and dashboards leveraging market leading business intelligence tools
Serving as an escalation point, and guiding less tenured business analysts to troubleshoot and resolve issues
Participat ing in Agile development process and contribut e to sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives
Help develop requirements for, and assist in testing of, software enhancements including providing market and user insights

The desired candidate is a team player who is passionate about learning and working with technology, finance, and alternative investments. The candidate will be detail oriented, possess strong listening, verbal/written communication skills, and able to collaborate well with others.

The Team

We are a growing global team of Analysts and Technology professionals. You will be working directly with team members at all levels, with the focus on enhancement or customization to meet the needs of our clients. Our teams understand the dynamics of serving complex, global clients across multiple industries, and the importance of increasing transparency around business performance. Learn more about our Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory practice at Deloitte.

Technical Knowledge and Experience :

Required

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience
5-7 years of relevant experience
Minimum of four years of work experience in IT and data driven projects as a Business Analyst/ Product Manager
Experience working in Agile projects with good understanding of Agile ways of working
Ability to influence peers and leadership stakeholders
Relevant certifications in Agile, Scrum or project management
Strong experience in IT consulting and business analysis - process definition, requirements gathering, Proficiency in writing Business Requirements Documents ( BRD ) , and Functional Specification Documents ( FSD )
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. and user stories



The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $75,924 - $133,200.

Job Title: Maritime Surveillance LFA/CLFA System Design and Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Description

Are you looking to be on the cutting edge of new and innovative ways to deploy active sonar capabilities within the Maritime Surveillance domain?

Are you passionate about working with groundbreaking, next-generation technologies?

Do you want to make significant contributions to improve essential U. S. Naval capabilities through operations analysis and test and evaluation?

If so, we're looking for someone like you to join us at APL.

We are seeking a dynamic, creative, and analytical candidate to help us assess the design and influence the capability development of the U.S. Navy's Maritime Surveillance Systems (MSS) Low Frequency Active (LFA), Compact LFA (CLFA), and prototype Deployable Active Systems. We are looking to push the boundaries of system capabilities by providing critical support to the U.S. Navy's Advanced Development, integration and testing community. Your contributions will help us transform data into knowledge, enabling decision makers to make informed choices on the future direction of the Navy's surveillance-based mission systems. You will join a hardworking and expert team of engineers, subject matter experts and software developers in an inclusive environment that values creative collaboration and innovation.

As a Maritime Surveillance Systems Engineer/Analyst, you will...
Collaborate with system developers and analysis team members to conduct lab-based and at-sea assessment of functional and operational Maritime Surveillance Systems CLFA, LFA and prototype Deployable Active Systems capabilities.
Ensure test scope, analysis methodology, appropriate measures of performance and data required to execute analysis are comprehensive.
Apply surveillance domain experience to develop new system display concepts, capabilities, and functions to improve system performance.
Research, investigate, and experiment with next-generation technologies and look for creative applications in unconventional ways.
Apply systems engineering expertise in support of future MSS LFA, CLFA and prototype Deployable Active Systems requirements and capability development to inform impending development direction.
Collaborate with analysts to contribute to evaluation of fielded MSS LFA, CLFA and prototype Deployable Active Systems.
Liaise between JHU/APL, acquisition sponsors (PMS 485), and fleet operational commands to inform future development decision-making and optimize operational utility and MSS LFA, CLFA and prototype Deployable Active Systems employment.

Qualifications

You meet our minimum qualifications for this position if you...
Have earned a US Navy designator, billet classification, or enlisted classification code related to surveillance systems and / or active sonar.
Have extensive relevant experience in surveillance systems operations, training, and testing.
Have experience with US Navy developmental and operational test and evaluation.
Are passionate about applying operational experience and analytical skills in an innovative and collaborative environment.
Have strong interpersonal skills, are skilled at developing relationships across organizational teams and have excellent oral and written communication skills.
Are proficient at multi-tasking, prioritizing assignments, communicating progress and meeting deadlines.
Are willing to participate in system test, delivery, and integration tests at sponsor or operational navy sites.
Are able to obtain an interim Secret level security clearance by your start date and can ultimately obtain a TS/SCI level clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.

You'll go above and beyond our minimum requirements if you...
Have a strong background or previous experience in acoustics analysis.
Have 6+ years of operational experience in the Integrated Undersea Surveillance Systems.
Have experience conducting reconstruction and analysis of operational data.
Have 5+ years of experience leading a technical team.
Have previous experience with evaluation of U.S. Navy surveillance systems performance.
Possess a BS degree in Mathematics, Science, or Engineering or equivalent surveillance qualifications.
Have an active TS or higher level clearance


Why work at APL?


The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) brings world-class expertise to our nation's most critical defense, security, space and science challenges. While we are dedicated to solving complex challenges and pioneering new technologies, what makes us truly outstanding is our culture. We offer a vibrant, welcoming atmosphere where you can bring your authentic self to work, continue to grow, and build strong connections with inspiring teammates.


At APL, we celebrate our differences and encourage creativity and bold, new ideas. Our employees enjoy generous benefits, including a robust education assistance program, unparalleled retirement contributions, and a healthy work/life balance. APL's campus is located in the Baltimore-Washington metro area. Learn more about our career opportunities at www.jhuapl.edu/careers.



About Us


APL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, occupation, marital or familial status, political opinion, personal appearance, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. APL is committed to promoting an innovative environment that embraces diversity, encourages creativity, and supports inclusion of new ideas. In doing so, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals of all abilities, including those with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in any part of the hiring process, please contact Accommodations@jhuapl.edu. Only by ensuring that everyone’s voice is heard are we empowered to be bold, do great things, and make the world a better place.

There is a place for you at T. Rowe Price to grow, contribute, learn, and make a difference. We are a premier asset manager focused on delivering global investment management excellence and retirement services that investors can rely on today and in the future. The work we do matters. We invite you to explore the opportunity to join us and grow your career with us.
ROLE SUMMARY
Senior Project Managers (sPM) are accountable for successful execution of one or more projects of moderate to high complexity. This involves managing change projects across functional areas that support the Distribution organization, working closely with senior leaders in Distribution, Marketing, Client Servicing and Reporting, Investment Operations and Technology.
The sPM will support components of the overall strategic program portfolio focusing on growth initiatives across APAC /EMEA/US. The sPM is expected to support Program Managers across initiatives on project management processes, best practices, effectively facilitate leaders and cross-functional teams to make decisions, achieve program objectives, manage risks, issues, and internal/external dependencies.
They will support the program and associated projects/work streams as needed and oversee the execution of work through the entire project management lifecycle (initiation, planning, execution, and closeout) per the processes established by the T. Rowe Price Transformation Office (TO) and industry best practices.
Successful candidate will have great leadership, organizational, business analysis and influencing skills. They will have experience applying project management processes in a thoughtful way to achieve the best business result. Candidates must have proven experience managing moderate to high complexity projects in the financial industry; have worked closely with multiple business partners to achieve results; and be willing to perform “hands-on” program/project management. The candidate is expected to have prior experience in driving transformation projects, project managing launch of new products. Prior experience in working with technology driven projects would be helpful.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsible for the day-to-day project management and delivery by working closely with the projects’ operating sponsors according to established project methodology and standards.
Develop the project charter, integrated project plan, resource plan, contingency plan, and related project management artifacts.
Assisting launch of new products from perspective of project management.
Partner with business sponsors to define success metrics and criteria.
Responsible for establishing/running the weekly project working group, adhering to the established project governance, and maintaining all project documentation including charter, RAID log, detailed project plan and ensuring all deliverables are signed off as required by the working group.
Facilitate all operational checkpoint activities throughout the lifecycle of projects.
Conduct analysis meetings with the agreed stakeholders to document requirements, workflows, policies, and procedures.
Assess and resolve all high priority project risks as they are encountered, escalating as required.
Continually update relevant business stakeholders of project status and periodically publish project status reports.
Ensure all projects meet success parameters and business objectives stated in the business case / charter.
Experience
Required:
Bachelor's degree and 6+ years of Project Manager experience
Preferred:
8+ years of project management experience
Project management certification (PMP, Prince II etc.)
Asset Management industry experience, particularly across Distribution, Client Servicing, Client Onboarding, Client Reporting and Technology across international locations.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Problem solving skills and being able to work with people across multiple locations.
Facilitation of meetings with stakeholders to review and solve key issues.
Well organized and self-motivated.
Proven experience delivering projects which are technology driven.
Proven experience managing projects involving new product launches.
Technical skills – Microsoft office including Visio, PowerPoint.
Very good presentation skills particularly to management.
Soft skills to motivate people and navigate a complex global working environment.
Demonstrated ability to apply excellent Communication and Interpersonal skills to manage a diverse set of stakeholders and leaders.
Strong negotiation and influencing skills.
Demonstrated high level of analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to present concepts to individuals and large groups.
FINRA Requirements
FINRA licenses are not required and will not be supported for this role.
Work Flexibility
This role is eligible for remote work up to two days a week.
Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
We strive for equity, equality, and opportunity for all associates. When we embrace the power of diversity and create an environment where people can bring their authentic and best selves to work, our firm is stronger, and we create greater value for our clients. Our commitment and inclusive programming aim to lift the experience for each associate and builds allies for our global associate community. Company Name: Office of The Chief Financial Officer
Job Description:
Government of the District of Columbia
Office of the Chief Financial Officer (OCFO)

ERP Business Analyst
$89,965.00 - $133,559.00 (Hybrid, Location Washington DC)

The Office of the Chief Financial Officer (OCFO) whose mission is to enhance the fiscal and financial stability, accountability and integrity of the Government of the District of Columbia is in search of an ERP Business Analyst. This position is located in the Office of the Chief Financial Officer (OCFO), Office of Financial Operations and Systems (OFOS), District Integrated Financial System (DIFS) Support Center. The incumbent is responsible for planning, designing, documenting, and implementing policies and procedures for quarterly updates and patches for Oracle ERP Cloud and Oracle EPM.

Duties include, but are not limited to:
Gathering and documenting business requirements
Testing and analyzing enhancement requests
Leading fit-gap analysis and as-is/to-be business process functional designs
Assisting with prototyping, functional system configuration, testing, and end-user training
Assessing internal controls
Troubleshooting and resolving production issues
Performing other related duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications: Four (4) years of progressive work experience performing related duties and responsibilities such as: analyzing financial systems, processes, and providing operational support to improve program effectiveness; managing complex projects including planning, designing, and implementing system enhancements; and conducting related training. Incumbent must have strong collaboration, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Excellent oral and written communications skills are required. Experience with Oracle Cloud Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Oracle Cloud Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) is preferred.

For initial review, please submit your resume to the Office of the Chief Financial Officer, Human Resources Division, located at 1101 4th Street, SW, Suite W220, Washington, DC 20024

The OCFO offers a competitive salary and benefits package including medical, dental, retirement, and educational assistance.

The Office of the Chief Financial Officer is an EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

XJ6

ASR Group is the world’s largest refiner and marketer of cane sugar, with an annual production capacity of more than 6 million tons of sugar. The company produces a full line of grocery, industrial, food service and specialty sweetener products. Across North America, ASR Group owns and operates six sugar refineries, located in Louisiana, New York, California, Maryland, Canada and Mexico. In the European Union, the company owns and operates sugar refineries in England, Portugal. ASR Group also owns and operates mills in Mexico and Belize. The company’s brand portfolio includes the leading brands Domino®, C&H®, Redpath®, Tate & Lyle®, Lyle’s® and Sidul®.


OVERVIEW

The Sr Operations Analyst will drive operational excellence across ASR manufacturing operations – the single most important driver of ASR profitability. The Sr Operations Analyst will lead aimed at improving the efficiency and sustainability of ASR operations (e.g., sugar refining, packaging, maintenance, distribution) while supporting some of the business’s most critical decisions. Additionally, this role will establish, track, troubleshoot and present operational Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to senior ASR leadership including the Global CFO and SVP Operations. The Sr Operations Analyst reports to the Director of Operational Finance.


DETAILED ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Use critical thinking and analysis to drive and lead change across all aspects of ASR’s business – particularly in operations, but also supply chain, sales, marketing and other functions as needed
Extract insights from data and effectively use images, charts, and conceptual frameworks to synthesize that data
Develop actionable recommendations
Create and deliver professional presentations to senior leadership
Collaborate with ASR colleagues across functions and regions in implementing solutions
Drive continuous process improvement within Finance and across all ASR processes
Support ASR’s annual budget process, to include detailed evaluation of all budget plans, budget compilation, and final presentation


WORK EXPERIENCE

Engineering or a technical degree a must, supplemented by a business degree- and 3-5 years of experience required involving data analysis, model building, continuous improvement or hands-on operations experience
Experience supporting and analyzing performance of manufacturing operations is a plus


EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

B.A. or B.S. required. Relevant course work in Engineering, Mathematics, and the Sciences preferred.
M.B.A. or Master’s in Finance/Accounting-related field of study is a plus but not required


ESSENTIAL CAPABILITIES (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES)

Data sleuth – approaches problems with an unbiased, objective, and data-first approach
A willingness to learn about our business, leaving your desk and spending time in a manufacturing environment
Comfortable in communicating with stakeholders at all levels of seniority
Highly analytical and with an ability to draw insight from large data sets
Strong knowledge of financial and accounting concepts required
Knowledge of manufacturing processes and cost accounting principles is a plus but not required
Strong Excel / Power BI / PowerPoint skills – beneficial
A willingness to learn – essential
Experience using SAP / Anaplan – beneficial
Organized and capable of prioritizing and managing multiple activities simultaneously


LOCATION OF ROLE

Baltimore, MD
Some travel is required (likely 5%-15% of time)


We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Position Summary:
Odyssey Systems has an exciting new opportunity for a Financial Management Lead/Tasker Support supporting the U.S. Army Medical Materiel Development Activity (USAMMDA), a subordinate command under United States Army Medical Research and Development Command (USAMRDC). USAMMDA is responsible for developing medical products such as drugs, vaccines, devices, and medical support equipment with the mission to preserve and protect the lives of warfighters by developing medical products to ensure readiness and the highest quality of medical care for DoD personnel.

As the Financial Management Lead you will will provide support to the product managers by performing budgetary and financial functions associated with the purchase and procurement of goods and services.

This position is based at Ft. Detrick in Frederick, Maryland.

***Contingent upon contract award***
Responsibilities:
Duties include, but not limited to:
Support product managers in budgetary and financial functions associated purchase and procurement of goods/services
Support all aspects of the Planning, Programming, Budgeting, and Execution System (PPBES) to include but not limited to: Program Objective Memorandum (POM), Program Decision Memoranda, Program Budget Decisions, Future Years Defense Program, and Budget Estimate Submission, Execution Reviews, Fiscal Year Budget Planning
Utilize General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS) to initiate purchase requisitions, execute monthly financial reports for obligations and disbursement rates, and query multiple reports
Prepare contract packages to support timely awards and facilitate the acquisition process, as needed, to ensure contracts and agreements operate smoothly
Analyze and provide reports on programmatic planning and execution data, provide periodic updates to financial plans inclusive of planned release schedules, current fiscal year activity, and prepare reports that will be used to brief senior leadership
Recommend methods for effective and efficient use of funding in the budget and planning years and analyze obligation and disbursement rates against budget. As budgetary financial challenges arise, seek resolution approaches to resolve and ensure funding is utilized appropriately.
Prepare contract packages to support timely awards and facilitate the acquisition process, as needed, to ensure contracts and agreements operate smoothly
Can handle demanding situations with clarity, focus and professionalism, and to respond quickly to quick turnaround taskers
Participate in special projects as required
Responsible for various financial functions such as budgeting, auditing, forecasting and analysis
Create, maintain, and update financial databases and spreadsheets, and generates various financial reports as required
Analyze assigned contracts projected staff hours, contract totals, revenues, and profit totals
Make recommendations to management to improve the financial performance of the organization
Develop budgets for assigned contracts and tracks performance through invoices to budgets
Work within SharePoint to update data and maintain records as needed by the customer
Input data and create purchase requisitions within GFEBS
Qualifications:
Minimum Required Qualifications:
Citizenship: Must be a US citizen
Clearance: Public Trust
Education: B.S. in Finance, Accounting or related discipline
Years’ experience: Ten (10) years of finance, accounting and/or business analysis.
Experience supporting the DoD or other Government agencies and working knowledge of financial management systems
Experience and understanding of the PPBES and GFEBS systems
Proficiency with Excel
Interpersonal Skills:
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work cross-functionally
Strong problem-solving skills
Ability to use critical thinking skills to make decisions with limited guidance
Ability to manage multiple taskers and projects
Additional Information:
Location: Onsite in Frederick, MD (local candidates only); Telework eligible
Travel: 10%

***Contingent upon contract award***
