Health Data Engineer

The Opportunity:

Ever-expanding technology like IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence means that there’s more structured and unstructured data available today than ever before. As a data engineer, you know that organizing big data can yield pivotal insights when it’s gathered from disparate sources. We need an experienced data engineer like you to help our clients find answers in their big data to impact important missions—from fraud detection, cancer research to national intelligence.

As a big data engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll implement data engineering activities on some of the most mission-driven projects in the industry. You’ll deploy and develop pipelines and platforms that organize and make disparate data meaningful. Here, you’ll work with and guide a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. You’ll use your experience in analytical exploration and data examination while you manage the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients. Work with us to use big data for good.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

2+ years of experience in application development

2+ years of experience designing, developing, operationalizing and maintaining complex data applications at enterprise scale

2+ years of experience with developing and maintaining scalable data stores that supply big data in forms needed for business analysis

2+ years of experience with a public Cloud, including AWS, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud

Experience creating software for retrieving, parsing and processing structured and unstructured data

Experience building scalable ETL/ELT workflows for reporting and analytics

Experience creating solutions within a collaborative, cross-functional team environment

Experience with Agile engineering practices

Public Trust

Bachelor’s degree

Nice If You Have:

3+ years of experience with utilizing programming languages, including C++, Java, or Python

Experience in application development utilizing SQL or Scala

Experience with distributed data and computing tools such as Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Hive, AWS EMR, or Kafka

Experience with working on real-time data and streaming applications

Experience with data warehousing, including AWS Redshift, MySQL, or Snowflake

Experience with UNIX and Linux, including basic commands and Shell scripting

Ability to develop scripts and programs for converting various types of data into usable formats and support project team to scale, monitor and operate data platforms

Vetting:

Applicants selected will be subject to a government investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements of the U.S. government client; Public Trust determination is required.

Create Your Career:

Grow With Us

Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

A Place Where You Belong

Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being

Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey

At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $73,100.00 to $166,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.

Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

Job Title: Senior / Lead Implementation Analyst - Food and Beverage Point of Sales Systems
Job Description:
Job Brief

Senior / Lead Implementation Analyst - F&B Point of Sale Systems - Remote with Travel

Description of Company:

ConStrata and its affiliated organizations, provide technology-focused consulting, professional services, event development/management, education, and networking offerings to the global foodservice, hospitality, and retail industries.

Senior / Lead Implementation Analyst - Food and Beverage POS (Point of Sale) Systems (Remote Based with travel)

If you are a savvy Point of Sale Implementation Professional who is the Leader of your POS implementation team and is looking for the next step in your career? We have opportunities as a Senior or Lead Implementation Analyst in our growing team! Our Senior and Lead Implementation Analysts are entirely responsible for leading the preparation, implementation, training, and on-site and remote support of the new point of sale food and beverage system and additional applications for restaurants, hotels, and other hospitality venues. Come join our growing company!

Position Requirements:

3-5 years of experience in food and beverage operations within the hospitality industry is required, with a supervisor/management position preferred.
2-3 years experience with POS configuration, implementation, and support of POS systems such as Micros (Simphony and Opera), Toast, etc.
Experience in providing training of POS systems to the management and hourly team in a hospitality F&B environment.
Engage and cooperate professionally with the client's key IT services for which support is being provided.
Interact with vendors to support hardware and software.
Be customer service-oriented and deliver implementations according to defined client and project requirements and policies.
Work in a team and communicate effectively with all levels of the customer organization and Company management.
Ability to work client/project days/shifts as required.
Ability to travel 75-80% locally or out of town. (Work remote, as needed, from a home office when not traveling.)

Job Duties & Responsibilities:

Assist clients with POS application configuration, reporting, integration with other applications, as well as hardware setup including terminals, handhelds, printers, and other peripherals.
Test/troubleshoot POS and networking problems including integrations with other required applications.
Conduct on-site and/or remote consultation sessions with local operations staff to configure POS applications and report appropriately and within approved client specifications and policies.
Conduct on-site and/or remote training sessions for customer/site staff and management.
Maintain and ensure full and complete documentation of tasks, plans, network diagrams, meetings, deliverables, and accomplishments.
Track and manage issues and risks to project timelines or deliverables escalating when necessary.
Submit all required client/project labor, expense, and other required reports on a complete and timely basis following completion of a project or deliverable.

Candidate Requirements include:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
2 – 3 years of customer service background and POS technical implementation and support experience.
Demonstrate attention to detail, strong organization skills, and the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks.
Ability to problem-solve and/or troubleshoot technology and operational issues in a timely manner.

Strata-Bare International LLC is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Strata-Bare does not discriminate based on disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, state, or local laws.

Do you have a passion for Science? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you!

At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being bold, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person.

About AstraZeneca in Gaithersburg, MD:

Our Gaithersburg, Maryland facility develops life-changing medicines for people around the world. This campus employs more than 3,500 experts in our field and is only a short drive from Washington, DC. This modern and vibrant scientific campus is the home of R&D and Oncology in the US. Here, we play host to some of the most innovative technology and lab spaces, all designed to encourage collaboration and cross-functional science. We are dedicated to crafting a culture of inclusion and collaboration.

The Gaithersburg site offers a variety of amenities to help boost efficiency and help keep our employees happy and balanced. This includes a fitness center, employee healthcare clinic, electric vehicle charging stations, dry cleaning, full-service cafeteria and copy center. This is where you’ll find newly-designed, activity-based work spaces to suit a variety of working styles while growing collaboration between teams.

As the Director of Bacterial Vaccine Discovery in Early Vaccines and Immune Therapies is responsible for leading efforts to discover and develop bacterial carbohydrate conjugate, mRNA and protein-based vaccines.

The individual will lead a team of scientists discovering and characterizing novel bacterial vaccines to build and progress the portfolio. The team will work across groups within Bacterial Vaccines to discover effective antibacterial vaccines and fully characterize their immunogenicity and effectiveness in preclinical disease models. The role will be responsible for influencing senior internal collaborators in Research, Bioprocess Development and Regulatory Affairs and manage external academic collaborations and contract research organizations to build and deliver our early vaccine portfolio. AstraZeneca has a dynamic environment that cultivates collaboration and innovation. We attract top minds, and we nurture and build top talent.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

Lead team of scientists to discover and characterize candidate vaccine antigens to deliver robust in vitro and in vivo research packages supporting pipeline progression and regulatory interactions
Act as subject matter authority and research lead for multiple research programs and present to senior leaders at governance interactions
Present key findings and research progress at top scientific conferences
Establish partnership with Early Vaccines and Immune Therapies Translational Sciences to develop and transfer assays to characterize immune responses in future clinical trials
Oversight and accountability of partnerships with third parties, academic or biotech partners
Evaluate external science and partnering opportunities with business development and extended scientific team to extend bacterial vaccine pipeline
Interact regularly with intellectual property attorneys to define IP strategy for early programs
Create and foster effective relationships with senior leaders in Research, Biochemistry, Bioinformatics, in Research, Clinical and Translational Medicine and Global Project Teams to ensure alignment across functions
Responsible for ensuring all projects within their area and their teams clearly and objectively communicate results, as well as their associated risks, uncertainties and limitations
Define the training standards for junior colleagues in line with best practices and principles

Minimum Requirements

PhD degree in microbiology, immunology, molecular biology, biochemistry or a related discipline with 8+ yrs industry experience
Proven experience leading and managing team of junior scientists (PhD and non-PhD)
Track record studying bacterial vaccines and / or bacterial pathogenesis
Experience leading efforts to characterize immune response and protective activity of vaccine antigens in small animal disease models
Familiarity with functional assays to measure effective immune response (e.g. opsonophagocytic killing assays, serum bactericidal assays)
Experience working in a cross-functional team to successfully deliver research and development programs in a biotech or pharma setting
Experience supporting or leading interdisciplinary vaccine discovery or development programs
Proven experience developing and controlling budgets
Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills

Desirable Requirements

Experience working with and leading scientists across disciplines
Familiarity with bacterial carbohydrate conjugate vaccines
Proven track record of publishing relevant results and tools in peer-reviewed journals, conferences, and other scientific proceedings.
Experience in novel methods development and application
Experience in a complex global organization

Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognizing their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organization to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we’re opening new ways to work, pioneering groundbreaking methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey.

So, what’s next!

Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours.

Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/

Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

Description: NSI requires a Journeyman Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Analyst to support PMA 299 Program Office. The Journeyman FMS Analyst along with other members of the Security Cooperation team, and under direction of the Case Manager/Program Manager/Team Lead, assisting the Case Manager in analyzing and managing all aspects of FMS casework in accordance with the Arms Export Control Act, the Security Assistance Management Manual (SAMM) and the International Traffic in Arms Regulation (ITAR) as well as applicable DoD Acquisition policy guidance. We are seeking a talented and experienced business solution architect with a strong background in Supply Chain. This strategic role is responsible for designing business solutions with technology and process analysis to enable Supply Chain digital transformation. This role involves understanding business processes and technology solutions, creating an architectural blueprint, and designing solutions that supports our company's business needs and goals.

As a business architect, you will take a leadership role in the strategy and development of the required business architecture and solution. Some of the critical deliverables will include business capability models, business capabilities, and value stream mapping. You will work in conjunction with product managers and technical architects to oversee and strategize business capabilities.

The Lead, Business Solutions Architect will report to the Senior Director, Digital Strategy and Planning.

Key Areas of Responsibility

Product Discovery and Solution: Develop business architecture and solutions by analyzing current technologies and process gaps. Understand market dynamics, customer needs, and industry trends to define the best solution.
Perform gap analyses through current and future state process analysis and technology capabilities.
Develop current and future business architecture frameworks
Develop current and future multi-level business capabilities map
Develop process maps that include current and future state end-to-end flows
Collaborate with stakeholders and IT teams to ensure the proposed solution meets business needs and address capability gaps.
Evaluate and recommend technologies that will best align with the required solution.

Product Roadmap and Outcome: Define solutions and support Digital Product Managers to breakdown high level roadmaps into implementable initiatives based on business priorities.
Build the business architecture including identifying high level business capabilities, processes and system applications needs
Provide architectural guidance and oversight to ensure that systems are scalable, reliable, secure, and achieve business objectives
Support Digital Product Managers to build business cases and ROI calculations.

Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with key stakeholders across the organization to communicate business capabilities and architecture solutions. Gather input, provide updates, manage expectations, and communicate architecture vision.
Help the organization shape strategy, conduct discovery, make investment decisions, and guide execution leveraging business architecture best practices

Education and Experience Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a related field
8 – 10 years of business solution architect experience or related field
Ability to understand sophisticated business problems and identify and interpret business needs.
Advanced understanding of business analysis techniques and processes
Expert understanding of IT applications
Experience in application design architecture and knowledge of best practices in this area
Ability to understand and analyze business needs and translate them into system requirements.
Proven experience as a solution architect with supply chain technologies and tools.
Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Analytical mindset with the ability to make data-driven decisions
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Proven facilitation and influencing skills to drive decision making among stakeholders with diverse perspectives and priorities.
Ability to manage competing priorities and demonstrate adaptability in meeting prioritized deadlines
Experience using software design support tools and productivity suites such as Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Office, and Lucid Charts

Additional Preferred Qualifications

Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and principles.

Kinaxis planning technology or similar technology experienc

Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.

Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented Current Operations Support Analyst (WF) to join our team at Fort Meade, MD.

This is a watch floor role. 24x7/365 static shifts.

Position Summary

This position will support the DISA GSM-O II Task Number 07 (TN07) Joint Force Headquarters DODIN. GSM-O II provides network operations and cyber defense support to the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) in support of the DoD and COCOMs. The selected candidate shall provide a stabilizing force to the high intensity, high tempo operations center. In depth technical knowledge, leadership, and analytic skills address senior command requirements, subordinate command information requirements, as well as supplements operations during a time of need.

Primary Responsibilities

Stay abreast of operational directives and developments across the enterprise to ensure command leadership maintains situational awareness.
Provide daily operational updates on all concurrent and pending operations and activities
Inform and address CC/S/A/FA headquarter communication and information requirements
Coordinate and assess network defense operations with DoD CC/S/A/FA and monitor and report effect of DCO-IDM operations on CC/S/A/FA missions
Provide surge support for current operations, to include, but not limited to, Crisis Action Teams, JFHQ-DODIN COOP events and Operation Planning Teams
Manage, coordinate, and support the transition of future operations (FuOPS) to current Operations (CuOPS)
Document and determine criteria for sufficient acquisition of mission; Identify required operational and technical data and information to ensure successful operation transition and execution.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical discipline and 8 - 12 years of prior relevant experience or master’s degree with 6 – 10 years of prior relevant experience.
Currently possess an active DoD TS/SCI clearance and eligible for C/I Polygraph.
Currently possess DoD 8750 certification at IAT level II, Security +ce.
Experience at Joint Command and/or Operations Center.
In-depth understanding of military orders and the military decision-making process.
Knowledge of and a proficiency in using Computer and Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook)
Knowledge of policy development and maintenance
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to speak clearly and effectively with customers and technical personnel in high-stress situations
A solid understanding of IP addressing and subnetting
Understanding of key network monitoring protocols
Proficient in Microsoft Office 365 Suite
Knowledge of Microsoft server operating systems, VMWare and Cisco network devices

Preferred Qualifications

ITIL V3
Experience with DISA and DoD Networks.
Demonstrated experience briefing Senior Executive Service (SES) and General Officer/Flag Officer (GO/FO) leadership.

Security Clearance Requirements:

Must possess an active DoD TS/SCI clearance and eligible for C/I Polygraph.

The person in this position will constantly operate a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a copy machine and computer printer.
The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management and customers which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange effective and accurate information in these situations.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.

KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst to join our Global Information Technology Group which is part of KPMG International.

Responsibilities:

Be accountable for managing daily security operations which focus on key business platforms ensuring integrity of changes which impact information security and control management
Collaborate with various Information Technology Services (ITS) Global teams on different security operations related tasks, analyze cloud compliance/vulnerability reports, technical review of exception request; help and guide junior team members to manage the service request queue (ServiceNow)

Build a deep understanding of current environments, researching, and advising on IT infrastructure
Assist the Security Operations Group (SOG) Manager with daily management of core security operations process

Date: Oct 28, 2023

Location: Annapolis Junction, MD, Maryland, United States

Requisition Number: 15381

Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt

Hours Per Week: 40.00

Level of Experience: Mid

Job Description

Mission Technologies a division of HII - Cyber Electronic Warfare and Space (CEWS) provides full-spectrum cyber, EW and space capabilities that address today’s rapidly changing, multi-domain global security threats, and anticipate emerging threats.




Our cyber professionals are on the cutting edge of cyberspace operations, delivering cyberspace options and effects for our nation in an ever-changing threat environment. Our experts provide a full range of expertise and capabilities across the spectrum of cyberspace operations. We are an integral part of an important mission - we go to work every day with the knowledge and pride that our accomplishments make a difference.





Cyber Electronic Warfare and Space team is currently seeking a Cyberspace Operations Analyst I in support of an exciting new effort supporting one of our clients that is responsible for unifying the direction of cyberspace operations, strengthening DoD cyberspace capabilities, and integrating and bolstering DoD's cyber expertise.

Minimum Qualifications

High school diploma or equivalent and three (3) years of relevant experience.

Must possess an active TS/SCI/Polygraph for consideration

Preferred Requirements

Experience to include but not limited to:

Performing cyberspace analysis and incident analysis.
Collaborating with federal cyber centers to determine root causes and provide perspective on a cyberspace situation, incident, or event.
Contributing to the development of cyberspace situational awareness products.
Possessing a general understanding of cyberspace analytic basic concepts to monitor, assess, and report on cyberspace operations, capabilities, and vulnerabilities.
Contributing to the development of analytic approaches and recommendations to problems and situations for which data is incomplete, controversial, or which no precedence exists.

This opportunity resides with Cyber & Electronic Warfare, a business group within HII’s Mission Technologies division. HII works within our nation’s intelligence and cyber operations communities to defend our interests in cyberspace. Our deep expertise in network architecture, software and hardware development, cybersecurity and the electromagnetic environment uniquely enables us to support sensitive missions for federal agency partners.




HII is a global engineering and defense technologies provider. With a 135-year history of trusted partnerships in advancing U.S. national security, HII delivers critical capabilities ranging from the most powerful and survivable naval ships ever built, to unmanned systems, ISR and AI/ML analytics. HII leads the industry in mission-driven solutions that support and enable a networked, all-domain force. Headquartered in Virginia, HII’s skilled workforce is 44,000 strong. For more information, please visit: hii.com.




HII is committed to cultivating an inclusive company culture to promote collaboration and enhance creativity by hiring a diverse work force. HII is an Equal Opportunity/Vets and Disabled Employer. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions.

Job Title: Program Analyst (PMA 207 C-130T, KC-130 and VR/OSA)
Job Description:
Precise Systems is a professional services company supporting U.S. Department of Defense programs. Our core capabilities include Digital Transformation, Advanced Engineering, Acquisition & Lifecycle Support, Information Technology, and Technical Solutions. Precise was founded in 1990, and since our establishment, we have provided cutting-edge solutions and support to our warfighters. At Precise, we understand and provide expert consultation on network and weapons systems acquisition, maintenance/modernization, and sustainment programs. For over 30 years, Precise Systems has demonstrated and perfected our ability to manage any task, no matter how difficult or complex.

We are seeking a Program Analyst to support our PMA 207 Patuxent River, MD, customer.

Duties of the position include the following:

Functional Description: Applies analytic techniques in the evaluation of program/project objectives. Analyzes requirements, status, budget and schedules. Performs management, technical, or business case analyses. Collects, completes, organizes and interprets data relating to aircraft/weapon/project acquisition and product programs. Tracks program/project status and schedules. Develops program acquisition documentation such as PIDs, SOWs, and CDRLs. Provides updates to NAVAIR AMS Tools (CDRLs, PMT, and CSPT) and advises Government on status of financial and procurement actions. Applies government-instituted processes for documentation, change control management and data management. Tracks program/project status and schedules, configuration management, data deliverables, and Data Management activities. Applies SECNAV, OPNAV, and OSD policy and documentation to support programs/project through PPBS and life-cycle management of military acquisition programs (as specified in the DoD 5000 series). Processes program acquisition, funding and contract documentation for military programs.

Required Education: Journeyman - BA/BS degree.

Substitution Language:

1. Associate’s Degree plus two (2) years additional work experience performing duties described in the functional description of the labor category may be substituted for a Bachelor’s Degree.
OR
2. Four (4) years additional work experience performing duties described in the functional description of the labor category may be substituted for a Bachelor’s Degree.

Required Experience: Journeyman - 3 to 10 years of experience performing duties described in the functional description.

Desired Experience:

At least four years of experience in program management, technical or business analysis discipline; and at least two years professional experience in NAVAIR AMS Suite of Tools (CDRLs, PMT, and CSPT), technical efforts supporting major weapon systems and components development. Experience providing critical program management support for major DoD acquisition systems with multiple appropriations and multiple type/model/series aircrafts and/or systems.

Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance. Due to the sensitivity of customer-related requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required.

Precise Systems, Inc. is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Precise Systems, Inc. participates in E-Verify. Precise Systems, Inc. encourages and supports workplace diversity.

There is a place for you at T. Rowe Price to grow, contribute, learn, and make a difference. We are a premier asset manager focused on delivering global investment management excellence and retirement services that investors can rely on today and in the future. The work we do matters. We invite you to explore the opportunity to join us and grow your career with us.
ROLE SUMMARY
Senior Project Managers (sPM) are accountable for successful execution of one or more projects of moderate to high complexity. This involves managing change projects across functional areas that support the Distribution organization, working closely with senior leaders in Distribution, Marketing, Client Servicing and Reporting, Investment Operations and Technology.
The sPM will support components of the overall program portfolio focusing on growth initiatives across APAC (specially Japan)/EMEA. The sPM would be expected to work closely with Japan hence should be flexible with time zones. The sPM is expected to support Program Managers across initiatives on project management processes, best practices, effectively facilitate leaders and cross-functional teams to make decisions, achieve program objectives, manage risks, issues and internal/external dependencies.
The sPM will support the program and associated projects/work streams as needed and oversee the execution of work through the entire project management lifecycle (initiation, planning, execution, and closeout) per the processes established by the T. Rowe Price Transformation Office (TO) and industry best practices.
Successful candidate will have great leadership, organizational, business analysis and influence management skills. Qualified candidates will have experience applying project management processes in a thoughtful way to achieve the best business result. Candidates must have proven experience managing moderate to high complexity projects in the financial industry; have worked closely with multiple business partners to achieve results; and be willing to perform “hands-on” program/project management.
The successful candidate is expected to work for Global Growth Strategy for T Rowe Price's focus markets across APAC and EMEA. The candidate is expected to have prior experience in working with middle office/Operations in the asset management/banking industry. This experience would be used to drive projects aligned to program for Global Operations.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the day-to-day project management and delivery by working closely with the projects’ operating sponsors according to established project methodology and standards
Develop the project charter, integrated project plan, resource plan, contingency plan, and related project management artifacts.
Partner with business sponsors to define success metrics and criteria.
Responsible for establishing/running the weekly project working group, adhering to the established project governance, and maintaining all project documentation including charter, RAID log, detailed project plan and ensuring all deliverables are signed off as required by the working group.
Facilitate all operational checkpoint activities throughout the lifecycle of projects.
Conduct analysis meetings with the agreed stakeholders to document requirements, workflows, policies, and procedures.
Assess and resolve all high priority project risks as they are encountered, escalating as required.
Continually update relevant business stakeholders of project status and periodically publish project status reports.
Ensure all projects meet success parameters and business objectives stated in the business case / charter.
Experience
Required:
Bachelor’s degree in related field
8+ years strong project management experience
Preferred:
project management certification (PMP, Prince II etc)
Asset Management industry experience, particularly across Distribution, Client Servicing, Client Onboarding, Client Reporting and Technology across international locations.
Problem solving skills and being able to work with people across multiple locations.
Facilitation of meetings with stakeholders to review and solve key issues.
Well organized and self-motivated.
Prior work experience on projects related to Japan
Technical skills – Microsoft office including Visio, PowerPoint.
Very good presentation skills particularly to management.
Demonstrated ability to motivate people and navigate a complex global working environment.
Demonstrated ability to apply excellent Communication and Interpersonal skills to manage a diverse set of stakeholders and leaders.
Strong negotiation and influencing skills.
Demonstrated high level of analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to present concepts to individuals and large groups.
FINRA Requirements
FINRA licenses are required and will be supported for this role.
Work Flexibility
This role is eligible for remote work up to two days a week.
Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
We strive for equity, equality, and opportunity for all associates. When we embrace the power of diversity and create an environment where people can bring their authentic and best selves to work, our firm is stronger, and we create greater value for our clients. Our commitment and inclusive programming aim to lift the experience for each associate and builds allies for our global associate community. We know that a sense of belonging is key not only to your success at the firm, but also to your ability to bring your best each day.
Benefits: We invest in our people through a wide range of programs and benefits, including:
Competitive pay and bonuses as well as a generous retirement plan and employee stock purchase plan with matching contributions
Flexible and remote work opportunities
Health care benefits (medical, dental, vision)
Tuition assistance
Wellness programs (fitness reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program)

Job Title: Cyberspace Operations Coordination and Deconfliction Analyst
Job Description:
Job ID: 2314538

Location: FORT MEADE, MD, US

Date Posted: 2023-10-23

Category: Cyber

Subcategory: Cybersecurity Ops

Schedule: Full-time

Shift: Evening Job

Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

Minimum Clearance Required: TS/SCI with Poly

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: None

Potential for Remote Work: No


Description

SAIC is seeking a Coordination and Deconfliction Analyst located out of Fort Meade, MD. This position directly supports the USCYBERCOM Joint Operations Center (JOC) and is a member of the JOC Fires Support Cell. The Coordination and Deconfliction (C&D) analyst operates in a dynamic, 24/7 environment, and interacts daily with other JOC functional cells, the battle watch leadership, and USYCBERCOM components. The C&D watch stander supports the Joint Operations Center (JOC) with technical deconfliction of specific requirements related to cyberspace operations. The C&D watch stander offers a central deconfliction point for the synchronization of inter and intra-Departmental activities in the cyberspace domain.

Available Shifts: Shift 3: Tues-Fri 2300 – 0900 / Shift 2W: Sat-Tues 1400 – 0000 / Shift 3W: Sat-Tues 2300 – 0900 Responsibilities include (but not limited to):

Perform technical deconfliction between USCYBERCOM, its components, US government partners, and allies in support of routine cyberspace operations, operational deconfliction, and public disclosure requests;
Consolidate input from USCYBERCOM components and integrated planning elements to develop a weekly cyberspace operations placemat used by senior USCYBERCOM, Joint Staff, and Defense of Department leaders;
Support C&D activities for cyberspace operations including exercises, global contingencies, and other emerging requirements;
Review all malware disclosure and information release requests and coordinate with the USCYBERCOM J39 and Public Affairs Officer for action;
Evaluate all deconfliction packages in IKE and take appropriate follow-on action;
Act as a JOC trusted agent for DOD Cyber Red Team (DCRT) activities and notify the JOC Director of DCRT actions when required but in accordance with the trusted agent nondisclosure agreement.



Deliverables include (as required):

J3 Morning Update Brief (virtual dial-in via Skype);
Briefing slides for the Commander’s Weekly Update (as requested);
Weekly operations placemat;
Quarterly summary placement;
C&D deep dive product when directed.

Qualifications

Requirements:

Education – High School Diploma or equivalent
Minimum of five (5) years of experience providing support to a cyberspace center to include:

o Collaborating or working with other centers on fleshing out the perspective on a situation, incident, or event

o Drafting reports on cyber events, incidents, and documenting situations

o Contributing to the development of cyberspace situational awareness products and cyberspace analysis duties with minimal guidance

o Possessing a general understanding of intelligence analytic base concepts to monitor, assess, and report on cyberspace operations, capabilities, and vulnerabilities

o Contributing to the development of analytic approaches and recommendations to problems and situations for which data are incomplete, controversial, or which no precedence exists

Clearance Requirement:

TS/SCI CI Poly




Covid Policy: SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.

The Prospective Group (TPG) is seeking a Security Specialist Lead to support the Defense Counterintelligence and Security Agency (DCSA). This Industrial Security Oversight Specialist (ISOS) position supports DCSA’s risk-based industrial security oversight mission by providing impactful pre-Security Review research and analysis relevant to the National Industrial Security Program (NISP). Research sources vary, but are primarily limited to commercial and government databases, controlled unclassified information (CUI), and publicly available information (PAI). Currently, due to COVID-19 mitigation efforts initiated by DCSA, a hybrid work arrangement of telework and on-site support temporarily exists.
Position Responsibilities:
Lead a team of Security Specialists
Producing impactful research and analysis of potential risks to cleared defense contractors (CDC) and Department of Defense (DoD) programs.
Identifying and reporting potential vulnerabilities associated with the CDC.
Identifying and reporting possible OPSEC or other security issues associated with the CDC.
Identifying and reporting possible violations of 32 Code of Federal Regulation (CFR) National Industrial Security Program Operating Manual (NISPOM) Part 117 requirements.
Authoring professional work products and meeting established deadlines.
Working in a collaborative on-site work environment at DCSA or independently through customer approved telework.
Provide security oversight as the primary DoD security interface for cleared contractor facilities relative to the establishment and maintenance of a security program in compliance with the NISP.
Responsible for handling more difficult, complex, and challenging industrial security issues within the NAESOC area of responsibility.
Identify and conduct administrative inquiries of serious security violations.
The ability to set well-defined and realistic personal goals and display a high level of initiative, effort, and commitment towards completing assignments in a timely manner.
Facilitate integration of the counterintelligence (CI) methodology into administration of the NISP and provides CI information and guidance to internal and external stakeholders.
Position Requirements:
Bachelor's degree.
Experience leading a team
At least three (3) years' experience working with the National Industrial Security System (NISS), and the Defense Information System for Security - Joint Verification System (DISS-JVS)
National Industrial Security Program Operating Manual (NISPOM) experience
Industrial Security Experience
At least three (3) years' experience in program management support.
Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
Knowledge of the principles of OPSEC and OSINT.
Familiarity with new CUI guidance and directives.
Ability to understand and apply the principles of research to analyze, evaluate, and interpret raw data collected from multiple sources.
Preferred Qualifications:
At least five (5) years' relevant experience in business analysis, intelligence, counterintelligence, or industrial security.
Familiarity with the NISP and 32 CFR NISPOM 117 requirements.
Comprehensive knowledge of Microsoft Office software packages.
Specialize experience for this position includes conducting inspections, surveys and investigations of government and non-governmental facilities and personnel in order to determine protection of sensitive materials and information and compliance with laws and regulations.
Conflict Management: anticipates and takes steps to prevent counterproductive confrontations. Manages and resolves conflict and disagreements in a constructive manner.
The Prospective Group (TPG) is an IT management consulting company providing services internationally to government and commercial entities. Being Prospective - leaning forward with action - defines the TPG culture.
Our focus areas include but are not limited to program/project management, cloud computing, software development, cybersecurity, data science/analytics, and diplomatic business support.
TPG is a women-owned small business (WOSB), appraised at CMMI Level 3 with excellent performance credentials.
The Prospective Group is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Job Title: Data Analyst & Project Manager, Operations Officer II - Department of General Services
Job Description:
OPENING DATE: 11/16/23
CLOSING DATE: 12/2/23
SALARY $72,624 - $116,198
EDUCATION ACCREDITATION: Applicant’s education must be obtained from an accredited institution. Education credentials obtained out of the US must be evaluated for US equivalency. Evaluation agencies information may be obtained at www.naces.org.
ELIGIBILITY: Qualified candidates will be considered for vacancies as they arise, for a period of at least six months. The decision of the Director of Human Resources with respect to acceptable minimum qualifications is final.
CRIMINAL BACKGROUND CHECK: Eligible candidates under final consideration for appointment to this position identified as positions of trust will be required to authorize the release of and successfully complete a Fingerprint check.
PROBATION: All persons, including current City employees, selected from this position will be on probation for 6 months.
CLASS DESCRIPTION
Positions in the Operations Officer series contribute to the effective management of an organizational unit, e.g., section, division, or agency by supervising and/or managing staff, problem solving as an individual contributor, or project managing.
Positions in the Operations Officer series are differentiated based on the following factors: analytics, budget, communications, environmental factors, functional responsibilities, minimum qualifications, policy, relationship building, supervision given, and supervision received.
SELECTION PROCESS
All candidates indicating the minimum qualifications on their application will be placed on the eligible list without further examination. The license, training, and experience of each candidate will be evaluated for appropriateness and quantity. It is essential, therefore, that you give complete and accurate information on your application. Vagueness or omission may prevent you from being considered for the position. Qualified candidates will not be listed in rank order.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATION
On or before the date of filing the application, each candidate must:
EDUCATION: Have a bachelor’s degree in business administration, Public Administration, Management, or related field from an accredited college or university

AND

EXPERIENCE: Have 4 years of experience in professional-level administrative, operations, or technical work.

OR
NOTE(EQUIVALENCIES): Have an equivalent combination of education and experience.
LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS AND CERTIFICATES: Have a valid Maryland Class C Noncommercial driver's license or an equivalent driver's license and eligible to obtain a Baltimore City driver’s permit may be required.
KNOWLEDGES, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Knowledge of the principles and practices of public and business administration and management, including the process of planning, organizing, staffing, directing and controlling.
Knowledge of methods and procedures for the collection or organization, interpretation and presentation of information.
Knowledge of the basic principles of accounting, budgeting, fiscal controls and statistics.
Knowledge of management practices and methods.
Ability to adapt and apply the concepts and techniques of administrative analysis to the needs of specific projects.
Ability to identify problem areas and recommend appropriate solutions based on logical consideration of alternatives.
Ability to interpret and apply a variety of laws, rules, regulations, standards and procedures.
Ability to prepare and present reports or recommendations clearly and concisely.
Ability to compile financial and operational data and to analyze charts and reports and statistical and budgetary statements.
Ability to coordinate the activities of various organizational units.
Ability to plan, organize and direct the work of others.
Ability to research and write complex narrative and statistical reports.
Ability to speak and testify effectively before governmental and legal bodies and commissions, the media and community and business groups.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with city officials, community and business groups.
EXAMINATION PROCESS
Applicants must provide sufficient information on their application to show that they meet the qualifications for this recruitment. Successful applicants will be placed on the employment certified eligible list for at least six months.

The examination will consist of a rating of your education, training, and experience as presented on your application and as they relate to the requirements of the position. You may be required to complete supplemental questions to further examine specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities of the position. Therefore, it is important that you provide complete and accurate information on your application.


NOTE: Those eligible, who are under final consideration for appointment, will be required to authorize the release of criminal conviction information.
If you have questions regarding this position, please contact Ayomide Arodoye, Recruitment and Talent Acquisition Specialist via email at
Ayomide.Arodoye@baltimorecity.gov
Financial Disclosure:
This position is required to complete a Financial Disclosure pursuant to Sections 7-7, 7-8, and 7-9 of the City Ethics Law.

LOCATION: Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD

STATUS: Contingent, Actively interviewing

TRAVEL: Up to 75% (CONUS / OCONUS)

CLEARANCE: Secret

BENEFITS: 401K, Life/Health/ Dental/Disability Insurance, Flexible Paid Leave, Student Debt Relief Program and Tuition Reimbursement

DESCRIPTION: MSK TriTech Group, LLC (MSK), a wholly owned subsidiary of Patricio Enterprises is looking to fill an Operations (Military) Analyst, Lead position in support of the Army Aerostats program.

Primary duties will include (but not limited to):

Advise on the effect of intelligence surveillance reconnaissance (ISR) systems on aerostats.
Advise on operational procedures and reporting tools.
Analyze operational data to identify and assist in resolving operations related and mission-critical issues affecting Warfighter support, and assist leadership with refinement of aerostat operational procedures.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

Ability to research, analyze, and evaluate information.
Ability to express ideas effectively orally and in writing.
Ability to work with large amounts of data.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office.

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree (desired).
5 years (required), 10 years (desired), of experience supporting military operations.
3 years (required), 5 years (desired), of operations with any aerostat larger than 20 meters in length.
Expertise with flight requirements for aerostats, including knowledge of flight certifications and flight parameters.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This is field and sedentary work which requires the following physical activities: extended travel, work at system sites deployed globally, reaching, sifting, lifting, finger dexterity, grasping, feeling, repetitive motions, talking, hearing and visual acuity. Themis Insight solves difficult business, IT, and analytic problems by addressing the whole problem – not just the symptoms – using interdisciplinary approaches that are both practical and innovative. We provide fresh alternatives to ordinary, mainstream consulting firms through small, highly skilled, and hand-picked teams that can meet clients' needs in any industry. Our broad interdisciplinary understanding allows us to provide the right solution, even if it is from outside the industry or traditionally defined problem space. We bring Public and Private, Civilian and Military expertise to every case.

We are hiring a Sr. Operations Requirements Analyst to work in Fort Meade, MD. Position location is subject to change based on central MD client's needs.

Required: TS/SCI with a Polygraph

This is a full-time position requiring 1880 hours of support per year; and work is performed at a customer location. As an Operations Requirements Analyst on our team, you will provide technical direction in national and tactical cryptologic capabilities, and facilitate requirements gathering by coordinating technical exchange meetings (and other meetings as needed) with the Services, Combat Support Agencies (CSAs), systems engineers, data modelers, and other members of the requirements team. You will also provide comprehensive definition and documentation updates for deliverables and coordinate with analysts, managers, and seniors within Unified Cryptologic System (UCS) to verify operational requirements to assist a customer that advocates and facilitates interoperability, commonality, modernization, and integration with the US SIGINT System.

Individual Capabilities/Experience Required:

Ten (10) years' experience in Operations Requirements on programs and contracts of similar scope, type and complexity is required of which five (5) years shall be in the Intelligence Community (IC).
Bachelor's degree in engineering or a related field (e.g., systems engineering, mathematics, information technology, operations research). A High School diploma and fourteen (14) years' experience would also be acceptable.
Must have a thorough understanding of US Armed Forces tactical SIGINT operations, military capabilities, and SIGINT concepts of operation.
Must have US Air Force SIGINT experience.
Position requires occasional travel.
Position requires TS/SCI clearance with polygraph.

Individual Capabilities/Experience Desired:

Ability to communicate with Service Cryptologic Offices.
Familiarity with Technical SIGINT Operations.
Qualified candidates should have experience in the intelligence cycle, information operations, signals intelligence technical expertise, an understanding of the National signals collection system, and familiarity with the varying levels of tactical operations and analysis taking place within the military services.

About the Job:
About the Job:
Sandy Spring Bank is currently recruiting for a Senior Salesforce Administrator. The successful candidate will be responsible for the successful deployment, implementation and on-going system administration of Sandy Spring Bank’s Salesforce based Customer Relationship Management platform. Position will drive the direction, functionality, and support of Salesforce and related systems throughout the company. Must work collaboratively with other departments to evaluate and implement process changes and software solutions that support our business needs and allow us to best serve our clients. This position will be more strategic in nature, guiding implementation and configuration for Salesforce projects across the Consumer Banking Department.

MAJOR JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Lead in implementing, designing, planning, configuration and management of Salesforce projects across all business sales channels. Facilitates solutions for the needs of internal customers and provides solutions that answer their requirements. Effectively identify, prioritize and escalate issues as required.
Build and manage custom objects, layouts, complicated workflows, complex reports and personalized dashboards as required.
Work with business representatives and analysts to quickly understand requirements and to create innovative solutions using Salesforce. Identify and implement opportunities to improve system functionality. Develop strong relationships with user groups to encourage system and process adoption, ensure proper system use, and provide continuous feedback on improvements to the application and corresponding business processes.
Lead and manage small projects that require significant Salesforce configuration and expertise.
Maintain overall system configuration including workflow rules, validation rules, formula fields, escalation rules etc. Document system specifications and configurations. Manage security, users, roles groups and other setup options.
Ensure data integrity within the system. Create and execute test plans and scenarios. Troubleshoot issues noted during testing or reported by users.
Conduct research on best practices and industry trends. Monitor Salesforce release changes, and advise business partners on impact to production.
Install and configure Salesforce packages. Work with Salesforce regarding platform roadmaps to determine how to apply enhancements to SSB business challenges.
Provide Salesforce user training and documentation.
Required Skills:
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
Bachelor’s degree and Salesforce Administrator Certification preferred. Financial industry experience is desired; project management, business analysis, database, and cloud integration experience is also a plus.
Minimum of five years of experience with Salesforce.com administration/development preferred.
Experience with unit testing, deployment, documentation, and familiarity with common software development practices and methods.
Advanced problem solving skills are needed to find solutions to problems that are technically complex and require collection, interpretation, and analysis of data from diverse sources. Must be detail oriented with a proven process oriented mindset.
Strong Banking and Commercial Lending acumen preferred.
Ability to analyze requirements to define, design and build platform solutions to business problems.
Project management and/or team leader experience preferred.
Must have strong technology skills and understanding with the ability to work effectively with managers, users and technical staff and be pro-active in problem resolution.
Must be able to able to work flexible hours as needed and balance multiple complex projects in a fast paced environment both independently or as part of a team.
Strong written and oral communication skills to effectively present complex information and document procedures. May be required to present information to small groups.
Work involves exposure to highly confidential information requiring tact and discretion.
Work is under minimal supervision where the work requires independent judgment in the interpretation of existing policies and procedures and the selection of alternative procedures and work routines.

SPECIFIC PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Work requires reasonable mobility in and around the work area. Ability to use standard computer and phone systems is required


WORKING CONDITIONS:

Normal office environment where there is almost no discomfort due to temperature, dust, noise, or other disagreeable elements.

Work includes little or no potential exposure to hazardous conditions.

Must be able to travel to remote company and/or client locations.

CPower Energy is the leading, national DER monetization and virtual power plant provider, creating the Customer-Powered GridTM that will enable a flexible, clean and dependable energy future. With 6.3 GW of capacity at nearly 20,000 sites across the U.S., we unlock the full value of distributed energy resources to strengthen the grid when and where reliable, dispatchable resources are needed most. CPower is based in Baltimore, Maryland and is owned by LS Power, a development, investment, and operating company focused on the power and energy infrastructure sector.
We are looking for a Senior Operations Analyst to be a part of the enrollments, settlements and payments team who will be considered a subject matter expert in the market(s) they support. This individual should proactively identify and solve problems with little to no guidance. In addition, this role requires individuals to communicate effectively, at a high level, with all functional groups including executive management. Success in this role requires continual review and improvement of existing processes and procedures, particularly as the company implements new and upgraded support systems.
This is a remote position.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Enroll assets in ISO/Utility markets, settle and/or shadow-settle events and test events, and report on both asset- and portfolio-level compliance.
Manage the calculation and submission of customer payments.
Analyze portfolio trends and create actionable suggestions during each stage of Enrollment, Settlement, and Payment.
Provide leadership on system and process improvement initiatives.
Work closely with internal teams on all audit requests received from the ISO/Utility.
Lead reporting out of the relevant financial impact of market operations with the highest level of accuracy for both internal and external reporting.
Develop customized reporting for customers and assist in maintaining executive level market summaries as needed.
Help guide more junior teammates in day to day tasks, communications, and other projects.


Requirements
BS or BA degree in business related field such as Marketing, Finance, Management or Economics required. A Technical or Engineering degree may also be considered.
Advanced degree in a business-related field such as Master of Business Administration, Marketing, or Finance is preferred.
5-10 years work experience in Operations, Finance, or other related field.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal and external customers.
Excellent computer proficiency (Microsoft Office – Excel, Word, Access and Outlook, VBA and/or Python experience a strong plus).
Strong mathematical and analytical skills and the ability to apply these concepts to practical business situations.
Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines, while maintaining a positive attitude and providing exemplary customer service.
Excellent attention to detail.
Ability to work both independently and with other team members to accomplish assigned tasks.
Energy-related experience or education is preferred, but not required.
All applicants must be able to provide documentation that they are legally eligible to work in the United States for an extended period.
Benefits
Unique opportunity to work at a successful, growing company with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. We focus heavily on developing our employees and linking successes to our core values. CPower offers a great benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401K, vacation, up to $10,000 per calendar year in tuition reimbursement, etc. CPower’s leadership prides itself on maintaining a rewarding culture, and always striving to offer a great team-member experience.
CPower is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. We believe that diversity and inclusion among our team members is critical to our success as a company, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

Job Title: Army Operations Research and Systems Analyst (ORSA) - Principal Engineer
Job Description:
(ESI JA Backfill)

If your the best at what you do, come work at CommNet LLC. We need the best talent to solve hard problems. CommNet's greatest asset is our Employee's. As such we offer industry leading salary and benefits package. Advance your career by joining us in doing challenging work developing solutions to tough problems supporting the US Army soldier. CommNet LLC needs you!

We are seeking highly qualified Senior Army Operations Analyst candidates to serve as a subject matter expert in Army Operations. If you are ready for a fast paced, rewarding experiencing to improve the Army’s future capabilities, this job is for you. As an Operational Analyst on our team, you will principally support the Data Collection Analysis, Modeling and Simulation Branch (DCAMS), you will work closely with the C5ISR Center’s Strategic Engagement Office (SEO) and the Combined Joint Systems Integration Lab (CJSIL) at Aberdeen Proving Ground (APG) MD, to develop future technological capabilities for the Army. You will also be a “Trail Boss” leading and guiding Project Managers in field experimentation activities at the C5ISR Centers Ground Activity, Joint Base McGuire, Dix, Lakehurst (JBMDL) in New Jersey. The objective of your engagements is to help the Army field new, modernized, fully integrated network transport capabilities and computer systems to seamlessly integrate with Joint, Multinational Coalition and interagency partners conducting multinational operations. The right candidate will provide hands on, strategic guidance, and experimentation support and the ideal candidate may have technical expertise in one or more areas: Tactical and Joint C2 systems, Networking, Line of Sight (LOS) communications, Beyond Line of Sight (BLOS) communications, and joint communications systems. This position will require working in classified spaces.

May be eligible for some remote work depending on contract/client and hiring manager approval.

Responsibilities:

Lead the strategic planning, stakeholder and customer management, define technical and operational objectives, themes and learning demands.
Develop movement scenarios consisting of ground and aerial assets using OneSAF or an equivalent military program to support Live, Virtual, and Constructive experimentation.
Develop specialized scenarios to support discrete Modeling and Simulation (M&S) events.
Develop operationally realistic scenarios to support field experimentation.
Develop briefings and spreadsheets to assist in and brief to project leads customer leadership as required.
Serve as principal advisor in ensuring Army participation in Joint and Coalition equities accurately reflect current or future Army operational concepts and capabilities.
Assist as required in setup and integration during field testing before the day begins and during the day.
Provide operational advice and assistance as requested by project leads and customer leadership throughout the customer organization.
Assist in analyzing data collected during an experiment as required.
Develop experimentation test plans and work across diverse team skillets to document results of M&S, lab, and field experimentation.

Qualifications:

Retired Military Officer preferably Army, from Field Artillery, Military Intelligence, or Signal Branch with a working knowledge of combat, combat support, and combat service support operations.
Subject Matter Expert in Army maneuver operations from platoon to brigade capable of developing realistic movement scenarios to feed Modeling and Simulation (M&S) events.
Working knowledge of staff elements at Division, Corps, Theater Army, Joint and Combined levels.
Minimum of a Command and General Staff College experience at any of the military service schools; preferably attendance and graduation from the Army War College or equivalent program.
Demonstrated leadership skills in military or civilian organizations. Capable of planning, and executing simple to complex experiments in a field environment.
Able to work as Team member with good interpersonal communication skills and a strong work ethic.
Knowledge of OneSAF capabilities
Experience in disparate products integration for inclusion into coherent reports.
Working knowledge in one or more Army Mission Command system capabilities to include AFATDS, TAIS, MCS, TAIS, AMDWS, JBCP, ATAK, and associated message types and formats. Ideal candidate will be proficient in the use of any or all of these systems.
Experience in data analysis using data collected from test runs during experimentation producing meaningful and impactful data products for colleague teams and Senior Leadership. Data products produced include products that are related to performance metrics such as throughput, latency, packet completion rates, etc.
Flexibility and adaptability to perform other duties as assigned by the customer. Ideal candidate is a Jack of all Trades and not necessarily a master of none type.
Bachelor's or Master's degree Military Operations. Ideal candidate may also have a Electrical, Mechanical, Aerospace or Systems Engineering from an ABET accredited course of study.
US Citizen and must be able to obtain a Secret Security Clearance required. Ideal candidate has an existing Top Secret SCI Clearance already in place.

We take care of our employees who in turn take care of our customers, driving the success of our business. Job Title: Sr. Procurement and Materials Mgmt Data Analyst and Systems Specialist (Remote or Hybrid)
Job Description:
Title:

Sr. Procurement and Materials Mgmt Data Analyst and Systems Specialist (Remote or Hybrid)

KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space, and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, the Intelligence Community, NASA, and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity.

Our people make the world a more productive, efficient, and fascinating place. And that’s only the beginning!

Role Details:

Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using Power BI, Cognos, SQL, and other relevant tools.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for reporting and analytics solutions.
Design and create data models, data visualizations, and interactive dashboards that effectively communicate insights.
Design and architect multidimensional and tabular SSAS models based on business requirements.
Optimize query performance and data retrieval processes to ensure efficient reporting.
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues and report discrepancies.
Ensure data security and compliance with company policies and industry regulations.
Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in reporting and data visualization.
Provide training and support to end-users to maximize their utilization of reporting tools.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance data analytics capabilities and drive data-driven decision-making.
Apply and integrate statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling, and business analysis skills to manipulate complex high-volume data from a variety of sources.

Description

The Project Manager will support the Service Operations Service Management Office (SOSMO) providing an ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) based methodology for Change, Incident, and Problem/Performance Management. This work is in support of the GSM-O II TN13 contract at the DISA Joint Operations Center (DJOC).

Primary Responsibilities

The ITIL Subject Matter Expert (SME) will create and manage ITIL based frameworks and processes, which form the structure and functions of the Service Management Office (SMO).

A SMO consists of a group of functions within business or IT that is accountable for defining, maintaining, and managing standards for service management and service management processes in the organization.
The framework shall be constructed based on Agency requirements and will correspond to ITIL defined General, Service, and Technical management practices.

Some of the basic daily functions are:

Provide daily, weekly, and monthly program and performance trends & analysis for DJOC Operations. This reporting shall include information pertaining to:
Documented incidents
Problems
Known errors
Events
Changes
ASIs and releases & deployments
Collect, measure, and report on key performance indicators and critical success factors for both the SMO program and SMO functions to include at a minimum Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, Release & Deployment Management, Event Management, along with Capacity and Availability measures in support of Performance Management activities.
Ability to apply advanced technical principles, theories, and concepts.
Develops solutions to complex technical issues and problems that affect multiple area or disciplines.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical discipline and 8-12 years of overall related experience or Masters with 6-10 years of prior relevant experience. 4+ years of additional related years of experience is accepted in lieu of a degree.
Active TS/SCI security clearance.
ITIL V3 or V4 Foundations
Experience with MS Office products (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) working with large data sets
Good oral and written communication skills

Preferred Qualifications

ITIL Master or ITIL Strategist certification
Currently possess DoD 8750 certification at IAT level II, Security+ce.
Experience briefing Senior Leaders
